review: everyone acting like they re expecting an otherworldly gastronomic experience from a small shop selling street tacos in the wee hours when almost everything else is closed  and the emperors lights is no longer upon us  need to chillllll.  their mini street tacos hit the spot every time  and what you see is what you get. they may bot blow you away  but the tortillas are petty good  and that mest aint nothing to shake a stick at.   the nachos are a bit of a mess  but c est la vie - beggers cant be choosers when its 2am and you need 4th meal in order to not completely write off responsibilities the next morning.

In the top 5 of Austin taco joints.. I can t get enough. The thing I love is the flavor at Bomb Taco.. it all tastes good to the last bite. I am going to proclaim that the Hawaiian Taco on the menu is one of the best bites in the city.... Absolutely fantastic array of fresh flavor. The Hawaiian is packed with soy sauce marinated chicken  pineapple  lettuce  Pico  cheese..... omg.. take me back now. The flavor from this truck is awesome. It s been around a long time all over town and I am a buyer anytime I m in the area. Get Bombed

If you happen to be out and about and find yourself at the White Horse in the late night chances are you might be hungry. Luckily Bomb Tacos is right there on the patio to serve your drunken hunger needs. I got the pork tacos and cheese fries. It was messy  but it hit the spot after a night of drinking with friends. The cheese fries are pretty big and definitely something to share. I wouldn t seek out this place probably  but I would eat here again if I find myself at the White Horse hungry at 1am.

Best campechana in town.  This food truck is located on the grounds of the white horse bar.  The campechana is the only tacos I ve tried and I ll always continue to come back. It is perfectly spicy with a sweet spin  they put pineapple in their campechana .  I m not sure if the tortillas are homemade  but they were tasty- not my favorite  but not bad.  Now  I must write this with a caveat  the campechana is made differently by different cooks. Sometimes the tacos are good  not great and other times  it is cooked to perfection.  Anyways  I d recommend giving this place a try.

Uber eats order . We had arrived pretty late and this was one of the few places open. They messed up the order. We ended up with soggy tacos and not so great quesadillas instead. The green sauce was actually good and saving grace.

We got an airbnb near by and was craving for some food around 9PM and went to 6th street hoping there was some food we can grab around there. Most of the places were closing down at 10PM  so we went out to grab food kinda late. We were told from one of the restaurant that The White Horse had some food trucks that are open late which was this. We walked here and saw that the taco truck is gated in and connects with the bar.   Approaching the bouncer  he was very rude and not helpful at all. We ignored him and just had 2 people go in to get some tacos because that s what we came there for. We got a bunch of different types of tacos from pastor  bistec  beef fajitas to hawaiian. The hawaiian was delicious  They were  4 each and a large portion. I would definitely giving the hawaiian tacos a try. I give the tacos a 5 star and the service at The White Horse itself a 2  If I m ever in the area and craving for some food late at night  this will be my go to.

Uber Eats order  I got the Popeye quesadilla and literally couldn t eat it. It was soaking in oil  even the outside of the tortillas  and the mushrooms were extremely slimy and a horrible texture. If there was cheese in the quesadilla I couldn t tell because the mushrooms were so wet the tortilla was sliding off.  God awful.
Ordered birra tacos on Uber eats. The driver took forever to come so food was cold but those tacos were amazing cold and all

These are the best tacos you ll have in Austin... birria  pastor  chorizo  locos - everything is awesome - the BOMB  I m still kinda new to Austin and don t trust all food trucks  but I m so happy that I was put in to this one

The only thing  bomb  about this place is what s going to happen in your bathroom afterwards.  What did I just eat   I ordered Nachos but what I was served was some Philly Cheesesteakesqe slop smothered over soggy and stale chips.  Whoever put this place on their  Best Nachos In Austin  list was clearly on hour fourteen of a peyote-induced vision quest.  Avoid for your personal health and wellness...and probably others around you.

Ordered bomb tacos thru uber eats and it was a terrible waste of money by me  food by them  and then gas the uber driver spent to deliver this disgusting order.  This was the first time ordering from bomb tacos and certainly the last. The google reviews are true  I suggest filtering by most recent.  Read the reviews    The 3 crunchy tacos I ordered a la cart  were made with chili sauce and not real ground beef  seasoned.  The rest of our order was incorrect with beef not chicken chipotle quesadilla. It was greasy and incorrect.   The fries weren t cooked all the way from the fries and quesadilla order.  They are soggy and greasy and would be edible only after I cook them longer in the oven.  Complete waste  I would never recommend this place.

Bomb tacos is the most mf bomb tacos you ll ever have in your life most likely. If you want to eat something that will pull you from whatever deep dark pit that you reside in  then trust me and go to bomb tacos. I can personally testify that I was sad before I ate these and now I m not. Go to bomb tacos. You will be happy.
Bomb Tacos  I think I got a dud. Not very good product. Pastor had a weird flavor to it.  Quesadilla with cheddar cheese  Meh.  Gordita was good.

The first of Austin s hidden treasures I ever unearthed.  I ve erred in not putting up a review in a timely manner.  Bomb Taco is a little orangey-red taco truck parked in the back of the White Horse.  Tried their beef fajita and the  Carne Guisada  tacos and who knew...they were  the bomb .  Darned good flavor and texture.  Queso was a little watery.  Definitely worth a visit when you re taking a break from the tunes at the White Horse.  This place scores a 4 out of 5 on the  CTJ Scale   as noted below.  5 out of 5 stars  Come-to-Jesus good. Would be OK passing away after finishing a plate here. 4 out of 5 stars  Come-to-Mary good. Would be OK being seen eating here by Mother Mary. 3 out of 5 stars  Come-to-Joseph good. Would be OK having a beer here with Jesus  Dad. 2 out of 5 stars  Come-to-the-Apostles good. Meh. Wouldn t have my last supper here. 1 out of 5 stars  Come-to-Nobody good. I wouldn t have my penultimate supper here  either.

My whole trip visiting Austin  this has to be one of the best food stops that we ve made. Cheap  BIG  delicious  4 tacos  that serve until 1AM. The pastor tacos were great  my boyfriend really enjoyed his Hawaiian  and personally my favorite was his carne guisada taco. The green sauce is HOT  but it makes the flavor so much better and gives it a kick. Don t pass up on these tacos

Taco places in bars are there to keep body and soul together.  I had my tacos.  My body and soul are still together.         The tacos are tasty.  They have a huge menu  a small stand and a lot of customers.  This means a lot of things sell out - and that is just the new normal.   If you have a small truck and a lot of customers and you don t want to sell out - you only sell two or three items and you stock them deep.  If you have thirty items on the menu - you can t stock much of any one item and many will disappear as the night progresses.   But there really aren t any landmines on the menu.  If you have to have your second  fifth or twenty-third choice - no need for tears.  The food will be fine - regardless of what flavor you get.

It s a food truck in the back of the white horse bar and is honestly one of the best tacos I have had in Texas     I got a fish taco- ask for extra hot sauce- green sauce- SO GOOD          The guy was kind of slow to make the tacos but it was worth the wait. Bring cash

I always ordered tacos al pastor  they re always delicious HOWEVER...  No matter what  without fail  the 4 times I ve tried  I say no cilantro and guess what my tacos are covered in  Cilantro. I spend 10 minutes picking it out.
I do not recommend this place. I got my order completely wrong through the Uber eats app. Utensils and condiments were missing. Food was cold. Eat somewhere else

Uber Eats Order  The food arrived cold and soggy  almost inedible. We tried the nachos  queso  and tacos. The nachos were a mess of stale  soggy chips - we couldn t find a crispy one on the entire plate. The queso was cold and separated with little taste. The crispy tacos were complete mush. Everything lacked flavor and spiciness. I tried a bite of each and had a popsicle for dinner instead. I will not order from them again.

When you re tipsy and hungry and it s late there s nothing better than this hidden gem  a food truck on the patio at The White Horse.   Tacos are inexpensive  they re large and filling  and you get to watch  em be made. Couldn t have asked for better. I don t know that they re actually the best tacos in the world or anything  but the SO and I were so incredibly happy and pleased. They hit the spot  they were delicious  and the green sauce hot sauce that the chef recommended was on point. So  so good. Perfect for laying with whiskey on tap at the bar...

Tortillas...store-bought  amp  taste microwaved. ALL tacos tastes like bland beef fajita meat. Queso is very watered down and thin -- Good luck trying to scoop it on your chips  Fish tacos have a mild freezer-taste  all the spices in the world don t get rid of That Taste...Ehh  At one time I m sure they had Bomb Tacos...as of last night and a couple of times before  it s Official  this place Sucks  Sorry  but if you haven t been here yet  don t bother  in fact I recommend just about Anywhere Else in the area.  If you re drunk and don t care what you re eating  then go for it   It s conveniently located in the White Horse outdoor drinking area  so ya don t have to walk very far.  But keep in mind  you re paying as much as any other taco stand in the area and only receiving mediocrity...actually Less than Mediocrity.  But if you re drunk  then I guess it doesn t really matter  The tacos weren t bad  but I could make better tacos at home.

Hidden gem   However  depending on the taco that you get  it s a HIT OR MISS  The first time that I came here  I got the bistec taco. It was amazing  The meat was full of flavor. MUST GET THE GREEN HOT SAUCE   it s delicious  I also tried the fries with queso but wasn t a big fan so I drowned it with the green hot sauce which made it much better. The second time that I came  I tried the campechana taco which was disgusting. I would not recommend it.

This place gained one star only because this time I got to try the tacos I ordered. However it was quite bland when compared to other taco trucks around Austin. Once again  they ran out of a lot of food and it was probably only midnight - still 2 more hours of service left. My husband finally gave up trying to eat there.  There is also only one guy working there which really slows down business. He takes an order and immediately makes it. Instead  I think because there is only one guy  he should take a 2-3 orders at a time so he can make bulk amounts.

I ordered  30 worth of tacos via Uber eats.   My tacos arrived smothered in cheese  which I requested them without.   Uber eats wouldn t approve the refund  so I just wasted  30 on food I couldn t eat bc the restaurant was careless.

Uber Eats Order    Vegan. Specifically asked for no cheese on tacos  all came with cheese. Couldn t eat it  called several times with no answer.  Asked for no lettuce or pico for daughters taco. Came with lettuce and pico. She couldn t eat it.   Extremely disappointed as a first time customer.

Ordered the nachos and they were terrible. Chips were stale  not much cheese  and it didn t come with the ingredients listed on the menu  jalape os . Also ordered tacos on corn tortillas. If they don t have corn they didn t mention that. I can t eat flour so they went in the trash.  cornmeanscorn
The tacos were awesome. Not sure why they have so many bad reviews. Maybe bad Uber Eats drivers taking too long
everything was cold  fries were soggy and I asked for no onions and it came with tons of onions  super disappointed
Wow. So bad. Like I didn t know you could make nachos this poorly.  I wasn t expecting the best at 1am but dang this was bad. Ordered a beef taco too  meat was soggy and bland and super gross.

So quick review...  The tacos were super delicious  I got the bistec taco no onion and the Hawaiian no vegg. The Hawaiian was my favorite  So flavorful and the chicken and pineapple were grilled just right.  Now  the reason for the 2-stars...I waited for I don t know how long for the lil dude  who was by himself  in the trailer to first off even acknowledge my presence and secondly to take my order. Seriously  it was totally off-putting to be ignored...I seriously felt invisible and felt almost annoyed when the guy could be bothered to even take my order.  Everyone standing in line behind me said it is the MO and worth the wait  but I gotta confess  not a fan. I know there is an expected no-expectation of  service  but this one just floored me. I think I would have way better about the whole experience if the guy would have just took two seconds to say  be with you in a moment   but treating me like I wasn t there til he was ready to  deal with customers . The surprising part was  the tacos came out way faster than my order wait time   But  I guess he has a captive audience in the patio of the White Horse  where being able to get a tasty taco at 1am without having to walk more than 5 steps and can do as he pleases...if I come back I will have someone else do the awkward wait dance for me and compensate them w a taco.

I placed an order with Favor for 1 chicken taco and chicken quesadillas. I heard  the Bomb Tacos  have the best Salsa. The primary reason I ordered the food from them is for the salsa. I specifically mentioned I want extra salsa and guess what  I didn t even received one. on top of that they charged me extra  3 for the salsas. first they didnt give any salsa and they charged me extra for the extra salsa I requested which I didnt get. utter disappointment. I would give negative 5 rating if I could. the food is not cheese and chicken with no flavor. You have succeed in loosing one more customer.
Terrible. Got old meat in  50 worth of food that we ordered. I understand we are going through a recession....but don t try and kill people with old meat

Don t bother unless you really need some sustenance fuel an alcoholic binge. Tacos al pastor we re just weird. Plus they suspiciously overcharged us maybe thinking we were some drunk tourists. Try elsewhere for real Mexican

This was by far the worst tasting meal I have had during quarantine...if not ever. One bite and I could tell they were using old meat that had freezer burn. During this terrible time I have done my best to support local but stuff like this will scare people away. Please use quality ingredients so that you do not give other local restaurants a bad name.

I cannot tell you enough how much I hope and pray this taco stand is open by my house. They have a location off of William Cannon and OH MY GOD I can t even tell you how amazing they are. Yes they have a menu but they let you get whatever you want. And the chipotle sauce  AHHHHH  Hands down one of the best food trucks I have had since moving here. Everything is cooked to order and cooked with love. You re missing out if you ve never had it.

Hidden in the back of white horse  this place is a gem     Brought our drinks out from the bar and were surprised by this little guy taco truck.  We ordered the beef quesadilla  amp  nachos.  The quesadilla was gigantic  soo tasty   With the salsa verde it was fantastic.  We also ordered the nachos  they were ENORMOUS   Easily shared with 2-3 people.  Highly recommend coming here

The queso tasted like bleach  or some kind of cleaning solution. Perhaps they didn t properly rinse their pots after cleaning. Regardless  we took one bite and threw it all in the trash  food and money wasted . We couldn t even salvage any chips  since they pour the queso over the chips rather than putting it on the side.   BEWARE
Great tacos at a great price  Also easy to get delivered  Highly recommend but the quesadilla was just meh...

We waited 40 minutes for our food after ordering behind one other group. After seeing the people behind us get their food  we asked about the eta for our food and couldn t get an answer. Just two dudes in a trailer that didn t seem to care that much. Cash only.

Y all ready for this  So they re cash only even though they don t make that evident on their page. We ordered at 11 14. We asked for an update at 11 42.  It ll be 3 minutes . At 11 58 we asked for our money back. They handed it back like that was their job instead of making tacos.

I am convinced the people working here have only half a brain. This is the third time I ve given them a chance but never ever again. On Uber eats when selecting my tacos they have the option of  no cilantro  I picked it because I am allergic. I even put in the notes  NO CILANTRO PLEASE  and every time they cover my tacos In cilantro. I also ordered the gorditas which were pretty awful. So dry and so bland. Such a disappointment.
Tortillas were not homemade. Five mini tacos were cold. Queso was not that great and the quesadilla looked and tasted like a kid made it. Super disappointed

great portions   well priced   excellent flavor   nuffsaid  p.s. fyi  they re parked in the back of whitehorse bar. yelp s gotta implement something to show when one business is basically part of another
Tried to get tacos  but it was impossible to find the entrance from within white horse. The bouncer was rude and not helpful. Maybe making the restaurant accessible would help their rating

Being from NY  I m super picky about food. After a busy day at a conference I decided to order in and this place hit the spot. I ordered 4 different tacos and every single bite was amazing. The portions are very generous without sacrificing the quality of the food. Not sure why other reviewers say the food was  mediocre . I was completely satisfied.
This place is legit   The campechana is just like the ones in Mexico City. Honestly going to go here specifically for these tacos. Radically delicious

This is my first yelp review but I had to post because this food truck does not deserve to have customers. The attendant was so rude. My date and I were more than accommodating when we had a long wait before we were helped and were told to pay cash even though there was no  cash only  sign. When we said we had no cash  the attendant sighed and held his hand out for our card. We witnessed him tell the next customers the wrong price for their meal and sass other customers. Never have I been so disrespected as a restaurant patron.
Incredible late-night food. Plus  Juan is the nicest guy you ll ever meet. In my experience  the more interesting  imaginative things on their menu are definitely the way to go.

Order from this restaurant on Uber Eats and 99  of the time the order is incorrect.  The majority of the time they don t read or ignore the notes in all caps NO CHEESE. The last time the menu didn t say cheese would be added to anything. I am extremely allergic to cheese    I wish could give them a big fat 0

This is dog food.  Seriously  this the most horrible dining experience. Not only was the food absolute garbage  the chef blatantly lied to me citing they serve homemade authentic tortillas which were  of course  nonexistent.    It only took two bites to wrap my head around The fact this taco was most likely a biohazard.  I then had the pleasure of being physically grabbed by a hygienically unkempt bearded management man from White Horse who took no effort to try and make right the totally inedible and absurdly overpriced garbage served to me with some type of apology.  Then I went inside of the White Horse and experienced what seemed to be a nightmare of equal horror versus the food served to me. No refunds  no apologies  and downright unethical lies about the freshness of this food that belongs in the dumpster. Do yourself a favor and never eat there. Unless of course you like to eat feces.

Had the chipoltle chicken quesadillas and they were sooo delicious. Only thing that bothered me was that it seemed the guy had bad English  but they were sooo good that I was almost tempted to 5 star this place right off the bat.

I was watching the Sunday football game in the back patio of bar 96 and thought I would try a fish taco. Wasn t anything special in my opinion. The tortilla was cold and it wasn t really put together well.

Just when I thought Taco Joint had established the nadir of Austin Mexican Food  I grabbed two vile tacos at this abomination. As the White Horse slowly transitions to a Rainey Street crowd  it is only natural that the food would nosedive. The beans taste worse than canned Rosarita beans  the guy at the counter lied to my friend that the tortillas are homemade  the French fries with queso seemed to be from a frozen bag and drizzled with Rico s or velveeta. I would suggest that you disregard all reviews from anyone giving this four or five stars. These are the worst tacos I ve experienced in the U.S. Taco Bell is significantly better. The only positive is that they throw some things on a grill -- hardly impressive  but in this post-Torchy s universe  I guess anything beats nothing.

The BEST tacos in town  hands down. The options are endless  and the veggie options are awesome. I couldn t believe such simple sounding tacos could taste so beyond what I was expecting. And they have never disappointed me so far.   Look  I don t even like the bar that they are parked inside the fence of  White Horse  but I will go there and I will expect to eat their tacos. In fact  White Horse is probably my least favorite bar on the eastside  but I find myself asking   Me   Can we go to White Horse   Him   You just want to eat tacos.   Me   Damn right I do  Don t judge me    Just do yourself a favor and venture over to Bomb Tacos. There s no fake fancy frills about it  and I love that. Just doing what they do best  as simple as it sounds  TACOS and tacos on the cheap. The way tacos should always be.

Huge portions for a reasonable price. Unfortunately the food looks better than it tastes. I tried the pastor burrito and was expecting it to be great  the guy put a ton of pork in it with a bunch of other stuff. Didn t taste like anything though

With a name like  Bomb Tacos  I had set my expectations high.  What I got was an overcooked meat bistek taco. The tortilla and queso fresco were good  I ll give them that.  Then again  it was late  drunk people hour at the White Horse... Not exactly the place to expect a high quality taco truck. It did it s job  it was properly seasoned  and the salsa saved me from getting angry at the Paisa who made my taco.  I call these  Tacos for Hipsters who Just Don t Know .
David was serving us and he worked quickly  diligently  and kindly. He exhibited excellent customer service and we will definitely be back on our next trip to Austin.
This place is amazing. Fantastic food despite the crowd. No line  just great service. And the food  my god...

The BBQ chicken  breast meat  tacos is comprised of delicious ingredients packed into a  3 bargain  4 stars .  The tasty corn tortilla was full of quality chicken meat  shredded cheese and queso fresco  and topped with pico de gallo.  I also tried the beef and potato picadillo taco but it wasn t my favorite  3 stars .

These guys screwed me  took my money and never gave me my order  when I asked for it they recognized  gave me my order 10 people after me and when we asked for an extra quesadilla  they laughed at me and ignored us...disappointed. good foof  but customer service sucked

With so many trailers in town I m always happy to find a really good one--this is a really good one. Got the spinach and mushroom taco and the pulled pork taco  both excellent. My friend got the burrito  chicken --it was huge and also great. Add a Live Oak beer and a really good zydeco band inside and it doesn t get much better.

Dear Austin   I approve of your taco trucks  especially this one. It s parked outside the White Horse and holy. friggin. moly.  Their special Friday night  Shrimp and barbacoa taco plates  so naturally I asked for one of each kind. The barbacoa was good  but the fried shrimp was some of the best I ve ever had. They don t need even sauces because the filling is so good  but you should put all the sauces on them anyway. Wonderful. The plates came with rice and beans too and it was something like  8.  My two friends and I sat in silence until we had cleaned our plates. Not to say that we weren t a little distracted by the honky tonk  the crazy-busy bar and the couple making out directly in front of us... but we were pretty occupied with inhaling tacos.  Saludos  Annie
Grabbed tacos here.  Was drinking.  Don t exactly remember how it was... sorry.
The mushroom and potato tacos was deep fried potato cubes with an otherwise really good mushroom. Sauce was decent and the tortilla was flour  kind of tasteless. Overall not that great.

I understand this place is a new addition to the White Horse. I can t speak as to how new because it was my first visit  but  regardless  it is a welcome one    This little taco trailer rocks  I can t say we had anything bad here  We had the portobello taco  which was amazing  Great flavor and so juicy  Our party also ordered the pork and the al pastor. Everyone raved    The green sauce was not as spicy as Selene s but it had great flavor.   The tacos were  3 each and huge. Can t wait to go to the White Horse again just to eat another portobello taco. My mouth is watering just for writing this

What could be better than an ice cold beer at the legendary White Horse  Oh  I know  How about the best flipping taco of my life  I asked the guys in the taco truck what their favorite was and they said the Pastor. So I got it. And I cried a little. The fish taco was probably the best fish taco I ve ever eaten but the Pastor was so good I wanted to marry it. And did I mention it s cheap

I ve been frequenting Bomb Tacos for a few months now and have never EVER been disappointed. Service is friendly and quick. Tacos are cheap  delicious  and always served piping hot  and the menu is pretty diverse. I ve probably had upwards of a dozen different tacos off the menu and while some are better than others  i ve never been disappointed. Pulled pork and Chicken Breast are two of my favorites. Beyond the simple deliciousness of the tacos  the two sauces they serve with them should NOT be missed. Both are flavorful  spicy as hell  and an excellent accompaniment to any Bomb Taco. I m perplexed as to why the original Bomb Tacos outside of Lustre Pearl has such crappy ratings. I ve frequented both trucks more than I can to say and have never had anything but great experiences. I recommend Bomb Tacos to all my friends
They tried to charge me  119 for JUST an order of tacos and nachos   Check your receipts
This place is ok. Not awful but just too greasy for my liking. I tried a few of their items and nothing was stand out.

Going here was a frustrating experience. First off  the phone number listed for Bomb Tacos is the White Horse general number  which takes you to a long recording and then hangs up on you. So...I guess they don t take call-in orders  I drove there to order because my bandmate wanted late-night enchiladas and based on the online menu this looked like the only place that had them at the hour I was seeking them. When I got to the restaurant I noticed that their posted menu was QUITE different from the online menu. I asked about the enchiladas and the guy behind the counter said   Oh  no  sorry.  I think they may have gotten this question before. So I ordered chips and salsa  some tacos  and a quesadilla for my enchilada-craving friend  all to go. When the chips and salsa were ready I was surprised to see that the salsa was already drizzled all over the chips  which meant that they would be soggy by the time I got back to my bandmates. On the plus side  the salsa was tasty and the guy at the counter was nice. But...they ve still lost my business. Should have stuck with El Chilito

Next time I m hungry and at the White Horse  I ll move mountains to go elsewhere for food.  Yeah  the food is good but the guy who runs the truck by himself is a total jerk-off and has bitten off more than he can chew.  There are plenty of friendly food trucks in the East Austin bar area and I m going to give my business to them  going forward.  I get that it s tough to run a food truck  blah blah blah  but    A.  I think people need to acknowledge their customers when they re waiting in YOUR line to order YOUR food  even if you re too busy to take their order.   I ll be right with you  would have gone a long way  rather than no eye contact even though he walked back and forth past me to grab ingredients  call out order numbers  etc. for over 15 minutes.  I almost walked away several times.  I don t know why I didn t.  B.  When you finally DO get around to picking up your food  if there s an issue with your order  don t even bother addressing it with him.  Once he puts the food in your hands  he s done.  I ordered a quesadilla and he gave me a taco.  When I told him  this isn t a quesadilla   he firmly insisted  NO  NO  That s right  and turned his back to me and went back to work.  OK dude.  I give up.  You suck.    I know you re making lots of money  Mr. stressed-out-over-extended-crabby-pants-taco-man  so hire a helper for minimum wage and your business will run much smoother.  If your business runs smoother  I doubt you d have any negative reviews on Yelp  and VOILA - you re the next East Side King trailer  pre-Top Chef.  Are you too greedy and don t want to share tips or pay an extra hand   Do you not realize there is a problem   Please know that EVERYONE was complaining about you last night.  I hope you care about that  even though I know you re making plenty of bank conducting business as-is.  Siiiiiiiiiiigh.

One of the best Taco stands in Austin.  The guy knows what he s doing and the food comes out perfect everytime..  this places knows whats up.  the nachos are out of control  but really the best thing here is the shrimp tacos.... Everything I v had was great  but those shrimp tacos are out of this world... I ve never gotten ones as good as these since being in mexico.  this place is worth the stop..  Plus they are at the White Horse.. best bar in Austin....
Dare I say  this is my favorite taco truck in Austin. There  I said it. The veggie options are out of this world.
Soooo good. Got the bistec tacos and they were absolutely amazing  They reminded me of the tacos they sell back home

Best tacos and it s in the back of the white horse. We had the Nachos with beef  carne Asad taco  and veggie quesadilla. My boyfriend can t stop talking about the quesadilla and how it s the best he s ever had  Good tacos  nice people
You had better be drunk and desperate to eat here.  It s the east side.  You can find better food than this.

Ok nachos especially if you love onions. The nachos were the way I like them  too many toppings so you have to eat them with a fork. No complaints about the amount of toppings however with the amount of onions.. it was pretty much all I could taste. For the price  nine bucks  I should be able to taste a lot more cheese. It was okay however I will not return.

In the sea of Tex-Mex in Austin  finding authentic tacos can be treacherous. Search no further  Bomb Tacos are cheap   3 for a heavy-loaded taco   fast  and delicious. When out-of-towners ask me to take them somewhere authentic  this is the only option I know...and it doesn t hurt that it s at the White Horse  greatest bar on the east side.

I think this is one of the best food trailers in Austin  plus its on the patio of the best honky tonk in town   3 tacos...all are delicious and seasoned to perfection. Gotta love that spicy green salsa too

Ordered their shrimp tacos.  The shrimp were fried.  I guess I should have expected that  since this is Texas.  I m used to grilled shrimp tacos.  I wish they used corn tortillas though.  Overall kinda bland.
Bomb delicious tacos. Get the Carne Guisada and add avocado. The meat is literally caramelized  NOM
The best Al Pastor IN THE CITY. I frequent white horse just for these. My Mexican boyfriend confirms.

These tacos are as good as they can get   2nd trip to Austin and second trip to  The Bomb    Fish  pork and chicken were tried tonight at the White Horse and all are so full of flavor and enhanced with their green sauce.  Definitely worth a try y all

Happy 18th birthday Casa Moreno  We unexpectedly came during Casa Moreno s 18th birthday celebration  and it was such a fun time.The local band Trez Amigos was playing  local artists had small tables outside  free cupcakes were passed out  and there was a raffle to win dozens of different prizes. I m sure events like this don t happen that often  but we left here very happy and satisfied   Food-wise  breakfast tacos are HUGE and come with 12 inch tortillas  they re more like skinny burritos  . We  almost  made the mistake of ordering several per person  but thankfully we noticed how big they were. The huevos rancheros were also tasty and filling   Service was rather slow but it was busy and completely understandable during their big birthday celebration.

Wow. How often do you see the reviews appear as a perfect reverse bell curve  with most at the 1 star or 5 star level   You ll pay here for chips and unremarkable salsa. Why  This ain t on the San Antonio riverwalk to be sure.  They are open for dinner only on the weekend  and they reopen after the lunch hours. I can t imagine how few places do a split shift like that  which no servers worth their salt are going to subject themselves to in 2022. So of course  we did not have the kind of server who was going to go to to bat with the kitchen  to be accommodating towards a vegetarian request for a chalupa that is apparently available only when the buffet is offered.   They did have sufficient knowledge and skills to scramble an egg and make a better than average pancake.   Just another disappointing entry in the very short list of otions on Ben White between 35 and the airport. A cultural desert. A food desert.

Summary  mostly disappointing for various reasons detailed below. The tortillas were chipotle size with 25  of the filling which made for dry overpriced tacos. The one upside is their tortillas tasted handmade rather than the plastic bulk tortillas some places use. The picadillo and machacado would get them run out of San Antonio if it were served there. Others were average but overpriced. Would not go back.  Picadillo  poor excise for picadillo. Plain unseasoned ground beef with dry mealy unseasoned potatos. Topped with a little bit of pico de gallo not even cooked into the meat.  Machacado  NOT machacado  which is made with dried beef. This was just barbacoa with a tiny bit of egg mixed in it. Some of the greasiest barbacoa I ve had.  Carne guisada  not bad  not much to say. Standard carne guisada.  Los chismes  Asada with chorizo and queso. I liked the filling on this one  the asada was tender and the chorizo added a lot of flavor. Only downside was there was not enough meat. The giant tortilla dominated and made the whole thing extremely dry.   Suicide  behemoth with all the fillings. Could easily feed two people. I added sausage which the crumbly kind rather than sliced sausage which seems strange for a Mexican restaurant. Not sure I d order again  a little overkill.

Ok  this place has one thing going for it at breakfast.  They serve big tacos.  Heck  they re what people in Lubbock and Amarillo would legitimately call breakfast burritos.  What they don t do is serve a good taco.  I was very unimpressed by the potato -- which was barely cooked.  And the salsa lacks any kick.  When you combine that with a relatively slow moving line and the basic lack of amenities for eating a taco while there  you quickly decide there are better options.

New to the area and everything we ve tried so far before CM seemed to be more  central American  than the Tex-Mex we are accustomed to. I had the Migas plate  amp  Hubs had the buffet. We both really enjoyed the food. The flavors  amp  taste were closer to what we like. Our server Liz was great. I would give her 5 stars alone. Give this place a try

Looking for a good time with karaoke and dancing  This was it.  Spur of moment drop in for food. Loud for karaoke and Fun atmosphere.  Food was good.  I wanna come back just for the dance  and music     Didn t get a chance for an adult beverage and had to manually tally our tab. 4 meals  2 beers  1tea.  201.  I THINK NOT   Something very wrong with that lil wrist machine

I was excited to give this place a second try   Im from a city that has amazing breakfast tacos so my boyfriend  Austin native  raves about this place . The tortilla is huge but hard and it is only filled about 10 . I was very disappointed as this is the second time I have not been satisfied.

You know what  I liked it  It s not anything like amazing or crazy special  but the staff was so nice  the buffet is small but I live for variety and combo plates so I enjoyed that  and I would definitely go back    The guacamole plate was  6 so maybe leave that one off and stick to just the buffet

I ve been wanting to eat here for years and I finally had the opportunity last week. My husband and I hit up the lunch buffet on Friday. Everything here was super easy and fast  which I appreciated since we had errands to run. We were seated  drinks ordered and we were able to immediately get in line for the buffet. They had enchiladas  rice  beans  guisada  fajitas  papas  fideo and more all on the buffet. I tried a little of most of it and it was delicious. I was definitely full after finishing my plate. I know it s a buffet  but I wasn t able to make a second trip. Believe me if you are looking for a good hearty lunch and to fill up then this is the spot. Service was excellent and the price was awesome  I ll definitely be back and won t wait so long next time

Me and some of my friends really enjoy Thursdays at Casa Moreno s. DJ 2DQ has gotten the party started on past Thursday evenings that I ve been to. This is a great spot for get togethers with family and especially if you have teenagers because they keep the place fun.   The food is always good and so is the service but we really enjoy the lively atmosphere and nice mix of ages and people.

Even after they moved  still a huge fan of this place despite price increases and what looks like a move to become more like a torchys franchise with tacos of the month and rewards. Maybe they got a high paid social media manager making them less like a Alice tx restaurant and more like what s in. Either way still love me a suicide

Vibe is great  they played classics along with having classing Mike Tyson Muhammad Ali fights on. The food is good  i ordered the suicide burrito along with rice and beans and i couldn t finish it cause it was so much. Very good tho. However  the service could be better. I had to call on my waitresses multiple times to get a refill  napkins  the check. Overall 3 5

I like to come here in the morning if I really want to get some fuel for my day  just grab one of their Suicide Taco  it s enough .  Kind of an odd location for a restaurant  but it s on my way to work so I stop every once in a while.  One of the ladies were pretty rude to me once... although it s never happened again  I don t really see the problem stopping by  I just grab a to go bag so I don t have to deal with anyone but the cashier.

My first time going today and I was very pleased with service and cleanliness of the restaurant. The food was AMAZING  I had the breakfast burrito and did not finish it all had the rest for lunch. I am excited to take my family next weekend.
Great as always.. I really have only eaten their breakfast but it is always delicious  I highly recommend the Huevos Rancheros  it s my favorite

Went to this place in the morning for some breakfast tacos. I got 1 barbacoa taco and my husband got 2 tacos 1 barbacoa and a bacon egg and beans taco. The Barbacoa was really greasy and had a lot of fat and had no salt . My husband bacon egg and bean taco was burnt like how do you burn eggs   Wanted some salsa for our tacos and we asked 1 waitress  since our waitress didn t even bother to Acknowledge her own table   she had  said ok but never brought it out . At this point is already aggravating so my husband had to go up to their podium and asked our waitress for the salsa while she was on the phone . She finally brought out a red salsa and it wasn t to bad.Actually wanted green salsa but didn t want to ask since the service was bad. Needed better service and better tacos.

The tacos that I got were nasty. Point blank. I m surprised that this place would serve this to a customer. You should try the food before serving it. The pastor tasted like freezer burn. So gross. I took one bite and threw it in the garbage where it belongs.

Casa Moreno s draws a crowd.  I went there in the pouring rain on a frigid day - the kind of day that makes most Austinites stay home.  Casa Moreno s was packed - and this was at 11 o clock in the morning.  I expect the place was going to be even more packed for lunch.   This is the only restaurant I have ever been to in far Southeast Austin that draws major major crowds.  The crowds know what s good and Casa Moreno s is good.         Because of the pandemic  Casa Moreno s is working on a limited menu.  They are known for their lunchtime buffet.   The lunchtime buffet looked like it would have been fantabulous but that is temporarily shut down.  What is left is pretty good though.         Key point   Usually we judge restaurants by the primary main dishes.  You probably have Mexican restaurants here in town whose main dishes you like better.  Casa Moreno s is all about the side dishes.  On the side dishes  they are world beaters.  Casa Moreno s makes the best flour tortilla in town.  There are a lot of fine fine homemade tortillas in Austin.  Nearly all of them are corn tortillas.  Flour tortillas are usually Tex-Mex cuisines answer to white bread.  Tortillas made with masa harina have power  have soul  have character.  Flour tortillas taste like nothing. You save those for serving to wimps.  Casa Moreno will change your mind about flour tortillas.  Their flour tortilla is about twice the size of a normal tortilla.  It is thick and puffy.  One Casa Moreno flour tortilla is like eating a hot loaf of freshly baked bread.  It is not technically buttery - but it might just as well be.  It is utterly comforting and utterly filling.  If you have had a Casa Moreno flour tortilla  Mommy has just made you lunch.  The world is a good place.  The other majorly good side dish is refried beans and rice.  You didn t hear me say two dishes refried beans and also rice.  They mix the two together.  Most Mexican restaurant rice is awful.  Most Mexican restaurant refried beans are ho hum.  Their rice by itself is okay. The beans by themselves are mildly superior.  The combo is the perfect side dish.  They don t give you very much - but you don t need very much.  The combo is good and even small amounts of it leave you happy and satisfied.  My main dish was chicken enchiladas in a suiza sauce.  The main dishes are pleasant but just okay.  That was the case here.  BUT .... and this matters ...  Take the jalapeno that comes with the enchiladas seriously.  Seriously like a treat  not seriously like a threat.  The dish only works when you eat it with the enchilada.  The garnish is not optional. It is mandatory.  Because of this they give you a great big muddafugga slice of jalapeno.  And if you look carefully off in the corner they give you another great big muddafugga slice of jalapeno.  The enchiladas may be bland by themselves but with the jalapeno the world gets interesting again.  That s why they give you two great big slices.  They want you to have enough to get through your entire entree.         Overall  this is a first rate establishment.  It might not be the one Mexican restaurant I would take an out of town guest to.  But if I am anywhere near Far Southeast Austin  I would go out of my way to eat here.  These guys have a lot of interesting ideas about how to serve food.  And remember    If you don t like your main dish.  You can always fill up on your tortilla.

Went two weeks ago during lunch. Definitely need to go early to get parking. Lucky we found one in the front. Your choice of buffet or off the menu. The buffet was very good  but you will be in line. Buffet menu consisted of cheese enchiladas  fideo  beans  refried borracho   mini chalupas  chicken fajitas  carne guisada  papas fritas  ..... It was very delicious with huge tortillas with the buffet. You will need to wait again in a longer line as more patrons arrived so fill up your plate the first time. lol The food was very delicious. Will be going back in the near future. Wait staff was very prompt and the buffet server was sweet and let you get as much as you plate could be filled. Was not stingy with the servings.

Stopped here on the way home from work the other morning. I really wanted a breakfast taco and had intentions of stopping somewhere else but the line was way long. I had never been here but drive by all the time. Wow  who knew. This place is pretty cool on the inside. I have been wanting to check it out  but the hours are different than when I want to go. Hard to figure out completely. The breakfast taco I got was a beef picadillo. It was yummy  Price was a little more than my other place I stop  but not bad. Will be stopping by to check out their taco tuesday special.

This use to be one of our favorite places for Carne Guisada. I think they are so busy now the quality just isn t the same. I tried calling to place my order and the line wouldn t get answered and would be followed up with an automated message. I ordered when we got there and when we got home we were EXTREMELY disappointed. The tacos were all so dry  I choked on the tortilla and beef tip.  This is now our 3rd failed attempt to picking breakfast up in the last few months.

Husband and I came here for dinner for the first time on a Thursday. Food was very bland and arrived at our table lukewarm at best. There was a DJ who started to set up and play music while we were eating . We ended up listening to about 10 minutes of music then asked for our ticket to pay. Our ticket seemed high for what we ordered. Turns out our server charged us an 18  tip twice  one per person  for subpar food and mediocre service and called it an event fee. First and last time here. Not worth it.

Casa Moreno s has some of my favorite breakfast tacos  I ll give them that  and that s about it. What turned me off from ever going back was the lunch experience my co-workers and I had a week ago. There were six of us  but two got the lunch buffet  meaning other than bringing a drink  they didn t need to be waited on. The other four of us all had simple orders from the lunch menu. I got the sour cream enchiladas and I ordered some extra jalape os slices. The food was alright  my coworker wanted hot sauce for her flautas but apparently they re the only Tex-mex restaurant with no hot sauce in the building. My meal was  9.45 and drink was I believe  2  when it was time to pay the waitress told me my total was over  16. She said parties 6 or more were charged gratuity  25  to be exact  and this information is no where on the menu. And again  two of our people ate at the buffet. Oh and my little sauce cup of jalape os... 1.50. If you like being nickel and dimed  by all means  eat here  but they won t be getting my business anymore.

This place has potential but unfortunately there s a lot to work on. The good  they have different events and is family friendly. The not so good is it is difficult to have a small gathering. If you want more than 6 people to a table they ll charge you a  100 FEE  they say deposit but you don t get this deposit back and this fee covers them putting tables together . It basically ensures you get better service than anyone else. My family had to sit on 3 different tables which were all separated but yet they still charged us 15-20  gratuity.  Some individuals on the same table were charged different amounts  Upon my arrival  which was after work  I waited 30 minutes and finally decided to try to order a drink and food at the bar. They sent me back to the table and I finally got a waitress. Once the food came I had no silverware  I definitely wasn t going to wait so I went and grabbed some myself. My nephew showed up and had a very similar experience. So ultimately  their service is terrible even nonexistent. They definitely didn t deserve the tip they gave themselves.

The experience was a total disaster. First  they did not bring out two of our plates because they completely forgot about them. We were not checked on and kept having to waive random waiters down to get drinks. Then  we found a rubber band in our salsa   Honestly  don t even bother with this place. We came here trying to give it the benefit of the doubt but totally regret it.

Never had a bad experience here intill today.. Paid for my food and my then got my notification from the bank that I was charged more than was on my receipt.  Apparently what they dnt you is if u pay with a card and don t leave a tip on the card their  system  will automatically add a tip. If my case it was a  9.00 add on . So on top of my cash tip they got an additional 9.00. So I paid  19.00 for self service on the lunch buffet.. I did get to speak with someone and hope that in the future they make customers aware of the add on charge before hand...

Terrible service  our server checked on us once or twice and we just had to hope someone would check on us. The food took forever to come out and when it did it was cold. The sour cream enchiladas had no taste and the chicken looked questionable. We ended up sending a meal back and not ordering anything. Definitely will not be coming back.

Terrible place. When you see others reviews about the terrible service here they are not kidding  We sat ignored by several servers for almost 15 minutes. We got up and left. Will not go back. I suggest going to Javi s TexMex which is only 3 minutes away. Hop back on Ben White and once you pass Riverside light turn in to the right. They have great food and drinks and we have always had friendly attentive staff.

Food and drinks very limited basic enchiladas..tacos no variety same for drinks Mex Martini served in small glass NO SHAKER for same price as Trudys or Baby A s MM also if you use CC you will be charged a fee REGARDLESS and drinks served during hh in small plastic cups for full price the only thing this place is known for is there a breakfast suicide Taco other than that there is no real Worth to come here for anything other than breakfast.
Noooooooo    It can t be    They no longer have the Chile relleno taco. Please bring it back    My heart is broken. I blame you COVID

This was very mediocre Mexican food. Not practicing Covid social distancing as the tables are very close together. Food was bland  the salsa was spicy  but that was the only good thing. Waitstaff paid little attention to us. Will not be going back.

I was very upset about my order. First of all my exact order was 3 bean and cheese tacos... One carne Guisada with Cheese   and One beef  bean  and cheese taco. My carne guisada had Zero cheese in it. Michelle one of the managers answering the phone argued with me and said she saw the cook add cheese. Take it had had 4 other tacos with cheese   Lol She said I probably took too long to pick it up and it evaporated   What    I called in my order while sitting in the parking lot    A few minutes later I walked in to pick it up.  She displays so much unprofessionalism for that title.  When I first walked in she stood there arguing with another blonde young girl in front of me    I stood there patiently while she rambled on. Who does this  I work for the City of Austin and when our supervisor has an issue it is taken to the back office not carried on in front of clients. Who does she think she is to argue with me about my order.  First time here but never coming back   She could have carried herself differently. Hopefully the owner is reading this. I mean things happen by mistake and I can understand that. Usually people just order the carne guisada by itself. Simple mistake. Just correct it and move forward don t get confrontational with me about it. She probably saw the cook adding cheese to my other 4 tacos    She definitely needs people training skills.  No salsa either.
Huge delicious breakfast tacos  which are actually more like burritos  the suicide is where it s at

Casa Moreno s is some next level good stuff  I only came her by accident. I was trying to eat at another nearby gem and they were closed and I was running short on time for lunch so I went to this place .. the only option close other than McDonald s or Jack in the Box.   I was expecting some below average Tex-Mex but when I walked in I could tell from the smell in the air that something very different was happening here. I noticed a buffet in the corner and lots of people going at it and decided that would work great with my extremely tight time scheduled.  When I got to the buffet and noticed the Handmade Tortilla s  Carne Guisada and Fideo my heart jumped with joy  I instantly got the feeling I was eating at someone s Grandma s house. The food was far above buffet quality and I had a 15 minute love affair with the Guisada and Fideo.  The people who wrote low scoring reviews for this place really needs to get  down off their high horse. The food is clearly made with love and care and is the kind of stuff I would like to eat every single day.   I will be going back  I ll be telling all of my co-workers about this place and I will be bringing people from out of town here. Do yourself a favor and eat this lunch buffet. Its under 10 dollars and some of the best food in the area

I ve always been skeptical of Casa Morenos - most specifically the kitchen. I ve been there a total of 4 times for a breakfast taco. I went there this morning and found this little label in my taco after biting it once    . If the potatoes are cooked fresh etc  which I m not sure since they were a little mushy ... I don t know how an am pm label would have been mixed in there.

Today was my first time here and is my last time for sure  First  upon entering the place and walking up to the host stand they asked if we were eating in. What    Duh  We re not just standing here waiting for a picture.  Then the hostess looks at her watch and then says... we close at 2 00.  It was 1 15 btw. Already trying to get us to not stay 45 minutes before close.  Re the food  my Fajita plate was subpar with barely a seasoning and they only gave me one tortilla for a plate of fajitas. I asked for some more tortillas and they brought me one. No container of several like most every other restaurant.. One   My friends enchilada plate was so so according to her.  Then the kicker came when I got the check. They charged me  .75 for that one tortilla.  Service was terrible. They don t give you all utensils to eat. And to cap it off they charge 3.20  fee for using your card to pay for the meal.  Never again

I really wanted to like this place as I ve heard so many people rave about it but  it didn t do it for me. We waited about an hour for our food to come out. Being a pregnant woman hungry is not safe for anyone . We were excited to try the menudo but were greatly dissatisfied. It was awful. It tasted like a stew and it wasn t red  red like good menudo usually is. I had the 2 egg plate with potato s and beans and it lacked salt and tasted bland. I didn t get any tortillas with it either. If we do back again  I will be trying the tacos instead of a plate . Maybe their tacos are better. I felt they could ve done a better job of moving the tables further because we were pretty close to other customers . Still prefer Casa Garcia s
Ordered extra crispy bacon They gave me raw looking bacon had to take it all out I told the 2 time for crispy bacon

Grossest 24  I spent on food ever.   Beans were cold  hamburger meat over cooked  corn tortillas were not pre soaked prior to making enchiladas. This place came highly recommended and I dont understand how. Service is terrible so I cannot understand why anyone would return.

Even before COVID I ate here all the time. Only reason it s a 3 star is because I noticed now  when me and my family try to call ahead of time the phone always goes to  too busy . Now I understand people are doing takeout more because of COVID  but this has been happening since before the pandemic. I called multiple times while waiting outside and when I walked in all the employees were in the back chilling and eating. Today  I was sitting in the waiting area and it was only me and a light dining room. So I decided to call and immediately the phone when to   too busy  and I asked what was the number just to make sure it was the same number I called and it was. Food is still great  but service seems sketchy.

They regular. I probably had the worst horchata ever from there. I went for lunch. I had the chicken fajitas and they were ok. They only gave me one tortilla with the fajitas which was different to me. The beans were not the best of the best nor was the rice but it was close to closing so I advise don t go close to closing and they close at 2. However their breakfast tacos are pretty good. I will only go for that

Let me start by saying that I have been going to this place for years and the customer service has gotten worst. If you re wanting to call for a take out  since there s no online way to do so  good luck. If you re lucky  they ll answer and if not then you might as well find another place. They have to realize people do take outs for a reason  people are busy these days. No one has a time to sit around for 15-20 while the food is ready  defeats the whole purpose. Also understand that your business only exists if you have customers  I m sure you re aware about your customer service so why not make attempts to fix it  Do you not care about your customer complaints or is it just not worth it  I hope you actually read this and work on your customer service  as a small business owner I always make sure to go above and beyond.

I love this place. Fantastic Barbacoa. As some people mention the morning take-out wait can be crazy...but that now should change as they have moved into the large restaurant space around the corner which will soon have a bar  etc  I did some recon yesterday . Great food and local no frills feel.

Casa says it all for Casa Moreno ...home made taste and great service.  The menudo is a must try  perfectly seasoned.  Also had a barbacoa taco  not dry like some places but still not overly moist. Delicioso.  Can t wait to come enjoy the buffet. They re open longer hrs as well.

This place has awesome breakfast tacos for an unbeatable price. They are ginormous  AND they also taste fantastic. Here s what I had from there  Carne guisada  excellent meaty flavor without being too oily Bacon egg potato cheese  a little too much egg but otherwise fantastic Picadillo  excellent  reminiscent of burritos I ve had in El Paso. Favorite. Bean and cheese  I think the beans have bacon fat in them  they are amazing. Second favorite Chile relleno Taco  great idea for a taco but the beans were a weird addition. But still great  Every single taco from here was the size of a burrito from somewhere else. This place only has 3 stars on yelp for some stupid non-food-related reason which is extremely annoying. It deserves 5 stars and has better tacos than 99  of the tacos in Austin. Also I can get it delivered to my house with Uber eats.   Get tacos here  you won t regret it
Very delicious and kind waiters  You get more bang for your buck  Definitely will return

I really like the tacos here. My coworker likes them even more... but he s also 6 foot 7 inches tall  so that might explain his obsession with them - they are Tony-sized as he would put it.  In other words  they are like extra large burritos as far as size goes.... so you definitely get your money s worth here. My coworker swears by they re carne guisada. He loves it and always orders it.  Anyway  I like that I only need one taco to fill me up. They also taste quite delicious. Mmm...  I wish I could come here for frequently  but I start work when they open  so it s a little trickier  but I go whenever I can. Keep doing what you do best  Casa Moreno. You guys rock.

Total disappointment  Very slow service  flavorless salsa. We ordered a couple of burritos  they were more like an oversized tacos lacked of flavor. The Migas were just tortilla chips with salsa on it   they got mine and my daughter s order wrong. It took for ever to get our insipid food  the pancakes tasted like McDonald s pancakes. I got there hungry and I left with our appetite.

Great taste in Menudo   Not too great on the attentive service. I asked for water - never got it. Then - I m becoming more skeptical of receipts that don t itemize the prices of what you purchase.  16.50 for a Menudo and Coffee  That s a bit pricy. Won t be going back. Too bad...the food is great
Best breakfast tacos ever    Restaurant is small but they really make you feel like home  Suicide taco is a must

Best thing about Casa Moreno s were the beans and flour tortillas.  We had the taco plate  Carne guisada  and a large nacho plate with ground beef added -  very average and nachos were soggy.  Service was subpar at best.  Wait staff was indifferent and were sitting around.
Great food with a nice lunch buffet option. Definitely great horchata. Stop by if you have time to sit down and enjoy lunch.

A hole in the wall place   Best migas tacos ever     Very affordable   It s family owned and you can taste the love and care that they take to make the food.  The owners are super nice as well. It s a good place for kids.  My picky eater kids liked it as well.

The breakfast food is out standing and would choose this place over any. The buffet is ok for what you get but nothing like the breakfast. What upsets me is they can t seem to ever answer the phone. Me and my co workers order or try to all the time and end up going in person and listen to the phone ring non stop and no one answers it. I would love to move the stars up to 5 if they can fix this problem.

This is the place to eat... They have great carne guisada...Oh  i must mention they have a lunchtime buffet that does not cut back on the quality of the food. They have great staff  my waitress today Rose was excellent . This is truly a South Austin jew  i recommend this restaurant to everyone

Small tex-mex lunch buffet is cheap and mostly delicious. The carne guisada is the best thing here  but we liked most of it. I did not like the enchiladas  which were made from some kind of greasy fake cheese. Nasty  Everything else was tasty though. It s crowded and busy  so the food is always fresh. Even as it got close to 2 00 pm  closing time   they kept refreshing all the most popular dishes.
Big ass tacos I believe you get what you pay for never disappointed. You have to try the  suicide taco

Found this little hole in the wall where the Mexican food is great. It does truly taste like the food my Abuela  grandma  makes. They have really good breakfast with homemade tortillas the size of the plate. They also have a plentiful daily buffet that offers carne guisda  cheese enchildas  rice  refried beans  charro beans  fideo  chicken mole  chalupas  and giant size homemade flour tortillas for only  7.95. Amazing food at amazing prices. If you re in the area you need to try it. This Mexican food is like back home in Alice  Texas. I can t say enough good things about it. It is so wonderful i want to cry. Finally found a good Mexican restaurant in Austin.

I legit had the best taco of my life here. The Picadillo breakfast taco  beef  pico  potatoes  was AMAZING. The seasoning was just perfect and the pico was just right. I also had the Migas breakfast taco which was also delicious. The prices were very affordable...  6.75 for two generously sized tacos. The wait staff were all very friendly and cheerful. I highly recommend this hole-in-the-wall  family-owned  unassuming place. It s not in a  trendy  part of Austin  but is grand

The service it s alright but the food it s really not good if you want to waste your money then this is the best restaurant I order some migas and some barbacoa the barbacoa was soaked on grease I couldn t even eat it and the migas plate tasted like if I was just eating nachos literally the food had no flavor

Definitely an overlooked place within Austin. They are a great taco spot but that s where it ends. Service is decent  most of the menu is better than the average Mexican restaurant in Austin but the tacos are where they shine. Breakfast tacos are their specialty and I couldn t recommend more

Don t listen to the haters  they don t know what they re talking about. The lunch buffet here is cheap  and even though its a small selection  they are all Tex Mex comfort foods. Not every restaurant in Austin has to be some high-falutin  20 dollar-a-plate blah-blah-fusion place. This is food from you grandmas kitchen. Think of the food like a church dinner level. Its good  there s plenty of it  and they ll bring you a bottle of choulula  except when they re out.  Usual selection is Enchiladas  rice  beans  refried or Ranchero   carne guisda  tostadas  chicken mole  large hand made flour tortillas  and of course salsa y chips. There are one or two other dishes that change out depending on what they re serving that day  but i can t remember what they were. Best part is  all of this  all you can eat   7.50  Nice folks there too.  Anyone else complaining about their  watery  salsa has never eaten mexican taquiera  throw it the blender  salsa. It s salsa. What the hell are you looking for  Chunky salsa with no juice  Thats called Pico. Tamale House 3 has the same salsa. You know why  Its salsa. Throw all the stuff in a blender. You what you get when you do that  SALSA.

Casa Moreno s is the best place to get BIG breakfast tacos and they re cheap  I ve tried almost everything  I really love the Teo s  Migas  and the Picadillo is the best I ve ever tried. Really great place for quick  cheap  and filling food.

A short menu of breakfast plates and generously portioned tacos with a ten minute turnaround in a slow lobby. Wait staff was attentive and knowledgeable. Very good sweet tea. My Suicide breakfast taco was piping hot and made well. Next visit  the lunch buffet

I love the Moreno family and their exthept wish  Meet the restaurant is 5      stars. their new location on river site is also good location  They have the same exact foods awsome food I am to go person.
The girls that work here are so sweet. The food is amazing and good prices. Oh did I mention that their tortillas are homemade  So yummy. The tacos are huge and so freakin  good. Love it
This is a South Austin classic. The tortillas are homemade and the food is delicious. Go eat at Casa Morenos

Poor customer service. I ll admit the food tastes good. It does. I don t usually write reviews but this interaction was extremely disappointing.  On Tuesdays  my colleagues order breakfast tacos. Every week. I don t always get a taco because I don t enjoy paying for a taco that is 1 2 filled. My colleagues get 3 items- get twice the filling  meaning they get a whole taco  Not just half  for .50-.75 cents less.  I ordered a Nopalitos breakfast taco 2.25  add egg  .95   This is the 3rd time I have been disappointed  first time inquiring about filling. I asked how full a Nopalitos taco was without egg because this one had maybe 6 strands of cactus. The person I spoke to said a spoonful usually filled the taco and that they make the tacos fresh. Neither of those things answered my question.  He asked what I wanted him to do  because they can t do anything unless I bring it in. The taco took like 3 bites to finish- it was that small  it was gone by that point.  I think I would have been happy if they offered a taco.

I ve been going to Casa Moreno s for a couple of years now. Surprised this is their first review. Only place in town I know of where you can get Mexican food lunch buffet. Breakfast has usual fare. The staff is always friendly. Love their hot sauce
We r from Fort Worth..Wow  This place deserves more then a 5 Star  The food was awesome n our waitress was so nice n quick.  I would definitely recommend this to everyone  We will be back

Okay  so I have been coming to this place for a few years and I have been forcing myself to give them another try but after today s experience I am certain I will never be back. Casa Moreno s is a different sort of place. I liken the establishment to something in between someone s house and a church reception. When you walk in you may smell an intense bathroom smell  this is real. All of the employees are either children or elderly.   The food leaves a lot to desire. Most of the items on the small buffet are warm though the meat tastes old and microwaved.   I will never eat here again. How can this place stay in business  Service is something that is obviously not very important to this establishment. Often  when I have arrived here I am ignored for a series of several minutes before I am acknowledged and seated. Every single time I have come here  no one has brought me a drink or acknowledged me after I have been seated until I am ready to leave  this means no one has asked if I wanted something to drink or if I needed anything until I am getting up to go pay the check. This place is truthfully gross. I see servers bringing additions to the buffet in old dirty plastic buckets and shoveling it into the buffet trays. I have no idea how this establishment has remained open this long.

Do you ever wonder how a place hidden in an industrial area on the south side stays open   LCRA workers   Crowds of them rush in to the place every morning  I imagine  to get their  Suicide Burrito  fix. I started reading the tips and reviews AFTER I had placed my order.  Shoot  I could barely finish one taco.  Props for having papa ranchera  and for the cheap prices.    WTF Moment  Sticky floors  WTF Moment  2  Runny  watery salsa.

Excellent local establishment to enjoy a fresh cooked to order breakfast.  The Saturday special is an great value  includes a beverage of choice.  Friendly efficient service.  Our group of nine is all satisfied    Treat yourself.
Two words   Suicide Burrito  Cost    3   Nuf said.

Pros  Cost  quick  good  homemade  tortillas  Cons  Bland food  sloppy  thrown together  taste and appearance  I made the mistake of ordering two  suicide  tacos  not only was it too much food to finish  my mouth didn t want to continue experiencing it either. I actually scraped out the beans potato egg mush and enjoyed the tortilla more than its  contents.  I would only order from here again if I was starving and had no options other than fast food.

I been going there since day one  10 years ago  when they first opened.  The food is good  the services is great and the breakfast is to die for. And if you can t decide what you want for lunch  go for the buffet   You can never go wrong.

Congratulations  you have a very ugly Mexican food buffet  except for the beef on gravy ... The chicken fajita looks like gallina vieja and fideo sopa have nothing but carbohydrates in there  good news is that if bum the price of the buffet a few  dollars you can get fresh food and not so cheap stuff like fideo sopa and papas sopes wanna and enchiladas wanna and serve real guisados like mole carne puerko con napalis and menudo .... The place ir clean old but clean place
You want soft fluffy huge homemade tortillas and some slamming Mexican food  This is your place   You won t regret it   Oh and don t forget about the lunch buffet   It s a kick
Want cheap mexican food this is the place to come. They have a great buffet to select from and the price is great if you are on budget.
Very cheap food  big portions too but the food is bland  My breakfast taco had egg shells in it. I gave it a try for lunch and my burger was not cooked all the way through

When your boss walks up to your desk and asks if you want to go to lunch  you say  Yes.  You  don t blink  as the would-be Vice President Sarah  Mooseburger  Palin might say. It s good work PR for yourself  and it s a free meal  That being said  when my boss asks me to go to lunch  it s usually to this dump down the street from our office. I want to like this place-- it s family-owned and the wait staff is sweet  stars number one and two . However  at lunchtime  their claim to fame is a lunch buffet  which isn t any better than Pancho s Mexican Buffet-style  bland weirdness. Also  once when I ordered breakfast tacos  beans and cheese   I got back to my desk with them to discover they weren t what I ordered. I decided to eat them anyway  beans and...ground beef  ew.   and my stomach hated me until the next day.  El Meson is right down the street and runs circles around this place.  Maybe next time the boss asks if I want to go to lunch  I ll take the reins and offer to pay-- and go somewhere else.

This morning I had what Casa Moreno s calls a  suicide taco   and I can definitely understand how it got it s name. I think by the end of the day i ll need to schedule a colonoscopy and have heart splints inserted.  Was it flavorful  Not so much  Was it filling  It s been an hour and I can still barely move if that answers your question  The suicide taco is basically a 12 inch flour tortilla filled with egg  cheese  potatoe  bacon  and chorizo for a total weight of a pound when completed.  Aside from the lack of intense flavor or originality like Vics or Torchys  Casa Moreno s does dish up the best value in town.  3 for a pound of food at 8 30am isnt bad at all. Now if they could just find a better salsa and spice up there ingrediants a bit...

This was the first time I tried and chose Buffet too bad I didn t see a menu to try their selections. Some people say that they miss  all you can eat  Panchos that was in Austin back before 1994 and a small stint in Round Rock and Oak Hill around 2004.    This restaurant doesn t serve the quantity dedicated to buffet of that establishment but if it did Casa Morenos would run circles around Panchos.   The closest Pancho s from here  west San Antonio  is to taste what the various nasty looking strip malls I avoid stopping at when Iam there.

This place is old school.  I am talking gooey cheese enchiladas topped with Chili gravy.  Don  find that too many place any more.  They have a lunch buffet for about  6.  Enchiladas  Carne Guisada  beans  rice  soup  and usually a couple of things that change.  You may try it and think that I am crazy.  That may be true but Casa Moreno makes food like a place I used to frequent 25 years ago before I left the area.  I never thought I would find those tastes again and yet I have.

I am giving them a 2 as it was my fault for not opening the bag before I left. Co worker suggested this place as we had never been. I placed an order during lunch for pick as I wanted to get back to work. I got the grilled chicken salad. It was small  did not have cheese or dressing  there was only 3 pieces of bell peppers and one piece of onion I asked for rice and beans to be added and they forgot. The chicken was dry and way over cooked. Next time I am driving the extra 10 min to Cabo bob  s to get a decent salad. My co worker got the chicken enchiladas he said they were meh.

After nearly 8 years of being at the top of my go to comfort food  I can honestly say I am walking away. On rare occasions before I have had some minor mishaps with one particular item on the menu  a barbacoba  shredded beef  taco. In Austin it has been really hard to find both a great homemade flour tortilla and yummy barbacoba. In the past when they put more  sebo   grease  than meat  I ve told the owner it s best just to say they don t have any barbacoba. And to give them credit they have apologized and tried to make things right. Don t get me wrong I understand sometimes to make the meat moist you need the sebo but don t make the whole taco of sebo.  Today though was the last straw  I can t believe I was dubbed again  it was the grossest taco of pure  sebo  not meat anywhere. So even though I love the fact that they make my egg white and bean taco  and that their carne guisada is yummy more than 90  of the time  I m sad to say my search for my go to place will start again.  This is the place I recommend to family and friends  the first place I would think of when people wanted homemade tortillas but after those bits of sebo today when I was expecting a meaty barbacoba taco and feeling my stomach turn I don t really have a choice.

Stopped and got some tacos the other morning I thought they where great  Home made corn and flour tortillas great hot Sauce. Can t wait to try more food here  Also I talked to a lady I think she s the owner she was very nice and a pleasure to talk to.

Sadly this place has gone WAY downhill.  I went here a little over a month ago with some coworkers and we left feeling unsatisfied.  The food was bland and had no flavor and the service was terrible.  It seems like every time you go to this place the owners have someone different working there and is always seems to be grandchildren or some form of family members.  Makes you feel like you re eating in someone s house the way they act  and not in a good way. There were young adults just hanging out at a few tables and then it was obvious that they were somehow related to the owners and at one point one of them got up to work the cash register but everyone seemed like they didn t even notice the customers  they were in their own world and we couldn t get refills or help.  I thought I d give the place another chance  I mean where else can you find a Mexican buffet around here  right   Well I REALLY should have turned around when I walked in an aroma hit me in the face that smelled like I had walked into a dirty night club restroom.  I thought  well the restroom hall is right there  Still gross and we should have left now that I experienced the food I realize this.  The chicken fajitas were old  cold  rubbery and had that nasty over-microwaved meat taste.  The enchiladas were bland and the edges of the tortilla were so hard you couldn t cut through hem with a fork let along chew with your teeth.  There was one mini chalupa on the buffet and all it s toppings were sadly scattered throughout the pan.  The fidello was nothing but liquid....I could keep going and going but bottom line  I have sadly given up on this place and decided that it is not worth it anymore.
