Another thing I noticed  this place used to be packed at the time that I went  today it was just us and two other people.  I think other people are noticing their decline.

Excited for a co-worker to bring me a giant breakfast taco this morning from Moreno s. The homemade flour tortilla was huge  fluffy and delicious  Salsa was pleasantly spicy and flavorful. I did not eat much of the inside of the taco because co-worker got bacon and I am sans meat for the time being  but it was packed. A great deal for anyone with a big appetite on a small budget. I look forward to going here on my own and ordering for myself so I can get the full experience.

I hate to say it  but this place doesn t live up to my expectations. The service is great. The lady at the cashier is always a sweetheart...I think she s the owner   But the food...the food is just not  teh awesome . It s good for a cheap  filling meal. I have been in a few times with a friend who loves it. I just don t find the breakfast tacos all that good. If I want cheap breakfast tacos  I ll go to that other place whose name escapes me now. sigh. It sucks to get old and have your brain go on holiday without you   So it s edible but nothing to get excited about. I gave it an extra star for the nice servers.
Food is blah and it compliments the awful service. DON T GO HERE there are better places to eat where customer service is held high.

Decent lunch buffet. Just very low on food  and some refills took a bit. Quality was ok. Chicken mole felt bland to me  but somebody else may love it that way. Cost   8 - a good deal. Restaurant was full but not overcrowded. Wait staff friendly but not terribly fast. Good choice for a regular lunch.
Family owned  wonderful staff of nice people and the food is soo good  Breakfast specials or a suicide taco for breakfast is a win or stay for the 11am buffet super good. Love tues. its mole  day

Some of the best breakfast tacos I have ever eaten    The tortillas are delicious and the size of the tacos will leave you full and satisfied.  I ordered the barbacoa taco and wasn t too impressed by it.  The taste was good but not a good amount of meat and kind of greasy.   I recommend the bacon egg and cheese tacos.

The lunch buffet is only 7 . Which is a great price. However the food doesn t have a lot favor but it s not bad and nor great at the same time. The customer service needs to better. They put name tags of the waitress on the table  I never seen this before but she still didn t attend to the table. I ll give this place another shot in a couple weeks.

No thanks to the buffet and we will mark it off our list. The enchiladas were so hard they couldn t be cut with a knife. Meat for carne guisa was very fatty and in a water sauce. Chips weren t refilled. Options are super limited. I mean  no queso or tacos fixings.

It took 40  minutes to get my food and the waiter never came to check in and just let us know that it was going to be a little while. There were several tables open so I was not anticipating that long of a wait.  But the best part was when I received my food it was not even cooked they had to take it back for an even longer time.  If they would have been apologetic or just kept me informed it would have been okay they did everything they could to avoid the situation. It was not even good after I finally got to eat it because it was soggy and cold

I m not sure what Lindsay C.  the previous reviewer  was expecting from a mexican restaurant that s open only for breakfast and lunch  in a commercial strip  on a commercial road  where the closest standard lunch option is McD s  but I got exactly what I was looking for at Casa Moreno s.  Driving by to work  I d always seen the Lunch Buffet sign  and of course my curiosity was piqued. I d never really seen a mexican lunch buffet pulled off effectively  but in this neighborhood an eatery isn t going to stay open long if they aren t serving an edible meal -- and there is always some traffic there at lunchtime.  The occasion arose where my boss was out for the day  so I planned on taking an out-of-office lunch.  I went by myself in case the food actually was terrible or the service was painfully slow  as not to inflict these trials on another.  I was pleasantly greeted when I came in and there were several still having lunch at about 12 45.  I was asked if I wanted a menu  or if I was having buffet.  I took a look at the buffet first and all appeared appetizing  so I let the waitress know I wanted a sweet tea and grabbed a buffet plate.  The cooking was what I would label traditional mexican style.  That means that there s going to be some fat on the meat  the beans aren t going to be vegan  and there s going to be onions seasoning most everything.  The buffet food seemed to me to be exactly what you would get if you ordered it off the menu  i.e. the beans weren t crusty  the rice wasn t dry  everything was very flavorful and hot.  I really enjoyed the carne guisada over some rice tucked in  what appeared to be  a homemade flour tortilla.  From the buffet  the rice was yummy  amp  fluffy  and the chicken fajitas were nicely spiced  too.  I placed some chicken meat  no  not strictly white pristine breast meat  on my mini chalupa  tostada if you re white-bread  and ate up.  I do have one bit of thumbs down  as the sauce brought with the chips was quite thin.  I asked for some pico de gallo  which was promptly brought and obviously fresh  stirred it in and had a nice salsa.  The chips are super fresh  but thankfully not greasy  as some cooked on-site chips are presented elsewhere.  The service was no-nonsense  but attentive with a pleasant smile.  The ladies let you do your own thing  but are there if you need a little extra attention.  There were several city employees lunching  since there are city buildings in the area  and multiple truck drivers stopped in who went directly to the buffet to pile up a hot plate.  I m sure they re thankful to have an option of an all-they-care-to-eat hot traditional meal with a refreshing glass of tea for just a little more than they d spend at the drive-thru.  Lunch served 11-2.  p.s. I haven t experience El Mason down the street  but I m a bit wary that they rarely have any obvious traffic.

It s a friendly place.  There s usually good music playing  and their lunch buffet is pretty solid on MWF  Tuesdays and Thursdays the centerpiece is a chicken  amp  vegetable stew that just isn t that filling  but the rest of the week there s some good variety of fajitas .  The Mexican rice and borracho beans are consistently excellent  and they have some of the best tortillas around.  Some of it is a little bland  and sometimes on busy days the buffet is a little overextended and stuff seems a little undercooked.  So I can see why someone might have a bad experience there  but for me it s worth a regular visit.  They also have a good cheeseburger  amp  fries if you re not up for Mexican food but somehow ended up in there anyway.

myself and some co-workers have been ordering tacos form here about once every week. we called in our order this morning  about 20 tacos  and sent a guy out to pick them up. when he got there he was turned away because they don t take separate orders any longer. that is a over  100 worth of business that they have lost  and we will not be ordering from them from here on out. if you want to place a separate order  go somewhere else. this place will turn you away.
We stopped in  here for breakfast. The breakfast plates are tasty and offer plenty of food for even a big appetite.  The service was quick and courteous. This is a nice find.

This place is about his rundown of a hole in the wall that you will ever find    6.50 lunch buffet but looks like smallest buffet in the world  we ordered off the main menu  I was a bit shocked and I received my fajitas and they were made of thigh meat that looked like it was dried out the day before microwaved  we had to request beverage refills as none were offered we had to get up and grab her own the silverware as our table was not set we sat down and to top it off while rushing to go to the bathroom and poop the horrible food out I was a bit taken aback by the fact that there was no toilet paper. Lol  all in all there are several Mexican choices in this area including a food truck I must say Casa Marina is likely the worst choice in the area please don t waste your time or money going into this dive  not trying to be rude but my god horrible service  horrible food  horrible dirty environment  horrible experience and I do not give 1 stars out lately but this place probably didn t even earn one star. Lol save your money go to the taco truck down the street it s probably a little bit more sanitized

I went years ago and didn t like it then. I don t know how my friends convinced me to go today. But I did. Once again. Horrible service. They have a buffet going on at a certain time of the day. We arrived during that time. It took 10 minutes for me to get my tea. My friends arrived before me. I opted out of the buffet that everyone seemed to be getting. I myself am not fan of ANY buffets. I feel if I m going out to eat my food should be cooked to order for ME     The salsa was soooo bland.  I only ordered one breakfast taco. The tortilla was so thick and hard. My friend ordered a suicide taco. Which seemed to miss the bacon. Once we brought it up to the waitress she went back to tell the cook. Comes back and says the cook said it was in there. We fork through the taco and a whopping two tiny pieces of bacon were there hidden. We laughed. Not a good laugh. So the waitress went back and brought my friend a little bowl with tiny pieces of bacon to add to his taco. I PERSONALLY WILL NEVER GO BACK   Good luck to all that do

As I walked in  there was a foul odor....It smelt like it was old and moldy.  I figured the building was just old so I ordered 2 chicken fajita tacos on corn tortillas.  I will NEVER go back....no flavor to the chicken what so ever  it was bland and the tortillas smelt like some kind of cleaner.  I think they should find a cleaner place and hire better cooks  maybe then it will be better.  The cooks need to taste their food before serving.

The only good thing I can say about this place is the decent size portions. Breakfast tacos are huge. Finally went in to dine for lunch. Customer services was okay. The food  not so great. Really bland. Probably won t go back.
This is the palce to get one of the best tacos in town for 3.00 you can t beet this place.

If you want a damn good taco for a great price  this is the place. I read the other reviews and feel some people might be more picky than I. I eat breakfast tacos everyday for the most part and this place serves big tacos that fill you up.  The service was great and the owner  Angie  greeted us at the door. She is super nice and I will be going back for more suicide tacos. I added chorizo to mine which made it even better.

Their food is great. However  any food on their buffet is not available to purchase for take out. Never heard of this before. Also  you are not allowed to sub refried beans for charro on their plates. Really  They need to learn how to please their customers.

Their potato  egg  and cheese breakfast tacos were HUGE for the very reasonable price.  I can usually eat two breakfast tacos and was stuffed after one of theirs.  The taste was ok  a little skimpy on the cheese  but definitely a great value for the money.

Their breakfast taco s are just ok.  Flavor is very bland and usually cold.  The place is close to my work so it is easy to stop in and get breakfast.  They just recently raised the price again on there breakfast taco.  The price is not worth it  especially when the food is so bland.  I also had there buffet for lunch and the experience was even worse.  Again  bland food and it  taste like the cheapest of ingredients were used.  More importantly some of the cooked items are cold  Hello Food Inspector .  I will most likely have to find a new place for Mexican food fix.  Just not worth it anymore.

My experience here was horrible  I took my food to go. I went for breakfast and ordered a breakfast burrito  it had egg shells in it which I was willing to look past but then I bit into something hard and it was a hard black piece of plastic  could have broken my filling   like maybe a piece of a cooking utensil. I had enough by then so I called the restaurant only to be hung up on  accidentally  on several occasions. I usually like  hole in the wall   Mexican restaurants but I DON T recommend casa moreno s

I m going to go for the obvious as everyone else has pointed out- suicide burrito. The flavor isn t 5 star or anything worth getting excited for  but for the size and price you can t complain a whole lot. I tend to have an alarmingly large appetite  but one of these  prefer mine without the beans  can shut my stomach up well into lunchtime. The past 2 times I ve been here  I have been slightly disappointed though- I absolutely love their salsa  and though I ask for extra each time and it is written down  it is still forgotten. The time before last I even checked my bag before I left and asked if I could have one more- I waited for 10 minutes while she ran to grab one for me but she never came back. If it was busy I would be more then understanding  but there was one other person in the entire restaurant besides me. Service in the morning is ehhhh  would like to give their lunch buffet a try some day. I recommend this place over El Meson down the street...but I am still on the hunt for a truly fantastic hole in the wall joint.
Pretty bland tacos  but they are cheap and filling. The suicide taco is my regular. Can t beat it for the price.

Love this place. Had a  suicide  taco and let me tell ya it sure was damn good. It reminds me of the hole in the wall restraints in San Antonio and that suicide taco is like three quarters of a pound and its only like 2.75. Check this place out its right by cat fish parlor off of ben white then exit ed burleson rd and it will be on your left

Los Mejores Tacos de Austin   This are without a doubt the BEST tacos i have had in Austin so ever  the ladies that run the place are very nice and make delicious food. This tacos are so good im going to go get some right now just for thinking about them.. Carnitas y tripas son mis favoritos....

This is by far one of the tastiest taco place I ve been in Austin. Quesadilla is also very good. There is one thing I didn t like much and that is the burrito add-ons.. there are none. A burrito has only  choice of meat  beans. No sour cream  lettuce  rice or fries.   So quality of the food is amazing but maybe more ingredients should be added for a better food experience. In a way I feel like what I didn t like is because of expectations... and when you have expectations you will be disappointed    all the places around have rice  cheese  guacamole etc in their burrito  maybe if this was my first burrito ever I would ve not been disappointed about it cause man it was tasty     Try it out and review it  I m looking forward to seeing more opinions about it.  Ps my previous review is a mistake  that was for a different taqueria. Sorry for that.

Absolutely integral component of South Austin.  Margie keeps the tacos coming and the smiles are abundant.  This is the best late night taco truck in ALL of Austin     Is it Westlake foodie friendly  At 1 am   ...damn straight.
Awesome place with awesome prices  Highly recommend their hotdog  has bacon and a bunch of toppings  and their order of street tacos

This place is terrible   I should have went to my guys at  Taqueria La Esperanza  on S. Congress. I mean this Jefes Taqueria is way below the bar when it comes to Austin food truck taco standards.   I ordered 4 Fajita Tacos and 1 Quesadilla to be split between a friend and I. The tacos were very small. Think street taco sizes. They charged me  26 for that. I mean what a rip off  right  The gentleman at the window told me it comes with cilantro and onions and asked if that was okay. I asked him if they had lettuce  tomatoes  amp  cheese instead and he said okay. All the while the lady making my food was giving me these weird looks.   Anyways  the guy that took my order ended up charging me extra over a  1 more per item  about  5  and the lady didn t even put cheese on the fajitas.  He didn t even tell me he was charging me extra  just went ahead and did it . The quesadilla in the pic on their menu shows it having sour cream  guac  lettuce  amp  pico. Except when I got it it only had just a few bits of chicken and mainly cheese and the tortilla. That s it  Not to mention nothing tasted very good. Everything was too salty and dry. Also  everything was very bland when it came to the seasonings.   I asked for extra salsa and the guy told me he would hook me up. Probably cuz I gave them a decent cash tip in their plastic tip jar. He gives me 2 small bags a little bigger than the size of my thumb with one green  amp  one red salsa. That s it  Bags that were like thin  flimsy sandwich bags mind you. They were tied in an awkward tight knot so I couldn t even use them without risking having to pop them and spill them everywhere. Do those small plastic ramikens really cost that much my dude   Pretty sure you could get them from costco for a great deal and end up pleasing your customers so they can be happy and come back for more bro    Well  at least now I know not to get tempted and stop here ever again  Lesson learned. It s back to my favorite spot Taqueria La Esperanza on S. Congress where the tacos are twice the size  taste a hundred times better and they won t be stingy on the accessories  amp  condiments

Great service  Fantastic burritos  amp  tacos. Decently priced too which is hard to find. The only thing that can be a pain is parking around the car wash if it s busy. You can park next door and walk if it s busy and I suggest it because I ve been blocked in before and couldn t get out.
Staff was really nice  amazing burritos and tacos and love that it s open late night. Definitely authentic and delicious. Thanks for being here
Good tacos all around for the price. Salsa comes in a baggy. Just note it is cash only

I just bought in the neighborhood across the street and saw the folks lining up at night and had to swing by and check out the food. I had the chicken tacos and a quesadilla on my first trip. Tacos were simple but good and the quesadilla was excellent. Plenty of cheese and meat. I m a sauce salsa snob and the green and red sauce here is on point. Service is friendly and fast. Bring cash. I ll be back regularly.
Favorite taco truck in Austin. The gringas are amazing. Staff always has a great recommendation for trying something new. Great late night spot

This taco truck is part of the north Austin chain of Jefes  but manages to have higher quality tacos than the others. Perhaps it s because one of the owners actually mans this roach coach. Or maybe because it s a stone s throw from a Tejano club.   Regardless  it s a solid choice for late night weekend tacos around the Ben White area. Somehow I missed this truck for the year it has been open. Clearly  I need to brush up on my taco stalking skills.

This place never fails to deliver on great food  From burritos to nachos to tacos y mas  Closed Monday and Tuesday  everyday is 7pm to 3am  but Sunday  closes at noon. Only downfall is that it s cash only  but after the first time I ve been pulling cash out just to get my fix
Excellent service and delicious tacos  The green sauce is amazing. Just remember to bring your cash
Just wanted to let you know that you have the best tacos in town. I ve been coming to y all for years and you guys are always so friendly

This is one of the best kept secrets for locals. Authentic mexican food cooked in a trailer by a legitimate mexican grandma  Only open evening and late but the quality of food is absolutely amazing.  Make sure to get the pickled carrots and cabbage and green sauce with EVERYTHING  Reasonably priced and they even treat this gringo like I m one of their own. Authentic pastor  suadero  chicharones. My go to spot on way home from a good night out.  Only knock on them and it s minor is that they only accept cash  why its 4 stars not 5  but are trusting enough to take your order and let you run to grab cash as your order is being redy. This is uncommon for a busy food truck

Absolutely solid place to go for a late night meal.  I ve never been disappointed here with anything I get  and I ve gotten everything on the menu.  Wish they were open 24 7 cause I d probably eat here every day.
Delicious  inexpensive  amp  fast. The ingredients were fresh  amp  the women working were very nice

After a night out  the hubby and I wanted some tacos. We ve passed by this place plenty of times on our way home and figured we would try it out. By far  the best al pastor tacos I ve had hands down. The tortillas were also amazing. If you want something a bit different  I d say try the hot dogs.. They were crazy good too. Be sure to take cash as they do not take cards

Bistec  Carnitas  al Pastor and all their delicious Mexican friends come out after dark in front of a detail shop.  Try this place out on your way home and you won t be disappointed. We had a few tacos and a Gringa but will be back for the tortas and gorditas.
Simple great tasting breakfast tacos. Almost always get sausage and egg or potato and egg. Have had the migas taco and it was good too.
With Torchy s down the street... Need to step up your game  ORLANDO    Always loyal to TS but today all my tacos were so cold

I m a regular here  but gotta say service has really plummeted in the last year. Pretty consistently bad--my order is almost always incorrect  and the folks behind the counter are no longer the jovial bunch I once knew. Bad attitudes all around and no sense of urgency. Morale seems pretty low at the establishment. Love me some Taco Shack  and the tacos are tasty   but no longer frequenting this place.
Half my to go order was missing and the manager hung up on me when I called to inform them of this.
Not the first time I ve been to this location and my order was wrong. Stupid me for not checking it before I left. Paid for 2  4 item tacos and got 2  3 item tacos -no bacon

A good  inexpensive  reliable  take-out only  place for basic breakfast tacos and standard traditional Tex-Mex for lunch. The service is friendly and brisk  and it doesn t hurt that the kitchen is open for all to see and always looks very clean. I like the catfish tacos and the cheese enchilada plate.  The barbacoa beef tacos are also quite good.
At their request I did reach out to them directly  first by phone  voicemail  and then via their contact page. No reply. Tacodeli is awesome

I called and placed a order it was not ready at the time I asked for and I was late. The guy that answered the phone was rude and when I got there he was at the desk and was rude still. If I could give 0 stars I would.
11.63 for two tacos and a drink. I ve never paid that for a breakfast taco and won t start now. No thank you.

Love Taco Shack  but not enough to risk COVID19.  Cashiers  who are most exposed to the most people  wear their masks so they just barely cover their mouths. asked each time  for their own safety if not for safety of customers  to please cover nose and mouth with the mask. All I got was snarky looks.  Management should step up and ensure that employees and customers are protected as much as practical.   Love the tacos  but not willing to die for one.

DON T WASTE YOUR MONEY OR RISK GETTING FOOD POISONING      Tacos were served at room temperature  and were inedible. The amount of grease was absurd. There are many great tacos places in Austin...don t waste your time  money  or health here.  -  Taco Shack - There are enough negative reviews that it s clear this location needs a fundamental overhaul of kitchen operations. Apologies and forwarding guests to a generic contact form seems to be a waste of time. No action was taken previously  why would I expect leaving my contact information in a generic form to be better  When your reviews are this bad  consistently  below is the response a franchise should make      We are closing down our store and are dedicating an entire day to train our team on food safety  preparation and presentation. On Saturday January XX we invite you to join us and our executive chef first name  last name at our Spicewood location as s he unveils our revamped menu that is sure to surprise and delight. If you join us  and you do not absolutely love your TacoShack experience  your tacos are on us

Taco Shack Spicewood Springs Austin tx.  The worst customer service I have ever had. The whole staff was not friendly.  Down right made me and my coworker uncomfortable.  They need to go visit the one on Lamar with Freddie.  He knows how to treat customers.  Get a better attitude and treat your customers better.

I hit this place 3-4 times a week  for over a year  and their tacos have always been good. I call in on my drive in and it s waiting for me when I get there. Today I called 33 times and never got through. I asked who was answering the phones and the cashier said they had a large order and a line out the door and were told not to answer the phones this morning. If you could put this info on your answering machine message  I could save a lot of time and just take my business elsewhere like I plan to for the next month...

Austin has a lot of taco options. Trust me  Taco Shack shouldn t be your first option  especially when the best thing I had there was the iced tea.  I ve lived in the neighborhood for over 30 years and have been to Taco Shack less than five times.  I thought maybe it was because the seating insider was limited  with less than six stools at a counter. After this morning  I remember why.  It s the food  prices  and service that make me not want to come back.  The food.  I ordered two Lone Star tacos  their term for a plain beef fajita taco   breakfast potatoes  and an iced tea. The fajita meat was meh at best.  The meat at chains like Taco Cabana  Rosa s  and even Taco Bell  at least their steak tacos  has more seasoning and pizzazz. The salsa was pedestrian at best and also lacked heat.  People  this is Texas.  I expect my salsa to remind me of that fact.  The breakfast potatoes were nowhere near cooked enough.  Underdone potatoes  whether deep fried or skillet fried  are not appetizing to say the least. The iced tea was truly the star of the meal with decent slices of lemon available.  I d give it a 2 star review except for two other things.  The service that was about as friendly as visiting an IRS office staffed by Post Office employees and the price.  For a large tea  two flavorless tacos  and a side of undercooked potatoes  I paid 12 dollars and change.  I could ve paid significantly less for significantly better food from a chain -- or one of the many amazing local taco options here in town.  I just don t get how this place has become an institution for providing flavorless food at high prices with disinterested service.  Here s the TL DR version.  Paying good money for bad tacos is wrong.

We ve been going to Taco Shack since it opened. We ve seen it through multiple management and staff changes but they always maintained a consistent level of friendly service and good food...until now. They completely turned over there food prep team and it has severely impacted every aspect of the product they serve. We used to go multiple times a week for breakfast tacos and they have not got one single order right for the past 4 weeks.  Add to the inconsistency of getting the order right  the servings are chintzy  quality has suffered  and condiments are often missing. We ve even called to offer constructive feedback  always with a positive tone  because this is a beloved restaurant and we want them to succeed. But after so many failed attempts - we give up and will no longer be a regular customer. Makes me sad.
Two thumbs up.  The Shack taco is a must have.  It s so big  I only need one.  Good service and lots of outdoor seating.

All I wanted was tacos. Ordered three  got two. I was wondering why it was only seven dollars for three.   Yep  they started selling these three fifty tacos about a year ago. One reason shy I barley stop by any more. Fleecing the suburbs with average tacos for three bucks.  If only Kens Tacos was in our area.   But I digress  two tacos when three ordered. And  mine was not even warm.  You can only half ass a taco so much  but they nailed that part.
Can t believe all customers are waiting for our individual orders while they fill a giant order.  They used to care about the waking too

We have totally given up on this Taco Shack Shame on us we keep going back because they re close and we think the next time will be better   Breakfast taco full of egg shells for the last time  Not going back

I just had their Chorizo and Egg shack taco and EWWWWWW  wth  it was awful    The eggs weren t cooked and the Chorizo  it didn t cook right and it tasted  JUST WRONG     Not sure what kind of chorizo sausage that was but it looked like grounded cat food and it tasted very very strange   I had to rush to nearby Starbucks to get rid of that disgusting taste    Don t eat here  the one on West Parmer Ln tasted way way better

I love  LOVE  the carne guisada taco on flour with avocado and cheese added. The classic breakfast tacos  such as potatoe egg and cheese are tried and true. The staff is nice and the wait is super short when they re slow and never too long when they re slammed. There isn t really seating inside - they have a bar you can eat at if you don t mind people hovering over you waiting for to-go orders. Outside seating is nice but limited. They have a pretty neat and massive outdoor patio umbrella. There s also a little fountain you can sit on the edge of  but it s kind of old and lacks in visual appeal. So if you re grabbing a taco to-go and want the best carne guisada north of the Rio Grande Valley  this is your place

We had a very bad experience here a week ago.  The cashier was seriously rude.  But I wrote a comment on the Taco Shack website.  Hesitantly  this morning we went back.  There was a different person at the cash register  a very friendly young woman  who had been there last week and recognized me today.   Amazing in itself  given we were all wearing masks.    She volunteered an apology for what had happened last week.  She said that my comment had been read and taken seriously.  And she said that I wouldn t have to deal with the rude woman again.

Have not been here in about a year was a weekly customer I had ordered  2 egg tacos  amp  one migas.  amp   said please no hot peppers.             Waited on other side for tacos  amp   cook said its all mixed in jalape o cannot be taken out  so I said just an egg taco instead to replace taco.             Got in my car  amp   only 2 tacos were in bag took a bite of one hardly even warm  other taco the same so in the trash they went.          I watched the cooks  amp  lg container of cooked eggs being scooped into tacos   cheese was not even melted.  It is not just your restaurant I think since the pandemic many placed are skipping quality.         Not your place but well known taco place up the road had flys inside  another the potatoes are not even cooked   amp  another had so much dirt under register.   Your place is clean         Should not be hard to get hot eggs  amp  requesting well done bacon   amp  being told we can look through pile   amp  it was not cooked well done. Why the bacon cannot be placed on grill for a couple of minutes more.       Our Family had 3 successful restaurants  amp  we bend over backwards to make a customer happy.  Maybe because your place was not that busy   amp  they made more eggs then needed

Had to be up north for the day  so I was looking for some breakfast tacos and hadn t been to a Taco Shack in a long time. It was pretty bad. Ordered a bacon  egg  amp  cheese for the toddler. The eggs were runny. A BEC taco shouldn t drip. I was trying to decide between the atx and the barbacoa. I asked if the barbacoa was lean and the guy said   it s just ok  I d go with the atx . So I did. The atx is brisket  which had big chunks of fat and veins  and runny eggs. After pulling off the fat  the brisket that was left was dry and not anything special. Flour tortillas were just average and the eggs  besides being runny  weren t seasoned at all. Definitely won t be back. Or maybe I ll come back in a few more years after I forget they aren t that great.
2 out of the 4 cooks were not wearing their masks properly  they were around their chins  not safe

I ve come here for years because I live nearby.  I know the owner from his days keeping up the fields at Northwest Little League.  These days we re remodeling  so I always get a Shack Pack for the construction crew.  One of the workers at Taco Shack was rude to me this morning.  I always ask for green sauce and I was shocked and embarrassed when he created a scene.  Apparently it is a bother to him to turn around and put two green sauce containers in my sack of tacos.  I won t be coming back.    UPDATE  I m getting tacos at the trailer in the parking lot of the convenience store at Steck and Mesa just a few blocks away.  They are cheaper  taste like real Latino tacos  are prepared just as fast and have no egg shells in them.  I can t believe I ate those tasteless tacos at Taco Shack all those years.

Today for lunch we headed to the taco shack  had a chicken tortilla soup which had a bunch of mixed veggies and and excessive amount of cheese. Don t get me wrong I love cheese just not the entire soup bowl having cheese. It was quite thick and the chicken tasted like that fake chicken. I wouldn t give this the worst rating but certainly not anything more than a 3 star. It was mediocore at best. I would possibly give this place a second chance.
Rude service  bad tacos.  Every time I go I m disappointed and wish I chose somewhere else. Will never go back. Don t waste your time or money here.
Great breakfast tacos  some of my favorite in Austin. Also really good coffee
I just went here and ordered 3 ground beef tacos. They were out of taco meat. How can the taco shack be out of taco meat    SMH

Owner contacted me and asked me to write to him and he d rectify the situation. I did. About 3 or more months ago.  Nothing. No reply. No anything. Adios Shack.  It was good white it lasted.  Maybe I ll come back when the place is managed better. Like it once was.

5 stars for a normal breakfast  can t comment on anything else.   Ok  so I m an instant instant fan of places that serve thick  crispy bacon. My go-to breakfast isn t tacos so I didn t have this restaurant on my radar... but I ended up eating a catered breakfast that had a variety of tacos from here and was intrigued by their thick  crispy bacon. I feel let down when I eat flabby ones.  So far I ve only gone to this location once and I have no complaints. The lady running the cash register was nice and smiley  which I very much enjoy at 7 am  and the burrito I got  Burnet Road burrito  came out quick. Bacon still crunchy. I probably wouldn t ever come here for a non-breakfast taco  since nothing really appeals to me  but if I m craving a breakfast taco and I m in the area I d come back. I m content.

I was excited as taco shack is in walking distances from my condo.  The barbacoa was greasy.   Dipping off the tortilla.   The beans didn t really have much flavor.  I can t eat eggs  so my breakfast choices are limited.  I would rather drive somewhere that have more options.    Not a bad choice for cheap tacos...just not my cup of tea.

My husband and I stopped in on a Sunday morning.  I guess they only serve breakfast tacos on the weekend so we ordered some shack tacos and a Mia s Migas taco.    The tacos were decent but could use some additional spices.  The salsa they provide does help but there was just a little something missing.  Service was friendly and it was a much shorter wait than Torchy s.  I d be interested to see what the lunch tacos are like.

I m fond of saying that the sign of a place s quality isn t when everything is going well  it s when things go wrong where businesses really shine or suck. I came in on a busy Friday morning having placed a sizable takeout order. Unfortunately my order wasn t ready when I had requested. I waited for about 10 minutes and when they brought me my order  not only did they apologize  they also threw in free extra tacos. I didn t make a fuss or show signs of displeasure so it was literally the staff here recognizing that they had a service fault and they automatically took care of the situation.  I genuinely appreciate when businesses do that. Thanks y all for being awesome.
Great simple breakfast items.  Fairly quick and they have great prices.   I go for the Burnet Rd burrito and beans and avocado

Checked this place out the other day with two other people  around 10 40am. I ordered the nachos and they said they had to double-check whether the beef was ready since they normally only serve lunch after 11am. It was ready so I put my order in for the nachos and requested no jalapenos.    They took a really long time  by the time I got my order the other two people I was with had finished eating their meals completely. I can appreciate that they may have had to warm up the oven or something but that still really sucked.   In short the nachos just weren t very good  minimal flavor and they did give me jalapenos which i had to pick out..plus I got some attitude from the woman who served them to me.  In summary the food was very  meh  and I was quite disappointed with the whole experience.   Would not go back especially when there are so many other good options for tacos in the area
Love this place. The breakfast tacos are always AMAZING  service is crazy fast  and the coffee is surprisingly good for a taco joint... really. Don t come if you want to lose weight though.

Fast and cheap. Their breakfast tacos are delicious with lots of items to choose from. Made after ordered  doesn t compare to other places selling premade ones under heat lamps for same price point. They really fill the tacos  so definitely not the petite torchy size. Their lunch is good too. The dollar something crispy taco is filled to the brim  and actually a good amount of food for the price.   One thing that brought rating down is quality of tortilla. I do eat my tacos there now  no problem as it doesn t take that long to eat a taco or two  but when taking somewhere else  the crispy taco shells always break and or get soggy. The flour tortillas get soggy as well  so because of the thinner less quality tortillas they changed to  this never happened before  and always happens past few years   I do frequent bit less. If having enchiladas  no worries. Also  their tacos are filled out  yay   but their queso is really small for the price  waaah . Still a good one to keep in the mix  esp on a weekend morning    For the most part  everyone there has been friendly and helpful and fast. All this taco writing is making me hungry

I really love the breakfast tacos here  They are yummy    I only have two hang ups about this location... 1.  They don t  wear gloves when making the tacos and their hands go in and out of the food. I had a little bean thumb print on my potato and egg taco.   2.  Some cashiers here seem to really hate being there  they rarely smile even when you are being pleasant with them. It s a little off putting.  I wish that those two concerns would be addressed because I really do think the food is great

After returning from a trip to Hawaii I was Jonesing for some good Tex-Mex and stopped in to the Taco Shack.  I know I know  I should have rushed home to see my two dogs and spring my cat from the local vet where I boarded him.  Why board a cat you ask   In short  he cant be trusted. When left to his own devises he terrorizes and attacks my dogs and god only knows what he would do to the pet sitter.  Back to the Shack.  I ordered 2 Cheese Enchiladas  Rice and Beans  extra Onions and fresh Jalapenos please. Food came out hot  tasty and oh so delicious. There is a small dine in area and a good size outside dinning area complete with shade umbrellas and palm trees.  The Shack has several locations all of which are consistently good  convenient and affordable.

Overall  3.5 stars but bumping it up to 4 for this specific location for serving breakfast til 1pm. YES   3 stars for most of the items on their lunch menu. Portions are a bit small for what you re paying compared to other places.   4 stars for most breakfast items.   4 stars for that one item on the menu that I come back for  the Burnet Burrito. Love the big gigantic breakfast burrito- full of all my favorite things  eggs  potatoes  2 slices of thick bacon  and shredded cheddar cheese.   Unlike others  I actually like their red salsa. It has just the right amount of kick. I always ask for extra  they only give you 2 tiny cups    . Yes  you HAVE to ask for the extra  annoying  right     This location has a cute patio with a few tables  amp  a fountain. Good option for breakfast on a nice day

Meh. I decided to get a burrito for lunch from somewhere other than Chipotle  which is right next to where I work   I was very disappointed with the shack burrito. The burrito was bland and lacked any spice  it also wasn t exactly hot. The two tiny cups of salsa they gave with the burrito had zero flavor as well. I gave two stars instead of 1 because the service was quick.

One of the worst dining experiences I ve ever had. The food I got fell apart and wasn t wrapped properly. Flavor was totally lacking. My girlfriends food tasted strange and old. Didnt even look day old fresh. But all of that wouldn t merit my giving a review. Normally I d just brush off a bad experience but what got me is that my food was made with BARE hands. Neither of the ladies wore gloves and they stuck their hands in the cheese  the lettuce  and other ingredients. This isnt your mama s kitchen  ladies. Its a restaurant. Its on American soil. There are sanitation laws. I would report them for violating safety standards but I hear they re going out of business anyway so it s not even worth the effort.

Taco Shack is to mornings like hangovers are to... uh... mornings   Every day it s rise and shine to go get one tasty carne guisada burrito with a little extra egg.  The staff here is super friendly.  Chris at the register greets me with a smile and some chit chat.  The other ladies working the back know me and usually have my order ready before I even pay.  I love this place  the people and the food.  I can t imagine why anyone would go anywhere else for a burrito.  Try it out if you haven t.  But be warned   It s taco crack   One taste and you ll be back again and again and again.  One thing worth mentioning  while high school is in session  watch out for the crowds about mid-morning.  The place packs in what seems like the whole school around 9AM.
I love the food they serve at the other taco shacks but the cashiers here are very rude and slow.  If you don t mind being served by people who look like they want to be there go for it.
Great for to quickly and cheaply quench a taco craving  Great they have vegetarian beans and good salsa    Nice staff
Amazing crunchy tacos  Fast food done with care and made amazing  They are crunch and greasy. It s a nice treat to have when breaking at work.  I like their salsa too.

Lunch special enchiladas plate was no so great. They threw all the food together on top of each other. Enchiladas were not rolled the way enchiladas are supposed to be. They just threw pieces of meat on top and made it a beef enchiladas plate. Salsa has a sweet taste to it.

I see all the mediocre and I know you re not a true Austinite  because you retards compare it to torchy s  Torchy s is good it s fine it s local  but so is Taco Shack and in all honesty torchy s breakfast tacos are crap compared to the shack. You go to Taco Shack for breakfast tacos. Also  Taco Shack is way more into supporting the local community. So quit your whining transplants or move home.
We use Taco Shack for a monthly staff support breakfast and love it   We give our order to Yoli and she takes care of it.  It s fast  yummy  and the service is great.

Never coming here after 1 visit   Out of chips. Order came out wrong. Told me there was silverware inside. There wasn t. Pointed out my order was wrong. They said they were out of black beans. Didn t put guac on I ordered. Didn t wring up my drink. Sheesh. I can understand a few things wrong. But literally everything   Nope. Not coming back.

My wife and I just waited outside of the Spicewood Springs Taco Shack for about 8 minutes waiting on someone to unlock the doors. We got there at 7 20am and the sign shows they open at 7am  but the doors were locked  we rattled both sets . We waved to a woman inside who appeared to go to the back to tell a manager who took his time coming out. The man was wearing black and just stood there talking to the ladies inside while looking at us. No one ever said anything to us  communicated in any other way or opened the doors. We finally gave up and left. Not only was this location locked up when it was supposed to be open  but they did a great job making it clear they didn t want any business.

They will now put  crispy bacon  on son s breakfast taco  Triumph Caf  is gone  the salsa is fresh  and I can call an order in and drive about half a mile to pick it up.  But they don t have toothpixxxx

Egg shells in my breakfast tacos on numerous occasions.  I tried to give them a break the first time.  But the second time it was absolutely disgusting how many shells were in there.  I will never go back.  Not worth it.

I showed up at the Taco Shack on Spicewood Springs this past Sunday at 7 10am to find locked doors when their website claims they open at 7am on Sunday s. After standing there and knocking on the door for five minutes  only to be ignored by the staff  someone finally turned around and held up ten fingers. WTF    I went to Tacodeli

Loved it  Placed a to go order  was ready as soon as I walked in  greeted with a smile   Couldn t beat the service  Even with Torchy s right next door  I d come back again and again just because they provide great food with excellent service   Had the Burnet Road Burrito oh wow   Delicious

I ordered take-out and they gave me someone else s order  which of course was all boxed up so didn t notice until I got home.  They were not at all crowded  so this was just inexcusable incompetence.  I hope the person who got my order enjoyed it.
Decent enough tacos  should be way cheaper for what you re getting. These tacos aren t elaborate or gourmet and the price should reflect that.

This is the place      I have a heck of an addiction about the breakfast tacos here. Every Friday    Pretty boring taco by some people s desires  but give me that bean  potato  and cheese  a little extra salt and some salsa...YUM    And my kids also share the same addiction. It is our Friday pre-school ritual.   We always call ahead by about 5-10 minutes and they are ready to be paid for and go. The staff gets the job done. No extra frills. Just great tacos  Minimal stool bar seating  several outdoor tables under umbrellas.  Is it Friday yet

An average taco joint  good for a quick meal. I d probably put it at the same category as Chipotle.  The tacos are Americanized  as opposed to Mexican street taco style  and of good size  so you re getting good value for your money.  Their prices are cheap  a breakfast burrito costs only  6.  We went there for breakfast and I found the options ok  perhaps a little uninspiring.  I suppose I shouldn t expect too much for a fast food type of joint.  Anyways  this is a good option for a quick meal  but probably not more than that.

Most taco places in town are mediocre and get three stars  like this one. There are a handful of fours  and precious few fives. If you re looking for The Best  keep looking. If you need a quick or close breakfast or lunch and happen to be near a Taco Shack  you re in good shape.   I mainly find myself here for breakfast. I was religious about my Saturday morning Taco Shack tacos in college  but that was before the five star haven took over the taco scene in town. I like their potato  egg and cheese  as well as their bacon  egg and cheese. Their almost veggie taco can also really hit the spot. Their crispy ground beef tacos make for a simple but tasty lunch. So while everything I ve had off the menu is fine  it s just nothing special  and their tortillas aren t made fresh  that I can tell  anyway .  I ll admit I m not the biggest fan of their salsa or their hours--closed Sundays--but it does the job most of the time  not that I go there all that often anymore.

Sweet Jesus  what the heck makes this place so good   I m not sure why I have this insane allegiance to Taco Shack.  Maybe it s the name  maybe it s because every time I ve gone  the weather has been awesome and the patio was the perfect place to sit.  Maybe they just have the perfect combination of syrup and carbonated water in their fountain drinks.  Whatever the reason  I m a die hard fan.  The breakfast tacos are primo  but my favorite is the crispy taco plate  the meat is juicy  the lettuce is crispy  and the cheese melds everything together to create the perfect handheld meal.  Let s just suffice it to say that Taco Shack is an Austin institution  and you haven t truly lived unless you ve experienced the Shack Taco.  Plus  the place is called Taco Shack...how awesome is that

I was headed to a doctor s appointment at ARC Far West when suddenly I realized I was a   early  and b   hungry. What a lovely surprise to find the Taco Shack nestled away on Spicewood.   I got a Shack Pack to share  three potato and egg breakfast tacos and three bacon and egg breakfast tacos. I loved the hot sauce  soft tortillas  and crispy fried potatoes. Eggs good  bacon good  what more do you want    I generally agree with the reviewer who called these tacos  gringo-style  and  safe   but there is no doubt that they are fresh and made to order and pretty dang good.
I LOVE Taco Shack   The Burnet Road Burrito is fantastic   Their house salsa is also really good.  Being able to dine in their nice outdoor seating is very peaceful  even during the summer.

This will be short and sweet since there s not a lot to tell about Taco Shack. Their breakfast tacos rule. I agree that Tacodeli is da bomb  but Taco Shack is located only about 5 minutes from our house.  It definitely gets crowded  especially on Fri and Sat mornings  but the service is always fast  friendly and efficient. The Shack Taco and Burnet Road Burrito are really good  but my favorite is still potato  egg and cheese with some pico de gallo. Their breakfast potatoes are my favorite in anybody s tacos.  Only thing that makes me give 4 instead of 5 stars is that they are closed on Sundays. I know it s their choice and they re being good to their employees   but that doesn t mean I have to like it.  Minus 1 star   Take that   Very minor beef though. I love Taco Shack

I do my best not to get swept up in fads  so I ve tried to be even handed about my morning taco options  given that I work in a taco triangle of sorts. There is Taco Cabana  which will never win any awards  but is easy on the wallet. There is Torchy s  which drips a hipster vibe and overcharges for everything. And then there s Taco Shack  whose history suggests it has a Cheers-esque quality. I ve tried all three many  many times and at the end of the taco  I throw my support behind the Shack.  Some people are a little upset that owners have changed hands and now  no one knows their name -- but me  I m okay with that. I haven t been going long enough  or consistently enough  for people to know my name... and honestly  I prefer food preparers  not  know my name. I only want that sort of relationship with my neighborhood barkeep. I was determined for quite a while to like Torchy s over Taco Shack  because hey  they re cool and everyone raves and my Secret Santa even got me a  10 gift card for there... so of course they re awesome  right   Maybe Torchy s saves all its awesome sauce for their trendy little trailer  because what you get at the Spicewood Springs location is unseasoned eggs  unspicy chiles and chorizo that tastes like overcooked turkey sausage.  But every time I stop at the Shack  service is efficient  the prices are unchanged and I don t experience sticker shock when I order two to go and an orange juice. Their shack taco is consistently filled to the brim with goodies -- potatoes cooked crisply  fluffy eggs  gooey cheese and spicy  but not overly so  chorizo that makes a party in your mouth. On top of that  their salsa is subtly hot and spreads a slow burn over your entire mouth. It s still tingly as I type this. I d rather they have one salsa option and do it dead on than offer a handful of options and all of them are bland and half-assed.   The sole reason I entertained other breakfast tacos as long as I did was because  at the Shack  there s no drive-thru. You must pull up  park  get out  order and wait. And for a person like me who starts the day 15 minutes late  that s an annoyance. But  at best  it s slight. I swallow it whole because I know soon I ll have tastiness in my tummy.  I ll admit up front  however  that I ve never been for lunch or dinner. I feel no need  as I like my tacos the way I like my men - stout  spicy and first thing in the morning.

the Enchilada plate special was great  it comes with 2 Cheese Enchiladas Rice and Beans with a Drink and tortillas all for 6.99 it was great and a great deal. the staff was nice  and the also have coke zero

This is our go-to breakfast taco joint.  Tacos are always hot and fresh.  Salsa is good  if not anything super special.  When I m really hungry  I get the Burnet Road Burrito  packed with eggs  bacon  cheese and potatoes  loaded up with hot sauce.  DO NOT go to this place for lunch.  I ve been twice and it was horrible.  I tried the fajita chicken tacos and the ground beef tacos.  Both were flavorless.  Stick to breakfast here and you ll be happy.  Go to Taco Deli for lunch.

With all of the choices Austin offers  I d never made it by a Taco Shack location until the other day  and now I know I haven t been missing out on anything. Kinda felt like stepping back in time to my youth  like  back when Taco Bell seemed exotic.  If you like your Tex Mex super-duper old school gringo style  this place might satisfy. For me it held all of the exciting memories of a middle school cafeteria meal. Edible  safe  but oppressive to every grownup sensibility in my goofy head.

I went to Taco Shack for lunch the other day. It was not an experience I would care to repeat.   We ordered two burritos  one carne guisada and the other fajita chicken. At about  5 each they are a good price for lunch. But they were both very disappointing. The meat was dry and flavorless.  The taste of the flour tortillas and shredded iceberg lettuce dominated the burrito  even after I tried adding plenty of  hot  sauce.  Even worse than Chipotle.   Stick to the breakfast tacos.

The hangover healing qualities of a breakfast taco are highly misunderstood and should be explored further.  How can having a couple of breakfast tacos after a night out celebrating a friend s birthday lead to instant recovery   This mystery lies right up there with crop-circles and how did George W. ever get elected  ...but alas  it will likely never be fully solved.  That s ok  as long as Taco Shack keep serving up their  Shack Taco  and their spicy   El Ni o Taco   then I ll keep on having that late night-cap at the bar.     My quick recipe to get you back on your feet starts with their  Shack Taco.    It s a tortilla filled with a heapin  helpin  of chorizo  potatoes  egg  n cheese.  Follow it quickly with one of their  El Ni o Tacos   which is filled with chorizo  beans  egg and jalape os   Wash it down with a cold chocolate milk.  Hangoooover   We don  need no stinkin  hangover
UPDATED  07 15 2010  They re now open on Sunday due to having some competition in the area.  Overpriced for the quantity and quality  AND NOT OPEN ON SUNDAY MORNING

I love Taco Shack  they have what I want. A steak  egg  cheese  and salsa with a starbucks Vanilla latte in the morning mmmmm... That and this is one of the few places I ve seen that makes tortas BIG plus. Don t care about anything else but the food

When you tell someone that one Taco Shack is better than another one  you typically get an eye roll and them thinking you are out of your mind. Prove it you say  Done.  The lady who started the chain was at this location this morning. Maybe she isn t always there but damn those tacos were good. Crispy bacon and eggs a little runny   just the way I like it. I didn t think I really liked Taco Shack but I d say it rivals Taco Deli  which is saying a LOT.   I haven t had their queso yet though  that will be the final test.
Who am I kidding  This place has become a Saturday tradition....  Awesome tacos  awesome patio  never too crowded...  I just wish they were open Sunday

I like the breakfast tacos..but i m Englisgh so my knowledge of tacos is limited.. the tortilla soup is pretty good also... they did get my order wrong however  the guy seemed more interested in my accent.   But enjoyable.

I go for two things  the Burnet Road Burrito and the salsa. My favorite breakfast in Austin. Period.   You take someone from out of town here and the salsa is what they remember. Take 4-6 containers of salsa  add them to the crispy bacon  potatoes  and eggs in the burrito and you ve got a perfect breakfast.   The breakfast tacos themselves are decent  made much better by the afore mentioned salsa  but on their own are nothing special. For anything outside of the confines of the basic breakfast staples  e.g. lunch  fajita tacos  etc  you re best to head else where.
About the most bland crappiest food I ve ever had don t go there unless you like old people. It had no flavor at all.

Breakfast Tacos gone Bad.  Since moving back to Austin a few years back  I noticed Taco Shacks everywhere.  I thought they must be great...I finally tried one and my first thought was WTF.  My second thought was  REALLY WTF     Their tacos are really a 1 2 step above Taco Cabana.  What is all the hoopla about   I work in the area and Triumph cafe is across the street and their breakfast tacos are at least 10x s better...bigger and better.  I hate giving crappy reviews  but really I don t understand.

I will update once I try their lunch.   I stopped by yesterday morning for some tacos on the way to work. Just a quick hop in and hop out. The young lady at the counter seemed nervous but she did really well.  I ended up getting 2 bean and cheese and 2 bacon and egg. They were delicious   The eggs were fluffy and fresh  The beans had a great flavor. I will definitely stop by and get some again.

I ve enjoyed the Taco Shack Burenet Road Burrito for over a decade. To me they are an Austin institution. Always good and consistent. I ve eaten at three different locations. Lamp Light Village and Round Rock. All good and sometimes I just need a burrito

I actually didn t go here. I had a co worker make a food run literally just like a few minutes ago. He said   I m going to make a food run.  Well I feel like I wasted all  6.47 of my little wallet change for two poorly prepared tacos. The meat was soggy and worst of all SALTY  And I HATE salt. Not only does it burn my lips but too much makes me puke. And one bite into the taco my stomach cringed. And the taco had absolutely no flavor. I could ve done better. Your looking for cheap tacos then your better off at Taco Bell or a taco bus. Seriously  Hate that I wasted my money. I still have my other taco right now. I ll give it to a homeless man. He would appreciate it a lot better than I can right now. I m not saying don t eat here because I haven t tried everything but that taco really discouraged me from trying anything else and I can guaranteed you if I was dining in. I would have definitely gave the tacos back. I d probably have to be drunk to like these tacos.

I was excited when a new taco place moved in within walking biking distance from my house because I love a good breakfast taco after a Saturday morning run.   If you want a cheap  2-ingredient taco for less than two dollars  then this is the place. If you want a migas taco  STANDARD at most taco places  I might add  or request an egg white taco  then prepare for blank looks or  we can t do that.  Seriously. You ve got eggs back there - just crack and separate. How hard can that be   The person who I was prepared to hand over money to because I was patronizing this place said  we can t do that.  Twice.   I also tried to ask one of the umpteen Spanish-speaking workers you can see working in the kitchen if they had a different type of salsa or what were their salsa options   Que   was her response. I tried to remember how to ask  do you have another salsa  in Spanish  but I knew if I asked that  I d just get more of the same. As I sucked it up and walked out with a frown on my face  the only guy speaking English who  can t do that  actually ran up to me by the door to find out what it was I wanted. I thought that proactiveness to avoid losing another customer is the only reason this location is getting more than one star.  UPDATE  I ve accepted the fact that I will most likely only ever order the bacon egg cheese taco. For this  I love them. And they are cheap

Our office usually gets tacos from Taco Shack on Fridays  I typically get the El Nino or a bean and cheese taco. The El Nino is okay  same with the bean and cheese. These are just typical everyday tacos  nothing really special about them. The location is good but the suite Taco Shack is in is kind of cramped  they do have outdoor seating. There are better tacos out there  this is just a very convenient location for me.
Horrible service  broken a c  bad management  and mediocre tacos. I ll never go here again. There are better places for sure

I love the tagline for The Taco Shack   Home of the Shack Taco.  Really  Ok  so beyond the quirky branding this place really is average. Walking into this location you get a sense that it used to be something else.   The outdoor eating area is great  with a fountain and large umbrellas  a great spot for lunch. Indoor there are three or four swivel stools like an old diner next to a prepping station.  Now  onto the food. I had the cheese enchilada plate  Yoli s Irresistible Enchilada Dinner   which came with rice  refried beans  and two flour tortillas. The enchiladas were made with cheddar  not Velveeta  which is a plus  but they could have used another minute or so in the oven  or under a headlamp . The cheese on the inside wasn t fully melted. By the time I was finished with my lunch the cheese had completely solidified leaving just a mound in my aluminum to-go dish.   The beans were very runny  I prefer mine a bit more sticky. The rice was cooked just right and was decent. The salsa was good  but nothing to write home about. I was pleased that they gave me two small containers of salsa and two more of pico de gallo.   The total was around  7  not out of this world  but not cheap either.

I can now walk here or to Torchy s. I eat a lot more tacos. Taco Shack is pretty basic. The tacos are good  if not quite as exotic as some places. The service is friendly and quick. Good value. If I have a complaint  it s that the tortillas are sometimes not hot off the grill.

I go to this Taco Shack a lot in the morning  because I go to Anderson  right up the road   and it s on my way to school. I always get two sausage and egg tacos  and they re...ok. Sometimes the egg is runny  or there really isn t a good ratio of egg to sausage  I mean  who wants JUST egg and like on small crumble of sausage    and the service is pretty awful in the  morning. I can t even count how many times I ve had to repeat my order  or wait FOREVER. It might just be me  but according to some of these other reviews...it might not be. However  they re pretty cheap  so it evens out.   So  all in all  it s ok. Just ok.
Tacos are good but falls short compared to other similar taco places. Consistently gets orders wrong and employees are not quick to resolve issues.

Taco Shack s breakfast tacos are among the elite in Austin. Theres nothing like a big sexy Bevo Burrito  Their create your own taco s are very good size for the price. I don t know what the hate is about this place.

An oldie but goodie. I haven t been here in 7 years  but it s just as good as when we used to start our week out every Monday morning. A wide variety of unique tacos  the El Ni o is wonderful for those who like beans - but the fajita steak  amp  eggs and the carne asada tacos are a true treat you won t be able to get anywhere else.

An absolute staple for breakfast tacos.  Any time I can make it there makes a good morning. Service is always great. We call in group orders quite often.  During the school year avoid 8 30-ish till about 9am as it s full of high schoolers headed to class and the line can get quite long even with the service as fast as it is.  The owners are local and are great community supporters who provide a lot to local schools as well.

I have been going to Taco Shack for almost 15 years now and will tell you that my last few experiences have been less than satisfactory.  Don t get me wrong  I LOVE the way Taco Shack tastes... My opinion is it is one of the better breakfast tacos in Austin. BUT 4 out of the last 5 times I have gone to this location  I have had EGG SHELLS in my taco. There is not much worse than biting in to a taco and having eggshells crunch in between your teeth. I feel like I have given it numerous tries  but the problem continues to not be fixed. Be wary of your breakfast tacos from this location  because there may be eggshells with your order.

Good God I had the worst food here today.  Have the people that run this place ever had Mexican food  or have they only seen pictures   The Carne Guisada had no flavor and the rice was crunchy. I ve had their breakfast tacos before and their salsa tastes like cocktail sauce. I usually wouldn t take the time to write a review but the people who rave about this place are probably the same ones who keep Poke e Joe s BBQ in business and we must starve them out.
Best breakfast tacos in town  I eat here every morning even though I live across town. Super fast service as well and the salsa is freaking amazing

I usually get breakfast tacos here because my son loves them. They are OK  no flavor unless you add the salsa. If you are counting carbs  you can get a breakfast bowl  which is basically a taco sans bowl  you re choice of ingredients.

Good old school Tex Mex.  Cheese enchiladas are really good.  Only problems are that the hours it s open should be longer and only breakfast is served on Sunday.  Why not serve everything all day on Sunday

Best breakfast tacos in Northwest hills.  Staff is really friendly.  if you re a regular you might be greeted by your first name.    I always assumed that all breakfast tacos start with eggs and that you add additional items.  I ve walked away a few times with a potato and sausage taco when my intent was to get egg  potato and sausage.  To avoid that problem I write a list on a piece of paper the ingredients  which always includes eggs  and read it word for word.  The outdoor patio is nice but watch out for the birds.  They also have a 4 stools at a bar inside where you can watch the TV.  Not many people take advantage of that so there is pretty much always a seat.  If you re taking your taco s to go you might want to check your bag to make sure go got what you ordered.  I ve found a mistake  but hey we re all human.  Still a frequent customer.

The breakfast tacos here are amazing. Been coming here for over 10 years  The only downside is the breakfast ends at 1 and the prices have gone up over the years. Other than that  best breakfast tacos in town.

Me   Breakfast Tacos  Her  Sure.  Where  Me   Taco Shack   It s right here on Spicewoooo...oops   We passed it. Her   Hey  what about Torchy s  Me   Let s give it a try.  Taco Shack kinda sucks  anyway.....  Wethinks   If you like your breakfast tacos with blah tortillas  runny eggs and burnt bacon  this is your place.

Mediocre burritos  which is really a travesty because how can you go wrong on burritos  They used really weird  lumpy  squishy blobs of chicken and it was just really gross. I haven t had their breakfast tacos  but hopefully they re better than their burritos. If you re in this area for lunch  China Cafe or Triumph Cafe are better bets.

Summary  needs a  variety pack  for breakfast tacos  options are all Tex  no Mex  price so-so  bacon  amp  egg taco solid quality  potato  amp  egg not  size of tacos fine  tortillas medicore  speed and packaging of bulk order good.  I d intended to pick up breakfast tacos for the office at Molca s Cafe on Mesa. where they are delicious  Mexican  interesting  Nopalitos  amp  egg    and on tortillas made RIGHT THEN  but they weren t answering the phone. What can I say -- it was early  and I d fixed this plan in my head of placing a pickup order to Molca s by phone  since that d worked so beautifully the day before. After they didn t answer  I m not sure why I didn t just go there  as I certainly  just went  to Taco Shack  and Molca s is even on the way. I don t know how the phone call became the crux of the process. You get strange things fixed in your head in the mornings  and somehow the whole plan got tossed.  Anyway  I found myself at Taco Shack nearby. Checking out the menu  the selection was less interesting yet more expensive than Molca s  but I d promised a co-worker tacos. To the cashier I said  the office special   gesturing vaguely and explaining I wanted 16 assorted breakfast tacos -- surely they get this request all the time  Where I expected him to pick right up on my theme  he instead hesitated and demurred  not encouraging me to order 4-of-this  4-of-that  2-of-these  6-of those. I was disappointed to have hit a snag so quickly  but I went with his suggestion of a pedestrian pack of bacon  amp  egg and potato  amp  egg  an order that they are accustomed to  though I d have to accept 18  as the packs came only in sixes. My reasoning in going with it was that if they hesitate to take a longer  varied order  it must be for good reason  they re probably not prepared to handle such orders as quickly or as correctly  or perhaps without much sighing and muttering -- who knows  But I stayed in his comfort zone and accepted his counter-offer of three of their 6-taco packs.   These packs are of their most boring tacos  mind you  egg  amp  potato and egg  amp  bacon. What  no Jimmy Dean  Why not just load one up with mashed potatoes  This is according to my preferences  of course  obviously there s a huge market for absolutely mundane breakfast tacos. I can accept other people liking boring food  and this purchase was for other people  so 18 oatmeal tacos it was.   Taco Shack  please offer larger packs with greater variety. I ve never been to a donut shop where I just can t say  two dozen assorted  and be confident in their judgment and execution. You re in basically the same business. Said donut wranglers ask at most one clarifying question   cake   You ll need a labeling solution beyond a sharpie on the foil to handle this well  print up some stickers. You definitely need something more to serve this  office  customer  because the lady after me said the same thing   tacos for the office  you know   expecting you to catch on and smoothly pack up a variety of tacos  in bulk.   So  onto the tacos themselves. Since I willfully and knowingly ordered something dull  I ll speak only about the quality of the ingredients and their preparation. The strip of bacon in my taco was large  not overcooked  and not too salty. I d be proud to serve that strip of bacon. The scrambled egg was on the soft side  but not runny  also totally acceptable and  like the bacon  quantity was fine. The tortilla was a bland sweatshop tortilla  without character or taste  strictly a vessel. The potato  amp  egg fell short of the bacon  amp  egg  the potatoes were soft and oily. Maybe cooking oil not hot enough  Without salsa  there was little to taste. A co-worker praised the tacos  saying that he  liked a nice mound of egg . Without deprecating his tastes  he was pleased.  Taco Shack  really good salsa can make up for a lot. The red stuff provided was inoffensive  but do you have a verde or habanero option I wasn t told about  maybe  That would have helped a lot  If these options aren t offered  I can t recommend adding them highly enough.  The 18 tacos were assembled within about 5 minutes and neatly piled in an aluminum pan with two containers of salsa  napkins and some spoons. It was a nice  sturdy package  and helped keep them warm.   I m rating Taco Shack A-Ok  because it s not to my tastes or cheap enough to make up for that  but I m the one that ordered it  someone else liked it fine  and they did some significant things right.

I am going to give up on hoping that Taco Shack can fulfill my breakfast taco cravings.   I have tried a few times and each time I am left disappointed.   The lack of flavor and seasoning in both the taco and salsa is a reoccurring theme when I order my trusty egg and potato breakfast tacos.  Sure  there are plenty of eggs  which were watery  and potato s in the flour tortilla  but that doesn t cut it.   The salsa tastes like tomato sauce with a little bit of kick.   Even after adding salt pepper and the entire container of salsa  I was still unable to enjoy my breakfast taco.
Is it just me  or are their tacos soggy and bland   There are definitely better options  especially for breakfast tacos.
My sunday doesn t start until I ve had my  Burnet Road  breakfast taco from Taco Shack. They are so quick and their tacos are awesome

Can t tell you anything about their lunch offerings  but their breakfast tacos are hands down my  and my family s  favorites in Austin.  The eggs are never too dry or runny  the bacon is thick and crispy but not burnt  and the potatoes are just right.  Then there is the salsa  mmmmmmm.  I envy their salsa skills.  I normally will use a green salsa on eggs  but their red is the perfect complement to my bacon  egg  and cheese taco.

I stop at this Taco Shack occasionally in the morning on my way to work. I get a bacon and egg taco and an OJ pretty much every time. I like the bacon  when it isn t overcooked and too crispy  and the eggs are usually fluffy and tasty. But the real reason I choose Taco Shack over Torchy s  which is also right on my way to work  is because they have bottled OJ that is easy to take to-go.  Taco Shack isn t anything special  but it is convenient  the salsa is great  and the prices are dirt cheap  a taco and OJ for less than 4 bucks . The biggest problem is that the Shack is inconsistent in all aspects. The service is sometimes fast and friendly  and  sometimes it is slow and cold-shouldered. The food also has some consistency issues. Sometimes my taco is filled to the brim with Bacon and Egg  other times I have a smattering of eggs and a burnt piece of bacon.  They hit more than they miss  but the misses stand out because when they miss  they miss by a mile. If the food and service were more consistent  I would easily give the Shack 4 stars  but the tacos just aren t as good as some others I have had. They are MILES and MILES better than Rudy s b-fast tacos though so that s a plus. I feel like I am rambling a bit  so I will wrap this up.   Pros  Location is super convenient  Two-Ingredient tacos are real cheap  Salsa is really good   Bottled OJ is easy to take to-go  Cons  It s usually packed to the brim with high school students in the AM  Service can be iffy at times  Can be inconsistent with food

I only go here for breakfast tacos or breakfast burritos. I think they re pretty tasty. I get the burnet road burrito with beans in it and its very good. It could use a little bit more cheese in it  but overall everything is tasty.  Their eggs aren t ever runny. The bacon is cooked their so its thick and crispy   I hate places that give me pre-cooked bacon . The potatoes are nice  crunchy and slightly  seasoned. The salsa has just the right kick to it it makes the tacos burrito better.  The only other of their locations I ve been to is the one right by Burnet and Medical Parkway  and I think both are really well run and produce some pretty tasty food.
VERY LONG LINE for the drive-thru that took four score and seven years for a blasted taco.

Here s how I like my tacos  corn tortilla  a lighter  well-spiced combination of ingredients  maybe some chicken with peppers and onions  pork and pineapple  or eggs and avocado...   topped off with some perky  not too spicy  mind you  salsa. If you disagree with my taste  that s cool. But if you like your tacos like I like my tacos  be forewarned  this is not the place for you. I tried to order their nice-looking lunch plate on a weekend and was informed that they don t do lunch tacos on weekends  only breakfast tacos  ...really  why  seriously   so I had to make a stressful snap decision between several flour tortillas filled with some variation of beef and potatoes. I ended up with two heavy  greasy tacos  with salsa that I thought was ketchup at first  not the best start to my Saturday. Think I ll head over to Torchy s for some REAL breakfast tacos.

The place for breakfast tacos if you re on the way to work. Not as good as Taco Xpress but much more convenient on the north side of Austin. Great breakfast fillings in an adequate flour tortilla - if they made the tortillas fresh on site like Taco Cabana they d be darn near perfect. Their non-breakfast offerings are just so-so.

Taco Shack may be my favorite breakfast taco in Austin. Good potatoes  great hot sauce.  This location  however  is wildly inconsistent. 8 times out of 10 it s great. Those other times ... watch out  Taco sizes vary widely. Sometimes the tacos are well made  sometimes thrown together  I get grumpy about tacos which are all a lump of ingredients at one side.  Sometimes the bacon is crisped up nicely  other times its a slab of disgusting fat.  Their coffee is much better than you expect. They must be using a pretty good bean.  The crispy taco plate for lunch is one of my guilty pleasures.

First time at the Shack  not particularly impressed. Got a chicken burrito. It was ok. Not bad  not great  not even sure I d call it  good . it was just kinda there. Nothing to distinguish it.  Heard the service here was friendly  but did not find that to be the case. The place was empty  I walk in and mention it s my first time there. The woman at the counter just stares at me. Says nothing. Oooooookay  I guess I ll try to figure out what s good. I look at the menu  figure I ll play it safe and get a burrito. She takes my order  gives me my change  never smiles once  never thanks me for the order. A few minutes later a guy hands me my food  no smile  no thanks  nothing.  Only reason I went here is they re walking distance from my office. Wish I d just gotten in the car and went to Torchy s. Doubt I ll be back.
