My wife and I stopped by for a quick and tasty lunch. She had tacos and I had cheese enchiladas. Although you dine outside  the patio had the appearance of being clean and attended with fresh flowers and big umbrellas to fend off the Texas sun.
I went here once and thought that someone took a dump in a tortilla and wrapped it in tin foil.  Not very appetizing  especially when considering Torchy s is down the street.

I always stop here on my way to work. I can get in and out of there in like 6 minutes  It s awesome  Bacon is always nice and crispy  but sometimes the eggs can be kind of runny  not every time  but sometimes  I see them peeling their own potatoes when I go in sometimes  I like to see that kind of stuff
Good place to get a breakfast taco.  Nothing fancy just good.
I tried them for the 3rd time today  close to my job .  Not impressed.  It gets worse every time I go in.  The salsa tastes like Pace too.

Oh Taco Shack you capricious mistress. Taco Shack is good for two basic  things  good breafast tacos  and ok lunch foods. I never knew why most of the locations close after lunch and do not reopen till next morning. Why is that  Because they know they d dip into the red ink if they tried to compete with other restaurants for dinner. Put simply  Taco Shack  which I wholly admire for it s homegrown roots and undying support of local Austin schools and businesses  is all about emphemera and speed. Is there anything wrong about such humble practicality  No -- unless you re a snob. It s all about showing up hungover on a Tuesday for a Shack Taco taco  downing it and a medium dr. Pepper  and getting out of there. It s about having 25 minutes for a bullshit lunch  swooping in  gulping down a plate of enchiladas  and peacing out. To get specific  aside from the two dishes I mentioned and the Bevo Breakfast Burrito everything else is pretty generic  but not all bad  today the shell of my taco salad was good...that s something  the guac  Not so much . But that s the whole point -- it s about quick eats. Not gourment dishes. You win some you lose some  accepted casualties here and there. If the food was totally fantastic people would feel guilty swooping in and not taking ample amounts of time to enjoy it.  Despite all this  this Taco Shack today played a lot of The Cars. And Devo. They love 80s New Wave. That s a plus in my book.

went there for the first time this morning  and had the breakfast orlando plate  which was a large amount of juicy scrambled eggs  covered in cheese and all sorts of other things of some description  with sides of fresh avocado  refried beans and a couple of tortillas.  it wasn t beautiful. but it was tasty.   the eggs were soft and juicy and the avocado was really delicious. the tortillas were soft and steamy. the refried beans were completely smooth  and not that great  but i m not much in a bean mood in the morning anyway.  the coffee was good  actually. was quite surprised about that.  overall  tasty  squidgy  cheesy eggs  a guilty pleasure.   -
It was ok. I probably won t go back. food was ok nothing great.

Went in this morning because I am getting tired of waiting 35 minutes in Torchy s death-defying drive-thru.  What an absolute disappointment.    The dummy working the counter rang up two tacos after I had ordered three.  He then failed to give me a cup for my iced tea.  Finally he gave me  4 change instead of the  14 I was owed.  Tortillas are not made fresh  all other taco items are held in a steam table within plain sight of the customers.  No attempt made to hide the dismal  pre-prepared fixin s.  Boo
Terrible. Poor quality. Nothing tastes fresh. Migas plate was extremely underwhelming and very over priced. Oh and there was grease in the bottom  How does that even happen..gross. Never  ever again.

I ve been twice to this location and each time has been a total disappointment.  The food is borderline inedible.  I tried the fajita beef and fajita chicken.  This must be the lowest grade of meat possible.
Love this place.. It s hard to find a place that has Barbacoa Tacos    The potato and egg tacos are awesome   I try to go when I get a chance.

I east here at least once a week for breakfast tacos.  The tacos are custom made while you wait  so they are hot an fresh.  The SHACK TACO is the best and hits the spot everytime.  My son likes the bacon egg potato or the steak and egg.  I ve also had the taco lunch special a few times  the crispy tacos are very good.

Torchy s Tacos on Spicewood Springs has a great location.  Parking is severely limited--we had to park across the  street and had no pedestrian walkway on a very busy street.  The food we ordered came out cold  and the portions were very small  hungry folks should order extra food.  It s a small place with limited seating.  The outside covered pation had comfortable seating in good weather. We will never return because so many better Mexican restaurants are in the area.
I always have great service and awesome food when I go here. The employees are usually very nice and engaging and they make some darn good tacos. I d definitely recommend them.

I get the potato  egg  and cheese taco with either a coffee  which is decent  or a chocolate milk  which is unfortunately not organic and is filled with hydrogenated corn syrup .  The tacos are greasy and taste great.

Perhaps if Austin didn t have such great taco places this would have gotten a better score. There s nothing really wrong with the tacos but they re more Taco Bell style than across the border or something fun and funky. With a Torchy s a mere two blocks away I just wouldn t bother with Taco Shack.

It s not Taco Shack in general that s the problem  the one on 620 is amazing. But THIS one...they DON T SERVE LUNCH ON WEEKENDS. Think about it. You re starving for a burrito or some nachos and it s past noon--shouldn t be too hard  right  Nope  this place will only give you breakfast stuff. All weekend. Most Taco Shacks serve the full menu all the time but for some reason this one can t be bothered--and EVERY SINGLE TIME I have gone in there asking for nachos  my favorite food  they have very rudely told me that they aren t serving lunch yet or at all that day. And somebody else gets my business  every time. I d recommend going to literally any other place.
Good tacos and friendly staff. They make your tacos fresh to order and the hot sauce is yummy. All locations are consistent too.

This Taco Shack used to be better  but  when they switched management a few years back  they lost a degree of personality. They used to call everyone by name  now it s just numbers. The cheese they use tastes a bit strange  and it s not as melted as I would like it. It seems as though they are going for speed rather than ensuring that all tacos are well prepared. The bacon was also fairly uncooked  and I had to remove most of it from my taco..what a waste of money. If you re looking for a good Taco Shack  head on over to Medical Parkway because this one doesn t make the cut.

So  truckin  on Spicewood Springs to work this morning and decided to stop and  re-visit  this particular Taco Shack.  Again  super disappointed  My order   potato  beans and cheese  and  beans and bacon tacos.... the coffee was really good.  The beans were runny  tasteless and a  schmear  on my tortilla.  Potatoes were white  greasy and underdone. Bacon was tasty..... I was a Taco Shack customer when they first opened on the little triangle at Burnet and Medical Parkway.......great tacos.  I eventually went away as a customer when they were not as consistent with the quality and the ingredients in the tortillas were very scarce. I thought I recognized the owner at the register  although he was not very friendly.  When I looked at my receipt I see that I was waited on by   Server  1   so who knows.   I work by Taco Shack  live in East Austin by Porfirios on Holly Street  so I guess if I want morning tacos Porfirios is my best bet.  They serve a taco that is consistenly tasty  full of ingredients and friendly service.
i love their potatoe egg  and cheese tacos. i LOOOOOOOOOVEEEEEEE THIER SALSA

Oh  Pollo Regio  where do I start   I tend not to order steaks at restaurants. The reason is simple  anyone can make steak taste good. Taking expensive  high quality ingredients and making them taste good isn t that impressive. I ve always had much more respect for the humble street food. The windows and carts that take the more humble cuts and put in the work to make them taste like fine cuisine. It s curious to me that I have to pay  50 to have someone cook a steak that tastes exactly like what I can make at home and yet for  9 I can get a pound of carne asada that s likely tastier than anything I ve ever cooked.  Pollo Regio is a humble place. There is no dining room  just a window with a line of hungry people outside of it. Behind that window  there is magic. They take glamorous meats and turn them into something incredible.  I know that there are many people in this world who love chicken and hate red meat but I m still convinced they re lying to themselves. 90  of the chicken in this world is dry and bland and bordering on inedible. Sure  chicken is great breaded and fried or covered in sweet sauces  or both   but chicken on it s own  Usually it s a chore to eat. Something you convince yourself that you like because you know beef is going to give you cancer or impotence or hernias or whatever the study-of-the-day was on the morning news today. I think a lot of chicken ends up on salad to remind you that things could be worse  your chicken could instead be lettuce.  And yet  the chicken at Pollo Regio is none of those things. It is delicious  well-seasoned  and every bite is a treat. Usually  through some kind of magic  they manage to keep even the breast moist. A miracle   9 gets you a half chicken and  13 gets you a whole. Both come with rice and beans but we usually skip those and opt for extra green sauce and an extra onion because we  try to  do the low carb thing. The beans are great  however. Even if you re all about the carbs  I STRONGLY suggest that you skip a tortilla at least once and instead build yourself a taco using as onion layer as your  tortilla . It s life-changing..  What of the 2nd item on Pollo Regio s 2-item menu  The Carne Asada is a feat of culinary science. We ve weighed it before and you re generally getting nearly a pound of cooked beef for  9  plus the sides. The beef is certainly not ribeye but the beauty is that they take low-end beef cuts and turn them into a dish that is a perfect mix of crispy  tender  and delicious.  Regio technically has about a dozen things on the menu but they re all just reconfigurations of these 2 core proteins. I go with my girlfriend and we get a half chicken and a carne asada plate and we always have enough leftovers for at least 1 of us to get an extra meal. 3 meals for  18 is an amazing price to pay for food this delicious.

I love this place. Been coming here for years getting the whole chicken  making tacos with the super soft corn tortilla s and drowning them in green sauce. Mmmm. My husband got the carne asada taco tonight for the first time and those are definitely added into the rotation.

This is our our go-to easy  cheap  fast dinner option. Having unexpected company  Just go grab a chicken and all the fixins for legit  delicious tacos that are as cheap as they are tasty. The chicken is an A  but the beans are an A  . Maybe the best pinto beans in Austin  For best results  get extra beans. Otherwise you ll just be fighting over them and life s too short for that. Highly recommend

My husband and I have a special nod while driving through Austin. No words needed. We stop off a Pollo Regio and always get 2 Taco Carne Asada Tacos with extra corn tortilla and extra green stuff. My husband speaks spanish--so he orders  and I go next door to grab us 2 forty s of cerveza.  WE go under the penny backer bridge and enjoy a romantic  orgasmic meal in our car.  The corn tortillas. A must. The green sauce. oh my god. The beef. I just lust over it. My mouth quivers upon seeing it. The pico. I love it. The grilled jalepeno. PUT IT IN MY FACE.  We don t talk throughout our meal and immediately make out afterwards.  I love you PR

LOVE IT   Cannot rave enough about it. Been here countless times. I do warn that the English is limited but the food is soooo good. And it looks like they are expanding. Green sauce is awesome. We usually get a while chicken. And I LOVE THE BEANS
Mmm riquisimo the creamy green salsa it s really good  i ate pollo regio como dos veces por semana  but cada vez it s more expensive  so now como una sola vez.

Holy Yard Bird BATMAN   This was beyond delicious it was darn tootin  SPANKY    There are in no way enough fabulous adjectives to describe it     The building and area a bit scary. The English spoken at the window is limited. The food however is NOT. The food is astronomical and gastronomically delicious   Only suggestion is more beans and less juice. Rice great    Green sauce delicious.  Limes and onions yummy dummy DOOOO toooo   LOVE IT AND WILL BE BACK      See you soon
So good  A couple of friends showed me this place  oh my gosh  the chicken is amazing and the stuffed potatos will leave you with a potato baby in your stomach. Painful but worth every bite

i highly recommend pollo regio - both the chicken and the carne asada. if you ve been here and love the chicken  try the carne asada  it s like delicious meat popcorn. the rice and beans are good  too   so glad to have found this place  thank you yelp.

Chicken was good. Only problem was I paid and ordered a full chicken. But  I only had one half of the bird. Is this is a new trend  The place was dirty and the employees ignore you being there at the window. Joking and cavorting among themselves while the customers awaiting at window. I am sure their social needs are more important than their job tasks. I paid  15.90. Did l paid enough for a full bird  Or am I supposed to go back an other day to pick up the rest of my order

Their chicken has literally fucked my world up it s so good  one of the consistently best things i have eaten after 24 years of eating in Austin. Get the whole chicken  extra rice and beans and green sauce.

This place totally escaped my radar for a long time  I refer to this place as the  the whole in the wall chicken joint  if memory serves me correctly you order through a small window in the side of a kind of shady shopping center. Its all cash but the chicken is amazing  Super succulent and juicy  Right amount of spices. They give you a heaping of tortillas and grilled onions. Load up on the green sauce  the  agua-mole  its fantastic  I need to get back here and devour some bird.

This chicken is so good  I have heard my co-worker talk about it before and she brought me some today and MAN it was so good  I will certainly get more of this and it is really affordable  you get alot of food
Best Dam whole chicken you cam find  Be sure to bite into the onion that comes with it     You won t be living if you don t.....
larry david would have no scruples choosing this chicken over the palestinian chicken. reminds me of tandori chicken in a way...but spicier and smokier. drool
This is the best taco food truck I have had in a while. The owner is real nice  food tastes natural  and the hot sauce is delicious. I highly recommend this place.
It s now called Capitol Taco  but very good  Same location. Gtrat fried avocado tacos  Also vegie burgers as well. Drinks next door from convenience store. Tables available.

Hidden gem  Quick  tasty  and reasonably priced. Some of the tacos can come out a little dry  but the flavor is unmatched  particularly when paired with the spicier salsa offering. When I went it was an orange colored salsa and absolutely delicious. Will definitely be back  Of the tacos I had I recommend the migas and carnitas the most.
Pretty good food. Portions were large. Definitely can share or save for later. Salsa was great as well they use some chipotle which I ve never had and not a fan of but was pretty good.

This is my go to for quick Mexican food. The ladies that run this taco truck are lovely. I ve just tried the tacos and they are good. Also you can call ahead and then pick up so you don t have to sit it your car.
Yumm these were so good  I had the potato egg and cheese and it was so good  The red salsa is my favorite

We LOVE Lolita s  The baby and I hit the taco truck multiple times a week after dropping off the big kids at school. The eggs are seasoned well and not runny. The green sauce is sooo spicy good  My husband likes the steak and cilantro tacos. And the big kids really like the bacon  cheese  amp  bean  refried black beans with plenty of flavor without being spicy . Not expensive  always friendly and ALWAYS yummy  And right down the street

The food truck with hand sanitizer is behind the Exxon on the corner   you have to walk a little uphill that has a beautiful  shady oak tree and two sturdy picnic tables and singing birds.  The workers speak very good English and explain the dishes happily.  I ordered the pambazos  and for the first time.  It s like an enchilada  but the dough is different -- more like a toasted hoagie bread.  They had special meat today and I chose the chunky and moist chicken fajita.  The mild sauce is very flavorful.  The wait is a little longer  because they cook fresh.  It is somewhat large and presented beautifully in a clam.  For  8 I wouldn t rush back for a sandwich  however it would be a wonderful treat.  Enjoy
Don t ever eat here the food is terrible They don t have beef fajitas and the kind of meat they have is steak and it s real tough.

I m not normally in this area  but the one day I was I needed gas and pulled into this Exxon station. As soon as I got out of my car I could smell some amazing food. I immediately knew I was going to get tacos from Lolita s. I went with the tacos al pastor and the cashier recommended I try the homemade corn tortillas and I m so glad she did  I ll definitely be stopping by this truck anytime I m even close to the Cuernavaca area of Westlake Hills.
Yum yum - always worth driving down Cuernavaca. The ladies in the food trailer are super nice. Order via phone amd you ll get the good stuff even faster. One of the best breakfast tacos in the West.

Not to disrespect anyone who has tried having food service on Cuernevavca  but thank God we finally have a taco stand. I stopped to see what was happening and had the al pastor burrito for  6. Without having seen the  3 tacos  I can t imagine they would have this much meat in them as well as a generous portion of beans and rice. The al pastor was on point. She uses black beans and the rice in it was good too. Green sauce was a little hot  but for once a red sauce outshines the green.  It s rich and thick. Reminds me of Torchy s sauce  although way better. The guy in front of me bought a torta. It looked huge. I may have to try that next time. She said she has tamales on Saturdays.  1 for your typical corn husk masa style and occasionally she ll have a more Central American plantain tamale for  3. I didn t post a picture of the breakfast taco menu  but they do that too. Curious if she ll have migas sometimes.  Very much worth the stop.
Excellent tacos. They make their salsa fresh and it is AMAZING  Everything I ve had here is delicious.

Great breakfast tacos and enchiladas   Friendly family run place. It s all homemade in house. The sauces are also made there    Everything is made to order.... So portion and salt level and heat level can vary. But if you just ask for how you want it  they will gladly make it just like you like    I haven t ventured far from my regular food  but I m excited to try the Tortas. They look so good.  They are fast and put love into the food   I never wait more than a few minutes. You can call in orders. Although I never see people wait more than about 5 minutes  even for bigger orders.  These ladies are amazing I m so glad this place is close to me

These guys are the best  It took me a year of living in the neighbourhood to try it  definitely guilty of judging the book by its cover  but I m glad that I now know how flipping delicious these cuernevaca truck stand tacos are  - family run  super friendly  pretty cheap. . Things are made to order so much they can tweak the spice levels to get them perfect for you. They make the salsa here too. They always have two kinds - a mild and a spicy - And it s always worth getting both    Mostly open week day lunchtimes - I ve not seen any activity in the evenings  definitely worth sampling if you need lunch in Lake Hills - it s in a bit of a weird spot behind the Exxon gas station - but they have shady picnic tables to eat at  and the gas station next door to grab cold drinks from.   I love a good food truck almost as much as I love good Mexican food. Win Win
I hits this food truck every week cuz it s on my pool route... They have some great tacos and their hot sauce is just right
No idea where these couple of low reviews are coming from... I ve had tacos all over Texas and these are some of the best. Super nice family  too.
So far I haven t been disappointed regarding the food. The have great service and are easy going when treating the costumer. Best food truck around here.

Not really exceptional as other reviews would have you believe. I tried the enchiladas and could have done better elsewhere. Making an out of the way trip is not worth the effort in my opinion. Maybe if the location was convenient  I d try something else.

The food is great and the service is good too. I love the sopes. They re huge  The carnitas taco are even better  They have shady picnic tables to eat at. They arent open for dinner so that s bummer but they re open for lunch. They are usually closed by 2pm.
Probably my favorite taco place. Meat is flavorful and the hot sauces add just the right amount of kick.
No to tasty  really heavy on the food grease. Also Instead of something that should of took 10 min took over 35 min  just a really bad first impression.
Terrific neighborhood taqueria with killer tacos  of course   tortas  enchiladas  house made salsas. Affordable and authentic. Breakfast tacos all day

Had a really great time. A group of my 8 friends sat comfortably outside on their patio. Their el captain tacos were amazing and their drinks too. The manager checked on us and was super nice. I ordered a drink that was no longer available and he checked with me and made me an awesome drink. We all really enjoyed this restaurant. Definitely coming back.
They re alright.   A bit pricey   6 for a vegan taco  and they add cabbage and onions every time without asking.   Good atmosphere  plants  music.

Wow. If you like  Mexican  food completely DEVOID of flavor  then Salsa Limon is the place for you.  We haven t been going out a lot other than our local downtown spots since it s been nice to be cooking back at home after being gone for so long  but came here on Friday night. HUGE MISTAKE. The food is terrible  and this new restaurant will go the way of the doomed popsicle place before it and be closed soon enough.  Their preferred ingredient here is AGUA. The queso and salsa were watery and bland and the  margaritas  tasted like someone squirted some lime in some water and splashed tequila on top  the  frozen  one was like a slushy that had been sitting out all day  also  both drinks were served AFTER the food arrived . The guac was nothin  but mashed avocado and the  salsita salad   which is advertised as having  mixed greens  arrived with only iceberg and--you guessed it--the most watery and flavorless dressing imaginable. We got it with barbacoa  and this places manages the miraculous feat of of making something as special as barbacoa taste boring and lifeless. The El Capitan taco was the only thing that showed signs of life and seemed to have seasoning on it. Our daughter s quesadilla was standard and her beans tasted like they came straight out of a can.   The benches are significantly lower than the height of the table  so eating is awkward. Service is friendly-ish at the register  but stops at that. Honestly  we cannot even believe that this place has lasted this long. Are they just hoping for the El Patio patrons unwilling to wait to meander over  We d highly recommend just going up the block to Torchy s instead.

I didn t realize there s a new taco place near the campus. It s basically a taco place with bar  very modern interior and plenty of space  But their taco is really really tasty  I especially like the tortilla a bit toasted with a bit crispy texture  The cheese was so so satisfying  And please don t forget about their sauce  it s really spicy but I m the boss with the sauce

New to Austin  coming from Fort Worth. Great spot on North Campus for quick tacos  great margaritas  plus a covered patio   tacos. brunch. palomas. margaritas. breakfast all day.    chips  amp  dips trio  11     breakfast taco w chorizo  4     chilaquiles  9     taco  4.25     el capitan taco  4.75     agua de rancho  7     frozen margarita  8     agua fresca  41 - horchata    austin exclusives    lupita  vegan   4     paloma fizz  9    Overall  I would come back. Everyone was very nice  the food was decent but wasn t blown away by the carne asada I got in a couple of tacos. Chilaquiles was incredible  get the chicken with it
Super delicious  Wanted a breakfast taco at noon and boy was it amazing. Would definitely come back

Only went in for a margarita and service and both were terrible. Ordering is confusing and you get treated poorly when you finally figure it out and the kiosks don t work. There s a sign that says  smile you re on camera  but the employees need a sign that says  smile you re in customer service .  Won t come back to try the food and do not recommend.

This spot just recently opened up on West Campus and I personally think it has a lot of potential. I would recommend skipping the tacos and get the Campe n Burrito instead. It was a hefty portion  but super flavorful and I didn t think I was going to enjoy it as much as a did  But if you do get a taco  get the El Capitan and order it with your choice of meat. They also have margaritas by the PITCHER  which they make a little on the strong side  so drink with caution.   Oh as a plus  they also have a parking lot  Which is rare for traveling anywhere near West Campus.
the granjero tacos were amazing   Fresh goodness spilling out if homemade corn tortillas. Frozen mango margarita was delightful.  Wonderful neighborhood taco joint

Decided to try something new on ubereats and this place was very disappointing.  I even added extra Asada to my burrito and there was still barely any asada in the burrito.  The same with the asada quesadilla.  The quality of meat was definitely not good.  Chipotle s way better.  Highly do not recommend.

Came here opening day and my experience was flawless. I got the burrito with carne asada. The tortilla was toasted which gave it a nice texture. The meat was perfectly seasoned and not too oily at all. The rice was just right. I paired it with a variety of salsas. The habanero has a kick  and couldn t stop putting it on the burrito. I washed it all down with a frozen marg with a grand marnier floater. These frozen margs will be perfect for the summer as they have the consistency of a slushy or icee. Can t be wait to try the other options on the menu.

The atmosphere is super nice with an eclectic modern vibe.   I got the Barbados which was super tasty and a good amount of complexity in the flavor profile.   The chicken in the chicken taco was seasoned well but the taco as a whole was underwhelming. It might have tasted better with more add ons but that would ve been  6 for a small taco.   Overall I was unimpressed with how small the tacos were for the price and how the flavor profiles weren t astounding or complex

I really liked Salsa Limon. The space is well designed  the tacos are excellent  with a lot of vegan and vegetarian options  the staff are friendly  and the prices are good. Their happy hour is EXCELLENT - Monday-Friday  4-6pm  no weird hours    5 rocks margaritas which are house-made  and super cheap beers  I think like  4    . Honestly  no notes. I got the mushroom taco and the carnitas taco and that was more than enough for dinner. The salsas are hot and made fresh. I don t know if this location is just cursed because I also liked the popsicle shop that was here before and nobody went there  but Salsa Limon is worth checking out

Came in looking for good chilaquiles near campus. Ordered horchata  chilaquiles with mushroom filling  and the barbacoa and chicken tacos. Horchata is good but has a tiny bit of cinnamon sediment  but it adds to the flavor. Chilaquiles are absolutely delicious  especially with a bit of red salsa added on top. My partner had the barbacoa and chicken tacos  which he liked quite a bit  They had 4 types of salsa  all solid and the spicy ones definitely packed a punch. They did forget the egg on my chilaquiles at first so they gave us free guac and chips  Horchata also had free refills  Their happy hour special looks great as well. My only  slight  complaint is the price  but the quality of ingredients justifies it for me. Will be recommending Salsa Limon to my friends

This little place was a pleasant surprise  Drinks were pretty good  tacos were yummy and the overall vibe was pleasant  My only tiny gripe was portion size but that s a personal preference  I enjoyed my sangria and left in a good mood. I would recommend this place if you re on Guadalupe looking for good Mexican food

My family gave this place a chance. The menu was definitely hit or miss. The barbacoa quesadilla was a HIT  It seemed a bit pricey at  10.50  but the portion size  including side of rice and refried beans  is enough for two people to share. Skip the carne asada tacos that were  5 each. Queso was unremarkable...tasted like melted Velveeta  and could have used a bigger portion of chips . If you re looking for value  skip this place.

I paid  12 for a bean burrito. Told the cashier I had never been there before and she recommended a couple of things  including the El Campeon burrito. I m a huge barbacoa and burritos so I was excited to hear that option. I kid you not  had two bites of meat inside of it. It was 70  bean  15  rice  10  creama  3  avocado  2  meat. Tortilla was fresh and flavors were decent but aside from that I am very disappointed. Maybe their tacos are what s keeping them in business but wouldn t gamble coming back to this place.

I ve been to Salsa Limon twice now  and I have I to say it s my new favorite taco joint in Austin  Their chicken tacos are DELICIOUS  So tender and juicy. Their tortillas are fresh and fantastic. I would also highly recommend the Paloma fizz  and the Jamaica agua Fresca- so refreshing and not overly sweet. Overall you can tell a lot of thought went into the menu  and decor of the place. I will be spending a lot of time and    at this place

Came here for breakfast to see if we could salvage a terrible breakfast at 24 7 diner. It turned out to be a  best of the worst contest.  We ordered the chilaquiles and migas. Get this  they get tortilla chips and ladle sauce over the top  sprinkle their toppings and call them  chilaquiles  Fail. The migas are an embarrassment. They should just call them  tortilla strips with scrambled eggs. Over cooked eggs  that is. I was excited to visit this place after reading about them online. The sign up front says  Help wanted  it needs to read  Help Needed  Also  someone in the kitchen wearing airpods  just like the last place we visited. It s a gross look.
legit. They have chile piquin salsa   Very few places in Austin can say they have this on their tacos. Fresh tortillas too

Just like the one in Dallas  this place was amazing and lived up to the hype  We enjoyed our tacos and I think I had the best chicken quesadilla I ve ever had in my life. The margaritas were solid  not my favorite in town  but pretty good . The staff and ordering process was a bit unorganized but may just be new growing pains. The patio is super cute and shaded. We ll be back to satisfy our taco craving

This place is mediocre at best  The drinks were subpar and the food was wayyyyyy tooo cheesy  overpriced for what your getting  Totally disappointing  The seating was very small  tables were small and the whole ambience was totally juvenile

Umm WOW  My boyfriend and I went to this place twice over the weekend after trying it for the first time because it was so delicious. I got the chicken tacos and he got the El Capitan tacos with chicken. The crispy cheese on the el capitan was insane  I tried a bite  and the chicken was marinated to perfection and not chewy at all  my biggest fear is chewy chicken...bleh  . Okay and the refried beans were some of the best I ve ever had. The michelada was great and atmosphere was very relaxed and enjoyable  could have had better music though . PLUS  The second time we went we had to wait a little longer for our food and they gave us free queso and chips and were so attentive. Another highlight was the salsa bar. They have 4 housemade salsas that are made daily that you can self serve  my favorite is the hottest one  so amazing . Overall this might be one of my new go-tos in Austin. Highligh highly recommend

My friend and I have been waiting for this spot to open near campus since a lot of places have been opening and closing due to COVID. We finally stopped in on a Friday afternoon for breakfast lunch. There are ordering kiosks to the left of the entrance inside that I wish I had noticed before ordering at the counter. The employees still seem a little lost and I tried ordering a breakfast burrito with bacon with a Bloody Maria sub vodka. With tip it ended up being  25 and I ended up with a regular burrito that had beans  rice and bacon. The burrito was still good but I was just disappointed when I was expecting breakfast. I didn t say anything because my food had already take awhile and I didn t want my friend to have to wait. She ordered chilaquiles and said it was good but spicier than she expected and before she could eat much of it her plate kind of looked like mush. The salsa was decent but it s a very small portion as pictured and it s not complimentary. The bloody Marias were really good and don t have that tomato juice texture that most bloody Marys have. The parking is very sparse so you may have to street park and walk if they are busy and I wouldn t come here with a big group. The patio looked nice but it was a little hot to sit outside. I would come back to try breakfast but I ll have to prepare for the price.

The tacos were super good   For me and my boyfriends first time we really enjoyed it and everything was delicious. I love the cheese added to the tortilla  Chips  amp  queso was also pretty good. Horchata was great  Only thing was it was a bit expensive our total for 2 people came out to  53. Which i find a bit much for just 2.

Upscale Chilachilas in Austin  The taste is exactly like the one I had in Mexico. Added chicken and it was great. It was accompanied by a La Baby - potato  cheese  refried beans  crema  avocado  sandwiched between corn tortillas - very filling and vegetarian for  5. There was also a house margarita - another winner  simple and not too sweet.
I will definitely go back very tasty.. Went for lunch but have to go back to for a drink and tacos.. Breakfast tacos all day is a plus.

Ordered the strawberry frozen marg  chicken taco  and barbacoa taco. It was a bit pricey at  20 for everything but overall everything was very tasty. They also have a salsa bar with very spicy habanero sauce which I I enjoyed but am still suffering from 10 mins later. So enjoy with caution

I try to visit Austin at least once a year  and I am always on the lookout for new  fun restaurants to explore. This place is in a great location  close to downtown and other pretty  walkable neighborhoods. The servers were enthusiastic and friendly  and helped me decide what to order. The wait time wasn t long at all and the seating was eclectic and comfortable. Very  Austin  vibe. The frozen margaritas were refreshing and delicious. I stayed classic with a burrito  but next time I ll be sure to check out the El Capitan  or the all day breakfast. Standout was also the guacamole  with the perfect balance of creamy and chunky  and full of lime flavor. I can t wait to head to this spot again next time I visit

I was so excited for this opening. I drove past it every day and watched as the building got remodeled for the opening. I finally had the opportunity to try it yesterday and was really disappointed. I got the Capitan with asada  la baby with chorizo  and a barbacoa taco. I also had queso  which was probably the best thing on the menu  although the chips were too salty which is the opposite of most places  All the tacos were just bland. Not horrible  just not much flavor. I think my expectations were just too high. The corn tortillas were great but the flour tortillas were thin and just like the raw ones you get at the HEB refrigerated section. Very thin. I may try a return visit for breakfast tacos but honestly  I m not sure I want to go out of my way to try them. Very disappointed.
I go here far too often. The great food  and incredibly attentive staff keep me coming back.

Such a fun atmosphere  The cashier gave a great recommendation of the potato quesadilla as a vegetarian option  it was super tasty  especially dipped in the green sauce  overall  the service and food were both outstanding and I will definitely be visiting again soon

I don t know if the cook knows how to make a taco. They were mediocre tacos but they took an hour with 4 customers in the restaurant. Plus it s 5 bucks a taco. Save your self time and money by going and getting tacos from a local truck. It ll be done in 5 minutes and half the price. Would not recommend to friends. Do not pass go. Do not collect 200 dollars 0 10 would not recommend
Capitan Asada  Barbar  are my go-to s  fresh  great margs and great atmosphere  must try.

This place is the real deal  food-wise and in all other ways. Austin has a bunch of taco places but none of them are as authentic as this one. The decor is so thought out  every detail makes being in there just feel nice. The service is excellent  and I especially love supporting a brown-owned  queer-owned Mexican restaurant  especially in Austin when so many Mexican places are owned by white people. The food is incredible  I especially love the La Baby  the chilaquiles  margaritas  and the micheladas. The patio makes it a pretty place to hang with friends on a nice day.

Bad  gross food  slow service  ordering confusing and they kept taking our numbers despite bringing out one dish at a time. Chef put some sort of sauerkraut on my quesadilla. For people who hate Mexican food  I would recommend Torchy s or anywhere else.
Chilaquiles and the tacos were awesome   Great food  drinks and vibes. Can t wait to go back.

Went to the grand opening last week and I m excited to come back and try their breakfast tacos  The food and the service were both fantastic. Our table got an assortment of tacos and salsas  along with a pitcher of margaritas. The Jalapeno and the Piquin salsas were both fantastic  the Jalapeno being the shining star  IMHO . It was a perfect balance of bright citrus with a kick on the backside. I enjoyed getting to meet the owner and hearing his story and food inspiration growing up in Oaxaca.

my first Salsa Lim n experience was awesome  i got the breakfast burrito w cheese and avocado   a pitcher of margs for some friends and everything was very fresh. the margs were sweet and not too strong. glad this spot opened up and looking forward to returning soon

Unpretentious drive-through charcoal chicken in South Austin.  We always get the whole chicken meal  comes with fresh tortillas  grilled onions  brand  and rice. The price is far more reasonable than fancy hipster Mexican chicken places north of the river  and the taste is just as good.   They also do burgers and fries  but the chicken is what draws loyal fans.  I can t believe some bitter yelpers are complaining about poor customer service. This ain t no five star restaurant  it s a cheap and greasy neighborhood take out spot.

Pretty greazy.  The only person able to speak English here was a very young entitled guy that obviously couldn t care less about taking care of customers.  The chips were awful  way way way too thick.  Drink was very diluted. Chicken was over priced.  Go to Sam s or Costco for a whole rotisserie chicken for under  5  every day.  Green sauce has a good flavor but it is super spicy hot.  Burns your tongue.  They don t have any salsa that isn t super hot.  Their borracho beans are good with cilantro but they shouldn t add pork.   They ve really gone up to unreasonable prices.  Come on man

Good food but the past two times their kitchen was closed an hour before the restaurant was. Change your hours if you stop making food at certain time.   We re still open but not making any food...Then Close. Pretty Simple Solution.   Just drove to another location to see if it was company wide. Nope just Oltorf.
All of the sodas dont have many of the drink all it was is gas it felt like it was mostly water in my drink if this was the only restaurant in town I wouldn t go I would rather eat at home

HORRIBLE SERVICE. THEY MADE ME WAIT FOR OVER 30 MINS FOR RAW CHICKEN  Then had the audacity to not want to refund my money. With proper receipts and matching cards   Will never eat here ever again. And ill rage a campaign of truth on this shit fuck chicken shit fuck ass place. Dont eat here.
Great place for authentic  like your dad  amp  t os outside bbqing  meat. Super delicious  amp  satisfying.  amp  the drive through makes it an easy go-to when you don t feel like cooking.

I always get the Rico Bowl - everything was off. Starting with my order being taken  then the person working the window... it goes on... you get the idea. The rice was  I ll just... say  strange   to be nice. I m not going to bash them  but definitely go to the one on Stassney  NIGHT AND DAY

Delicious 1 2 chicken meal. didn t disappoint  everything was yummy. rice was a little bland  but the bean sauce fixed that up nice. Very satisfied thanks to the cook. the chicken was perfect  note that Jamica was on menu but not available    definitely will be back

Wow  I m pretty floored by this place. I ordered ONE  16 and two small sodas and the woman rang up 2  16 and two small sodas. My card got changed and I asked her why it was so much. She said two soups and I told her I only ordered one. They hadn t even made the soups yet and she told me she couldn t refund my card. That can t be true. I tried to protest but I was in a rush. If the manager or owner is reading this please respond with your policy to employee error.

They close at 9 46  not 11pm as listed on Saturdays. The cook was nice enough to come out the back door after I was at the speaker for 3 minutes in total silence and tell me  we close it  and walk back in. Well....

Here s a hint. When you order  put on your handbrake and turn off the car. This is not in anyway fast food.   I bought the MexMix... Chicken and what they consider fajita meat I guess.  I received a glorified wing and some sort of a breast thing. The wing was tasty  yet the breast thingy was so dry. The fajita meat was just a lil off  but my dog loved it. Not impressed for  11 and change.    I will say that the borracho beans are great  but I don t know any Hispanic that could eat the rice.   Just my opinion.

We were craving a late breakfast and The places we wanted to try were closed so we pulled I here because of the full parking lot.  We ordered a whole chicken meal  grilled chicken with rice and bean. This is awesome grilled chicken  very tasty and very ethnic. And the staff are so friendly today.  Y all come and enjoy.

I ve heard great things about this place and finally wanted to give it a try while in Austin.  I ordered the carne asada with charro beans and plantains.  The steak was very tender and flavorful.  They definitely give you plenty of tortillas too but they are not homemade.  The wife ordered chicken tostadas and she loved them.  The chicken had a ton of flavor.  You definitely get your money s worth as the food portions are not small.  The green sauce is phenomenal and I could eat it by the spoonful

As some of you may or may not know  the hamburger special at most Mexican restaurants is damn tasty.  There are several reasons for this   1.  They are usually hand made and not frozen patties  I m pretty sure the one at Pollo Rico falls into this category since the patty was not totally uniform--it had character .    b. They will usually be hot and fresh  since they are not often ordered  I had to pull forward and wait for my burger and fries today.  The fries were screaming hot  the burger was fresh off the grill .  iii.  They will taste more like a homemade hamburger  see item 1. .  All of these statements were true of the hamburger special at Pollo Rico.  The burger was so big  it is still sitting here half eaten and they gave me so many fries  half of them are sitting here as well  they may find themselves in a homemade breakfast taco tomorrow... .  They also gave me a HUGE pickled jalapeno  see photo .  I was a little to scared to use it  but it was an interesting condiment to include.  Oh  it was also a surprise cheeseburger  which was a pleasant surprise  since the menu clearly just said  hamburger special .    I am trying to try all the new menu items  though of course  the whole chicken special with the rice  beans  and big ole onion is the bomb.  I want to try the carne asada baked potato next time.  Also  this Pollo Rico has in-house seating  most of the locations are drive through only.      I will forever miss Al John s  the drive-thru and eat-in pizza place that used to be here  but if someone new had to move it  at least it was Pollo Rico.

The food is delicious.   Great tacos    However they are always out of everything.  Twice now I ve gone and they were out of queso.   They said it s homemade    so it will take at least 10 minutes before it s ready.   So not sure how that works.  Like do you have to call ahead to order it     Today I went and they were out  so instead I ordered a taco and they said they were out of chicken as well.   So confused why they re open if they don t have anything on the menu.
Probably the best beef fajita taco I have eaten at these Pollo...Regio  Rico....El Rey de Pollo restaurants.

Eh. I ve never been to this location  as I usually go to the stassney location  but this one is very near my job so I went on my lunch break. Ordered 3 barbacoa  two pastor and one chicken - the pastor was decent and very flavorful but the barbacoa was so fatty that I gagged after biting into it. Huge strips of pure fat and fatty pieces - they took up like have the tacos. I also get their breakfast tacos sometimes and it s the same story - while the bacon and egg is tasty  the bacon pieces they use are sometimes all fat  to the point where I can t eat it without picking those pieces out because I will be sick. I wish the staff would take more care to trim the meats they use - a small amount of fat is okay but no one wants to bite into a huge slimy mouthful of fat. I ll stick to the stassney location - from what I can tell  it s far superior to this one.

I get the family meal which is good for half a week or so. The family meal includes a whole chicken with an onion  tortillas  charro beans and rice along with red and green salsas. But the best thing is the creamy green sauce. You can make a chicken taco with onion and green sauce. I do recommend eating their chicken that way. If you do order the family meal  make sure you order extra beans and rice. The beans and rice which is included in the meal is not enough. This location has a drive thru although it does need a little technology update. The inside of the restaurant is bit of a dive but there is a salsa bar inside. Lo and behold  a big gallon of the green sauce.

Went again cause it s close. Get home and no salsa called and they said if there s a jalapeno inside you dont get salsa . How the hell do I know which ones yall put a jalapeno in . So I should ask does a jalapeno come in it   Ridiculous . Salsa should come with everything . This place thinks it s salsa is gold   Other places have to go cups next to salsa and don t care what you take . Your better off going to any Mexican restaurant
Rico bowlio.  The ladies are super friendly here and the service is always top notch.  One of the best fast food places i ve ever been too.

I have had El Pollo Rico recommended to me many times before  but never really been up for it. Something about the  asada al carbon  on the sign... a Spanish title is par for the Mexican course  but the Spanish subtitle always kind of intimidated me  because it s like they re not even trying to communicate with non-hispanohablantes. But my friend and I were trying to work out a place to meet  and I said  any place that has good tacos around there    And here we are.  I ordered  13  the  taquitos  and since they re using accurate Spanish they really are just diminutive tacos  in a set of 5. The al pastor was magnificent. Well-seasoned  on fresh tortillas and there were 5 of them for  6. That s about the same as Taco Cabana s  street tacos  except they re made with higher-quality ingredients and an order gives you 5 instead of 3.  I also was very happy to discover  the sauce . I speak of the creamy spicy green jalape o sauce that I had never encountered before I was in Austin  but a few restaurants have. EPR s was not as creamy as Tacodeli s but the flavor was there  and any restaurant with  the sauce  is doing something thunderingly right in my book.  So far  so good... nice restaurant  good al pastor  tasty sauce. But when I was treated to my lunch companion s leftovers... daaaang. The chicken is very good. I consider myself an excellent griller of chicken at home. I always marinate  always use charcoal  and take pride in my crack-level-addictive chicken... and this chicken was astoundingly  tremendously better than my char-grilled chicken on the best day.  Great place for food. Not one to forget.
Just straight up good grilled chicken. Enough said. Get a few pieces though because they re on the smaller side. The tacos are pretty decent as well. Give  em a try.

Awesome place for a great meal with a great deal  The carne asada combo is delicious. My co-workers bought the chicken combo plates and they said it was really delicious  I will definitely come here for lunch another day on my out to lunch day from work. The best part is you can smell the good food when you drive by to it. Each meal comes with beans  rice  corn or flour tortillas. You get a lot food for one meal.  Don t be afraid of the place because the outside appearance if you judge a book by it s will only keep you away. If you don t judge you will find a treasure of great meals for a great price  The beans awesome too    I didn t get to eat the rice because I was full. But even the rice looked delicious.

Great grilled chicken. The half chicken meal is already packaged up  you don t wait for them to grill a chicken   so it takes about 30 seconds to get served. Good for a short lunch.  They have other food  but it s not great. The sign says chicken 3 times  and has a picture of a chicken  so that s not a surprise.

3 taco plate pollo y carne asada with refried beans and rice  added cheese and avocado to each taco for .25 cents each. Melon Agua fresca. They refused to sub charro beans for refried beans  ended up getting a less expensive meal just to avoid charros.  I liked the refried beans and the rice but its my fault for not clearly getting the answer to what is on the taco besides the meat   My carne asada taco was so full of tiny bits of chopped union that fused with the cheese it was unsalvageable   The chicken taco didn t have all the onions but it wasn t that great. 3 stars for the refried beans and rice but the tacos won t make me rush back.

Decided to check out El Pollo Rico on a recent Austin trip because El Taquito was slammed with people... I should have just roughed out the crowd. When I pulled up they were out of a lot of things so I opted for their cinco taquitos. When I paid my  7  the attendant practically threw the plate in my window   gotta love that service  . The beef was dry and I noticed that compared with other photos that they were sheisty in the meat department. The green salsa was too hot to consume but I know of a lot of people who would love this. I ll try to make it back at an earlier time when there is more of a selection.

I paid 9 bucks for a half chicken with rice n beans. And the chicken was super dry and very boney.  There was hardly any meat on it. Big rip off       I know sometimes they can be good or so I ve heard  i just dont know if thats currently the case anymore.  My experience was pretty tasteless.

I ve tried almost every item on the menu and my top picks are the Chicken flautas  Torta combo  with beef   Papa asada  also with beef   Pollo asado plate  and the Carne asada plate. In that order. And all of these come with the salsa verse  green sauce . Which is amazing.  As far as the service goes  sure they could be speedier  but as for the reviews I ve read about the staff being tools  I ve never gotten mean-muggin  looks or unfriendly service. Oftentimes  I even get complimented on how cute my dog is. So I don t know what those people are talking about.  My suggestion  Try it for yourself. If you get shitty service then  yelp about it. Surely you won t be disappointed with the food  I never have been

I wanted some Mexican food to take home so I stopped at the drive thru and ordered the grilled chicken  amp  beef combo dinner.  Price was good - just over  10 including tax.   Everything was good. Green sauce is very spicy - red is mild.   You get a lot of food - chicken breast quarter  some strips of grilled fajita meat  rice  charro beans  corn tortillas  grilled onion  red  amp  green salsa  amp  1 2 lime.   The beef was slightly overcooked - but that s par for 95  of the Mexican restaurants out there.   I have not ever had better grilled chicken. It s marinated  amp  seasoned just right.   Their rice  amp  beans are also very good. Prices are fair for most meals. However  I think  15  for a whole chicken dinner is excessive. You can buy a whole rotisserie chicken from the grocery store for under  6.   Even though it comes with the sides - that s pretty high because the chicken pieces are not that big.   Great choice if you want a quick dinner to take home. I ve never dined inside so I can t speak for their sit down service.

From out of town and doing laundry across the street  I was just going to a burger joint next door.  I saw the sign that said Charcoal Grilled Chicken.  What a treat  Great flavor perfectly grilled in a spicy but not hot marinade.  Did the half chicken combo  rice was good  but beans were great.  Came with limes  whole grilled onion  tortillas and both red and green sauces for about  10.  Try it if you can  you ll want more.  Going to try the Barbacoa next time.

DO NOT go to this pollo Rico location  the people who work there are worthless.  It would honestly save you time to drive to the Stassney location.  On top of that I was given a menu with coupons And was accused of taking one of the coupons off of the counter to use  which isn t allowed   Seems like a bait and switch tactic and they were so rude I left.

Got the half chicken meal and it was awesome I gotta say  Huge portion  and great authentic grilled-flavor to the chicken. Comes with a side of rice and beans  both were good. Would have preferred some mashed taters...  But this place is essentially a Mexican restaurant that seemingly specializes in grilled chicken. It s pretty close to my place and I ve wanted to try it for a little while now  definitely quality for your buck. Think I m a regular now.
caldo de pollo terrible salty and greasy although the service is good  grill chicken very good.

I love this place. They do an excellent job at grilling chicken. Today Im having the rico bowl which is full of tasty beef  ricea  beans corn and pico. Im here twice a week eatting up all this yummy food.

I m not a chicken lover.  In fact  I flatly refused to eat chicken until I was in my late 20 s.  I have grown to tolerate it over time  but not love it.  So when Mister told me he was going to bring home a chicken dinner one night  I was less then enthusiastic  but he was excited so I went along with it.    Oh.  My.  God.  I LOVE this chicken.  Get the whole chicken combo  that s what we get .  It s amazing.  MORE than enough for two people  although we really need to get extra tortillas .  I have had it about five times now  and it s awesome every single time.  That s all I have had from here and probably all I ever will have because I love it too much to try anything else.

The mex mix is the bomb diggity.  Overall this place is always a solid choice. The chicken is great. Flavorful and chargrilled to perfection. The whole chicken meal is easily the best deal. The amount of food you get is fantastic  comes with rice  beans  tortillas and an whole roasted onion .   I haven t ventured too deep into the menu because the chicken by itself and the mex mix  carne asada and chicken combo  are soooo good  I haven t felt the need to stray from them   As a bonus  the HEB receipts from the the riverside location have a coupon on the back for a whole chicken meal for just  11.69.

Please be careful yesturday i buy a chicken bowl 2 hour later after i eat it i star felling with head pain the hight fiver all the night i thing someone have a virus or the food was contaminate. This is the first time happen to me. I will never come back.

El POLLO DELICIOSO        This place is amazing. The chicken will bring you in and the price will bring you back.   The whole charcoal grilled chicken with all of the sides  tortillas  beans  rice  a grilled onion  and limes for 16 bucks is an absolute steal. I have tried to buy all of these items at the store and I come out more expensive. The great thing about it is that you can get it from a drive thru. My girlfriend and I can each get 2 meals from the whole meal. If you don t have that many mouths to feed don t fret they also have a 1 2 chicken option.   If you like chicken and haven t tried this place give it a go  I guarantee you will not be disappointed.   I have also had one of the tortas when I was on lunch from work and they are also spot on but to be honest you would be doing yourself a disservice to not order the chicken.

Save yourself sometime  amp  go to El Taquito On Riverside  First I go order  amp  ask for the 1A 2 piece chicken  I wanted two legs the lady taking my order said she can only give me a leg  amp  thigh.. okay I know what I m paying so why can t I have 2 legs either way I m paying more than I should so what s it matter   Get to the window I ordered a shake she then proceeds to tell me my meal comes with a fountain drink okay  well I want a shake I don t care if I pay extra  She made my whole order complicated  Now let s get to the food  It freaking sucks  The locations up north where the white people have better food   You d figure oltorf where Mexicans are they would have the good food  No  The chicken was burnt  the tortillas taste like HEB store bought BLEH  amp  The beans had more juice  amp  Veggies than it had beans  The rice was hard  amp  had no flavor   The only thing decent about my meal was the green sauce  Save your time just not worth it

Pollo Asado  roughly translates as Awesome Chicken   Don t even screw around and buy anything other than a whole chicken. It s what you want. It s what you need.  Pros  - Drive Thru - Green Sauce - Roasted Onion - Did I mention the green sauce  - Not super cheap  but not expensive for a 2-person meal  Cons  - What  Are you crazy

POllo Rico s green salsa is the bomb diggity. It s spicy but so delicious.  Their pollo asada and grilled fajitas are legit.  Rice and beans are also solid.  I m really picky with Mexican food but they ve got it down.  Their caldo de pollo makes my heart happy.  It s a sure fire way to make any cold day instantly better.  But  make sure and go early because they always seem to sell out. P.S. Supply and Demand is a real concept  Pollo Rico. Just saying.

Looked on their website to make sure they had chips and queso before heading out  and their website said they did. Upon arrival my dreams were crushed  there is no queso. Just heads up  what s on the menu   may not actually be on the menu...just sayin . Have tissues ready.

Came here for the first time and ordered their chicken meal which came with rice beans amp corn tortillas amp was delicious  however my boyfriend ordered some type of beef tortilla gyro thing and it make him sick for the rest of the night. The place seemed grimy  the cashier  didn t know  answers to any questions I had about the menu amp the tv was blaring so loud I could hardly hear while trying to order.

There food would be a 4 out of 5. Have been here about 6 times and each of those I found the person running the drive through to be less then pleasant. I don t mind waiting 15 minutes in a drive through but a smile may help.

I eat here around two or three times a month. It s awesome.   Granted  I am no rotisserie chicken connoisseur  it definitely beats HEB  or any other place in the area.   For a super cheap price  you get a ton of chicken  plus rice and beans. They have other typical mexican dishes too  but why bother when you can get the chicken   Everytime I ve gotten it  the chicken has been moist and full of flavor. It s great anytime we have guests in town and don t feel like cooking  we just grab a chicken or two    As far as fast food drive thrus go  I have to say  Pollo Rico is the best.

Good chicken. But really shocked to find they started charging for extra salsa. 3 for a dollar. Which kinda peeved me since she failed to say that until after she ran my card.  I get it. Prices are going up. But the salsa cups are small to begin with. Salsa is not like a bbq packet at mcds. I drench my food in it. Like jerry seinfeld says it should be a condiment on the table...Right next to salt and pepper.
Their tres beef tacos combo with green sauce is a flavor explosion  I d give 6 stars if I could

Isn t just delicious  is mamas kitchen  They are super natural  simple  friendly  tasty  and sincere food   That s just a little piece of what they offer  you had to be a genius to offer such simple ingredients on many good choices. Also some plus is the fast attention  They are really good at it  The salad and fresh same day made it salad bar  and chips   You have to  you should try it   I m 2 or 3 times a week costumer  and I love the chips l  I got there hungry  and I come out satisfy. That s why maybe I ve been seen some many non Latino costumes around  They price rocks and the food is awesome

This place is amazing. Everything I have ever eaten here was beyond perfect. The green sauce is my end all and be all  I usually get 3 or 4 tacos with either chicken or carne asada. Also  I occasionally grab the whole chicken meal on Fridays for Pollo Rico day with my co-workers. I will always be back here  the great smell of cooking fills the entire neighborhood and draws me in almost every time I pass by. The only downside I can find with this establishment is their slowly rising prices. I have noticed most items on the menu have increased by approximately  3 over the past couple of years. Overall  this place is a winner.

This place has the worst customer service  we recently went and the girl at the drive thru was very rude she treated us in a rude way as if she hated her job.  It s a shame because the food is delicious  but the bad customer service kills any possibility of me ever returning here.

I am currently dieting and The order taker was able to adjust my carne asada order so there weren t any rice and beans  and I got a salad with it instead.  The steak was really good  I had trouble trying to slow down and really chew through it  The salad came with the guacamole and sour cream I ordered and I dipped my steak with that. I really liked it.

I had the Half Chicken for lunch today.  The chicken is very flavorful and there is plenty of food for at least a meal and a half.  I especially like the green sauce from the salsa bar.  4 stars for the food  minus 1 star for the cleaning chemicals smell when you walk in.  However  they gained a star back to bring it to 4 with the friendly service and free chips
Ate from here for the first time today loved it. The beef was savory without being greasy and it filled me up without being heavy.  Very light and fresh fare. Will go back often
The only word I can think of to describe this place is AMAZING I m crazy picky when it comes to chicken and this is definitely the best chicken I ve had

Did you know there is a coupon on the back of HEB receipts for El Pollo Rico  A whole chicken combo meal for 11.69. It expires Nov 30 I think. Check your receipts  folks.   So today was the day  I wasn t feeling so well and left work early  and picked up my little package of goodies on my way home. Upon entering  my roomie s cats all suddenly appeared  looking at me hungrily. I had to fend them off. The chicken is pretty good  the dark meat far superior to the relatively dry white meat  which is kind of a bummer  I m hoping they aren t all like that. Both are flavorful though. I love the beans  they have bits of beef and chorizo along with big chunks of tomato and jalapeno. The rice is also very good. I guess I was expecting a larger portion of each  since I tend to think a whole chicken will feed four people  but I would say the give you enough rice and beans for two portions. It also came with a grilled onion  half a lime  and corn tortillas. Oh god  and the salsas. I asked for extra green sauce because I am pretty much just obsessed with it. I can eat it by the spoonful. And an update on the service  The problem mainly lies with the teenagers working here  which is hardly surprising. As long as the employee is above 20 or so the service is fine.

I was craving rotisserie chicken and upon searching the internets this place came up. This is definitely some good tasting chicken  although it tasted a lot like Pakistani Indian tandoori chicken or a spicier El Pollo Loco instead of rotisserie. This is to no fault of the restaurant  of course. The full chicken came with rice  beans  salsa  and tortillas. The beans were AWESOME. Not your typical re-fried beans  but rather a pinto bean soup almost with spices and pieces of meat.

This is an amazing place to eat. Prices are lower then I would have expected  and the food is unbelievable. I am a big fan of the food. If you are a working person and on a budget this is the place to go and eat lunch.

After reading the yelp reviews  i went out to look for EPR  5 but found this  6 instead.  I ventured in to see their offerings.  It kinda is like a basic Pollo Loco as some others have descirbed it and no I am not from Cali  there are PL in other places in Texas   The lady at the counter was very friendly and helpful.  I got a two piece meal.  The chicken was tasty and did have the spice rub others had discussed  but the flame taste was kinda weak.  It was ok for me  but i guess I prefer a more of an asado grill taste.  The rub spice maybe took some of that flavor away.  The salsa s were ok  as was the grilled onion.  The beans were not too good  I think Taco Cabana does a better job and the rice was just eh rice  not the worst i have had.  So not terrible at least it wasn t dry  maybe i will try some of their other locations   Or maybe if it is cold out and rainy I will just go down the road to this location and see if it gets better.  Maybe the other options are great too   FYI they offer those awesome tostada chips that i freakin love  i could eat that with the salsa alone
love Rico. i enjoy their chicken and the tortas and the huge quesadilla.

The food here is definitely affordable and good. Definitely not a five star gourmet Mexican food if that s what you are looking for. The service is great every time I have come here. Their menudo is really good and made just right. I just wish there was more hominy along with all the meat. Most Mexican restaurants just serve a lot of meat.       I came here with my kids one evening because my wife had to work late. Needless to say my kids are typical kids. Picky about everything  this place has you covered even if you are Hispanic and your kids don t want to eat Mexican food.   They also make some delicious fajitas if that is your favorite Mexican dish. The chips and salsa are good too.   Parking can be breeze or a pain depending how packed the plaza gets.
We enjoyed our dinner at El Rinconcito Del Sabor. I ordered Pollo Asado. Everything was made fresh and was full of flavor. The salsas are great too. Service was nice and the staff was very friendly.

This corner place is a hidden gem  I just moved to the Austin area and looked around for some comfort food that tasted close to Mexican food. I ordered the pozole and queso flameado  cheese with chorizo  and I was blown away  I went in expecting Tex Mex and got an authentic Mexican dish experience. Don t even get me started on the horchata my oh my delicious. If you are craving close to home Mexican food this is your place  I will be back for dinner next time

Just left this place after waiting for a waitress to attend me my daughter and wife and I ve never been more upset at a small local business before ... not only did the place look like someone s basement but after taking a while to attend us the lady approaches and says to us that because my daughter came in with a pizza  keep in mind that she s 4 years of age and a very picky eater so we knew she wouldn t eat anything there and picked her up something along the way  they told us we had to leave and couldn t eat there.... Fine. Don t want my business money or tip for the waitress  I don t care. But definitely will not be returning or recommending this place to anyone. What an embarrassing moment. Made us feel alienated. Never again

A really nice and quiet hole in the wall restaurant. The staff is super friendly and attentive. The food was great  The queso and verde enchiladas definitely hit the spot    Will not be my last time coming here

Great local family restaurant and my favorite close by Mexican joint. Every time I go in  I am the only white guy there - I always take this as a good sign   Their salsa has a decent kick to it  and unlike a few other nearby Mexican restaurants  they do have a liquor license if you want a michelada or Bloody Maria. I get something different each visit  and it never fails to be delicious.   I would choose this spot for authenticity over nearby Tres Amigos  and the staff is a lot friendlier than Aguilar s across the street  plus they have booze here and serve food faster. Y es barato aqui

This is the perfect spot for authentic Mexican food. The staff are fantastic and very attentive. Everything I ve tried is amazing but my favorites are their fajitas  tortas  breakfast tacos  flautas  and menudo  on weekends . Delicious margaritas and Mexican candies and treats are for sale at the register. This restaurant is a gem in this quickly developing neighborhood. Hope to see it around for a very long time

Horrible food I have tried all kinds of food but this place I will not recommend to anyone even if it s the last place on earth my food arrived but nun of my tortillas came with it so I m sitting for at least 30 min before anyone ask if the food is ready and by the time they gave my tortillas to me I just put the container on top of my food and gave them my plate back because 30min for 2 tortillas was horrible and they still wanted to charge 2 dollars for the late tortillas but the End of the story is that no one come by asked about our food or told us if we need a refill so if your have a bad day here just don t stop here
Yummy cane guisada and they are sweet when i try my spanish. Great food  And they speak english too

I think the 3-star is perfect for this restaurant. The service was extremely friendly  but the offerings  from the chips to the enchiladas were just A-OK. It was really affordable and service was quick. While I won t bring friends by while they are in town  I will stop by if I need a quick lunch.
It would ve been so much better if the indoor humidity had not been 100 . Needs a new A C.

Great taqueria  The green salsa gives me life and the chips are delicious   1 after the first complimentary bowl . I got a torta with lengua. The bread was perfect  the meat was delicious  and the side fries were good too. I m very happy I stopped by.

Whoop   ...We made the mark  ...100 different Mex Tex joints since we have started Yelping  ...One heck on An Adventure it has been  ...Needless to say the diet starts Jan 1...We have hammered a lot of new places out this last couple months  ...This place was a solid  very solid 3 stars....this was right across the street from the last place we hit...Service was outstanding   ....Everyone looked out for everyone else...Water  chips  etc. Team work is key in any restaurant today...Chips  Salsa and Queso hit the table...Once again a small portion of salsa  yet not complaining...had a great flavor  bite..and of course with a couple spoon fulls added to the queso...was a nice touch....Basics first...Beef enchiladas for the wife  and the Belly Buster for me  ...WwwHHHatt ...why do they make me feel guilty..Mine first...Well the Belly had enough room for the meal...2 crunchy Beef Tacos...shells were crunchy  not sure if they were home made...flavor was well above the Box bought at the store...Beef was a little light on flavor  But they were fresh  veggies cold and decent in size. Chicken Chiladas were delish....all white meat..still moist and flavorful...Now for the green sauce...NICE...Great flavor  tart and a bit of heat...Beans were creamy with just enough whole beans...Wifes beef Chiladas were packed out  came with the Tex-Mex sauce and worked well with the beef  gave it bit of boost in flavor...wife could have taken a bit more heat  but still a good flavor..Over all a great finish to a crazy Adventure   .
Not fresh food the corn tortillas weren t warmed up all the way. Not tasty food I ll say.

I cannot believe how horrible the serves is here. Now I know why you have no business.  We decided to surprise our dear friend  who has become homeless due to the Memorial Day flooding  with a baby shower to help her before her baby comes.  Thinking it was a good idea to go some place where its not too busy we chose El Rinconcito Del Sabor - Kyle   unfortunately we were not welcomed. The owner or manager whoever she was explained that we should have called ahead. By all means I totally understand and my apologize. I honestly didn t think it would be an issue. I mean the Facebook page does advertise walk-ins welcomed and parties of 6 or over get a free queso.. I didn t think it was an issue but now I know. Then she proceeds to say if you re going to eat here you all have to order a plate nothing al la cart and just have water.. Again okay weird but your rules.. Whatever..   Then what had all of us livid... 2 of our guest were disabled veterans  both served overseas  and both parked in the handicap parking. Well  the same lady tells another guest of ours to tell them they could not park there. My friend came to double check with the 2 vets and they confirmed that they have it on their plates they can park in that parking. Once my friend explained that it was on the plates they are able to park there  that woman then says well they look to young to be disabled veterans  in a tone that she did not believe it was true . OMG it was horrible.... Not that she was deserving both had furnished all credentials.. It took me to tell the waiter that he and that lady owed them an apology. Happy fourth of July      Not to mention we were told they could not split the check with over 6 credit cards. Needless to say we used 2 different cards and the rest in cash. That was a big mess and them trying to double charge.   Ritas were good  Food was edible  beans no flavor  Portions you get robbed...  Do not do large groups Better when it was Luvianos  Cute house and out door patio  I really hope someone takes over because this spot has so much potential. All posting from 2009-2013 are accurate.. Miss the old staff and not too sure if they hired a new cook. I thought it was the same owners of Luvianos but after last night not too sure.
This place was okay. Just okay. It wasn t delicious but it wasn t terrible either.  The chips though  those were not good. They were store bought.

Some of the best food I have had in Kyle. It s in a cute little house made into a restaurant  there s more outdoor seating then indoor. The food is very good  they don t have homemade tortillas but that s okay  the food more than makes up for it. The barbacoa place for breakfast is my favorite.
One of my favorite local eats  Always good quality food in a low key setting. From breakfast tacos to some of my favorite green sauce enchiladas  this is a great choice.
Good authentic Mexican food.  Good tacos and the chili rolleno were solid. This is not a 5 star restaurant so don t set your expectations to that of one. The staff is wonderful and friendly.

Everything I have ever had here has been excellent.  The prices are very reasonable  the waitstaff are all the sweetest ladies and the atmosphere is just what you d expect of a hidden gem hole-in-the-wall Mexican food place.   I have debated as to whether or not to review Luvianos  as it is one of my favorite places and I don t want all of you crowding my spot... but it s a New Year and I thought I d play nice and share.
This place has the best chicken verde enchiladas  The breakfast tacos and horchata are also great

Ho hum....that kinda sums it up for me. Now before you dis me on my ho hum review  it s not my fault  A friend played up this place to be fabulous. It was average  only negative were the tortillas we stiff and not fresh. The chicken enchiladas were good  fresh chicken was great  the red sauce  ok. The small amount of unmelted cheese was just a garnish. The rice nothing special  the beans were really good. Oops...almost forgot the salsa...too smokey and roasted for my tastes. I almost felt like I was dipping chips in bbq sauce  now I know that will excite someone  I promise to go back and try the breakfast tacos soon...breakfast tacos can make or break a joint for sure   I will surely update my review then.
Authentic Mexican restaurant. Friendly prompt bilingual service. The salsa was quite good... piquante  spicy  I enjoyed the  Pollo Diablo   Devil s Chicken

I d give it a 3.5 maybe  more than a 4. It was good solid quality  just no frills  and the beans and potatoes were kinda bland  as was the salsa. I got the barbacoa breakfast platter. It was really large  The meat was very tender. The horchata was good too.
I work down the street and this place has awesome breakfast tacos. Plus you can t beat the price 3 for  2.99. What really makes it great is the salsa for the tacos.
