Getting sick was not the flavor of Mexico I had in mind at the Cameron Rd location. After what must ve been 1 2 an hour  my to go order of chicken stew which sickened both me and my dining partner with stomach cramps - it was distastefully presented and nearly  impossible to eat consisting of about 2 boiled whole chicken quarters with skin on  almost a whole squash  a raw piece of corn  whole potato and ginormous carrot  none of which had the ROTTEN parts cut off prior to cooking - what   Gross. Take your dining plans elsewhere.

Owner recently changed the name of this place but we ve been having breakfast here for several years.  If I don t get nopalitos or huevos ranchero I get my  menudo fix  and their spinach omelette is lovely.

read the other s and then read this...... are you done  Good. So while my car was in the shop for 7 hours I went around town with my mother and for lunch we stopped at Luvianos. A cute mexican restraunt in the hood. Thats right I said  hood . Not to scare you away or anything but there are bars on the windows for a reason lol. I know cuz I went to a school in this neighborhood and did my share of wandering around on foot around the neighborhood. So yeah the food is good. I ordered the Pollo Asado  the chicken was very flat  so was my mother s carne asada steak flat. Flat as a crepe  not a pancake a crepe. Super flat. Ha  Not quite what i was expecting. Maybe its normal in Mexico for the meat to be flat  The rice was good the beans were bland the chips were stale. I have had better and I have had worse. Oh and the salsa...... pureed canned tomato s with some chiles. I know my salsa. I prefer it cold  chunky and made with fresh ingredients. It was room temp  way too much like tomato soup. Oh and not spicy enough. I didnt really plan to give a bad review  but It is what it is.
Very cheap excellent Mexican food. I ll be there again.
Cheap and good food I will go back just for the tomato paste salsa but really the food is good but the salsa is just ok.
my favorite Mexican restaurant.  My children s favorite Mexican restaurant. My wife s favorite Mexican restaurant. Need I say more

Man oh man  This place is the bomb  I went for my first time today and i m going again  that s for sure. From the look outside you wouldn t expect it to be so adorable inside. There are things hanging from the ceiling  Mexican newspaper  dolls on wall  and Mexican candy. It s not a crowded place and that s why it s great. The staff is really sweet  but i m not sure if they know English. i had a friend translate for me just to be safe. Right when you sit down they give you complimentary chips and salsa  ask what you want to drink  then you order. I ordered the Tex-Mex cheese enchiladas. When I got my plate I was truly flabbergasted. It was a hug place with 1 3 rice AMAZING  1 3 Cheese enchiladas with some type of red salsa  FANTASTIC  and 1 3 beans  shooot  GREAT  are for 5.99    You need to go     You wont be let down

We went here for the 3 for 2.99 breakfast taco deal that they advertise outside  only to get inside and see the same sign but in small writing that is only during the week.  The tacos weren t bad  wasn t much on the bacon personally.   They only have 1 sauce and it s the same sauce used for the chips  amp  salsa.   Sauce wasn t spicy enough for me.  For 5 breakfast tacos  1 tea   amp  1 water our total with tip and all was  20.  Service was pretty quick.
The food is always great   Fast  and courteous.  Best Mexican fast food restaurant ever   Get the Rico bowl   Chicken  amp  beef

This place used to be on my way home from work  and I can t tell you how many times I pull in last minute because I just can t resist their delicious chicken  rice  and beans. I practically lived off of el pollo rico for the 15 months that I passed it on my way home from work everyday. I moved further north and forgot about this place  but now that I m back in south Austin  I ll be adding this restaurant back into my weekly rotation.

This is not your corporate fast food  The chicken is juicy and with a unique  rich flavor  exactly as advertised. The beef is solid but not outstanding  the baked potatoes were the same. Chicken is the star of the show  complemented beautifully by the fried plantains. Don t let the drive-thru lines scare you off  They ve got their system down  and you ll be out of there in no time

First I m going to go ahead and say it. This is the best chicken in the whole town. It s better than any fried chicken you can get  it s better than any chicken I ve had anywhere in all of Austin.   The whole chicken meal is not only good its a great deal. The price point is right on and your whole chicken comes with Charro Beans  Rice and Tortilla s. Wait there s more you also get green and red salsa     The green sauce is so good  Its one of the most delicious hot sauces I have ever had and I never get enough of it. In fact  writing this review is making me wish they were open late so I could stop in on the way home and pick up a whole chicken meal.  Sometimes when I drive through the intersection where they are located I can smell them cooking the chickens. I cant say I haven t immediately detoured to get one. If you happen to be Stassney and South 1st and you smell chickens do yourself a favor and detour for the chicken. You wont regret it
I love the roasted chicken  beans and rice barbacoa tacos and the nachos. For fast food  it s the best around.

This is what I call fast food heaven   We order the whole chicken meal sometimes or if we are low carbing it we will pick up two whole chickens for  20 with no extra sides.  The chicken here is absolutely the best in the whole town.  I have tasted the other Mexican chicken competitors and they are not as good in my opinion.  The charcoal flavor mixed with the seasoning is pure perfection.  Then there is also the green sauce that will rock your taste buds.  I dip and drizzle my chicken in the green sauce.  The charro beans have chunks of meat in them  they are packed with flavor and taste like they have been stewing and cooking in your grandma s kitchen for days.    The prices are cheap too  especially if you are feeding a family. The large whole chicken mean with the large sides is  18 and can feed a family of 4.  For what El Pollo Rico does - they are literally as good as it gets
Fast  delicious  and very inexpensive.  I ve gone here about 4 times a week for the past year and I ve never had a bad experience.
Love Pollo Rico  this location is always fresh and the staff is very kind. Great food great price
Oh man  the reviews were right  The chicken meal is incredible  One of the best meals i ve had here in Austin. The rice and beans are great as well. And you get lots of food for the money
We do take out here once a month  including   Whole grilled Chicken Charro Beans Rice Grilled Onion Lime Green Sauce  Chips.....OH My  the Green Sauce  OK..... 1 more Green Sauce....eso es todo.
I got a order to go to share with my friends and they all love it the chicken was super fresh tender and the seasoning was on point.

I absolutely love this place. I love the aroma driving up to it  the smoky meat smell filling the air. I love the charro beans  the rice  the chicken... and especially the carne.   Of course  as mentioned in other reviews  the green sauce is amazing.   BTW  never had any problem with the food here in over a number of years visiting. And Taco Cabana doesn t even qualify as Mexican food.

Due to an afternoon encounter with El Pollo Rico I am now a FAT BASTARD. my girlfriend and I got the chicken and beef combo s and gorged ourselves into oblivion. That place is cheap and pretty good. Stay away from the beef and make sweet love to the succulent  juicy  smokey pollo.  Not fancy at all- but pretty good.

Best food that has ever been handed to me through a car window  hands-down.  Get the half-chicken combo  or the whole chicken if you re with a friend.  The seasoning is so good that you will be licking your fingers and scraping the bones with your teeth  to the point that its almost embarrassing. Comes with a bowl of rice  beans with big chunks of fresh veggies  a stack of like 8 tortillas  two salsas  and a whole grilled onion.  Seriously awesome.

I went to Rico for the first time for breakfast tacos. Food wise and price wise I think this place is great. My breakfast taco with egg  chorizo and potato was delicious and generous. However  as accuracy goes this place is not going to get your order right and you have to be ok with that. I actually ordered the above with cheese and didn t get it. It worked out because I don t think it needed cheese at all and if I go back I know that now. My other taco was missing a more important ingredient  egg  which is what makes it a breakfast taco . The menu says the breakfast taco comes with egg and one topping. So my assumption was if I order a breakfast taco with sausage it would be egg plus my included topping  sausage  and my add ons which they also didn t get right. So in summary  the one taco was delicious and filing and cheap BUT I wouldn t expect them to get your order exactly right since they got some potion of each of my tacos wrong. I will go back and next time I ll try to work out the ordering kink  could have been partially my fault as a first time customer.

Today is Friday the 18 of October 2014 I purchased 2 beef tortas they girl there who had me the order I ve asked for a lime and some green sauce and she said that there were 1  extra for each item so I ve asked her I usually come here and they don t charge for them  She answered well I never seen you and I you want the items I gave you the price for them so I answered back can I speak to the manager and she said well he s not here so too bad and slammeed the drive thru window in my face  An I ve waited 15-20min to receive my food there was only 2 cars head of me got home at my food it s awful cold and with tomatoes when I ve asked her I didn t want tomatoes when I ve had order in the window  Never had this experience here before till today not satisfied with the your girl at all

we have been eating here for about 5 years now and it still tastes GREAT   consistent flavors and portions.  get the Papas Assadas  and a whole chicken  get xtra beans  to feed 3-4 hungry people and you won t be disappointed. price is well worth it.
This place is fast and relatively cheap  but I d rather go to Taco Cabana for similar food at a better price.

El Pollo Rico is the most awesome thing ever. For  15  you get a whole char-grilled chicken  rice  beans  tortillas  onion  and salsa. This chicken is pure ecstasy. The left-overs make a fantastic breakfast as well. Plus  this location has a drive-thru. Can life get any better  The next time you need to pick up dinner on the way home  stop here. It will not disappoint.

Aguilera s gets 5-stars due to speed of service  authenticity  and price for what you get   The staff was very friendly  and the food was made to order  very prompt with beverages  chips  amp  salsa  breakfast etc. . As someone that has spent a lot of my life in small  mom and pop Mexican restaurants  I enjoyed the quality and portion sizes of our food.   My fiancee and I ordered a few breakfast tacos  and they were loaded with delicious ingredients on our choice of corn flour tortillas  only  1.50 each . In the mornings before 11am I think  you can get 3 for  2.99 total  which would fill up any hungry customer. We ll definitely be back again for breakfast if we re nearby in town

Great food  great price  great service. I felt like I was at my abuelas home. The family environment and the ridiculously affordable food combine for an amazing experience. Would recommend to literally anyone.

I m sad to report that I wouldn t recommend this restaurant  based on a recent taco order. I was there at 4pm on a weekday and tried to order the Carne Guisada tacos.  Not finished yet.   Okay  how about the Barbacoa   Not finished yet.   Bummer. How about the Al Pastor  Yes  But don t get too excited yet...the meat was dry as a bone  the pieces cut too large  and without much flavor  and unfortunately so were the  available  bistec tacos. Maybe the empty restaurant and lack of take-out orders should have been a head s up for me  I will say  however  that the one saving grace of my visit was the red salsa provided with the tacos--it was deliciously fresh  with onions  peppers and tomatoes  and packed a punch  but unfortunately still couldn t overcome the dryness of the taco meat.

Very good food  homemade tortillas. Family restaurant. Our server was cooking  serving  and taking care of her very well behaved child. Still did an amazing job. Very good atmosphere. Overall amazing food  good atmosphere  and nice  hardworking owners.

This spot is serving without wearing their masks correctly or not wearing them at all  The lady that was prepping my meal got mad when I asked for the sides that came with my plate which was a salad  guac  and sour cream  She said that the salad was all and I pulled up the menu and said that is not what it states here and she threw whatever she had in her hand with an attitude and kept arguing with me as she walked back to get what was missing. I highly do not recommend this place  Their is several other spots in very close proximity  Give them a try instead

I got my order to go. The cashier was polite but not friendly. The food was hot and fresh. I had to ask for a menu  as this was my first time to visit. Last time also. They gave a great amount of cheese on the enchaladas which is a plus. The beef inside the enchaladas lacked flavor for me. The rice and beans were very bland to me. For the price you got a good amount of food. They make their own turgid las which is a plus also.

Stopped in for a quick dinner with my husband before driving back to Denton - always a shame to leave Austin without grabbing some Mexican food  We d never been here before  but this place did not disappoint.   The atmosphere was relaxed and unpretentious - f tbol on the TV the entire time  dudes chilling with beers and micheladas watching the game. It was pleasantly cool after a hot day outside  plus nice and clean.  The food was very authentic  served up fast and hot. The chips and salsa were complimentary  not always a given at an authentic Mexican restaurant  that s kind of a gringo thing  and delicious - warm chips  spicy and flavorful salsa with excellent texture. Our entrees were simple and super tasty. I had the cheese chile relleno  hubs had the chicken enchiladas with red sauce. Both came with rice  beans  and salad  lettuce  onion  tomato  and ripe avocado . Didn t take any before pics of our meal  but did snap shots before we loaded our to-go box.  Service was friendly and fast  too. We were in and out in about thirty minutes.
Hidden gem. The real deal. Better than hipster torchys or all those other gringo joints.
This place is definitely gem  I wish I could give more than 5 stars  Haven t find a good enchilada around in Texas until I find this place  Lifesaver     highly recommend

99  Closer and Closer to the  100 mark...and were not disappointed with this find  ...Not many reviews  most seam solid...I will say Customer service was spot on ...Exactly what we look for  ...Chips  Queso and Salsa hit the table...Queso was good  and priced great for the size...Salsa was fresh and hit the spot....Our new thing these days is to add a spoonful of the salsa to the queso...and it always seams to work  and this round was no exception ...Sadly I missed out on the  Green Stuff  I have read about in the reviews...Hot plates hit the table  wife with the usual Beef Enchiladas  double rice...This would be the second time  ever  we came across a potato filler in the beef  yet this time around they were small  diced and were a good fit  a bit of carrot as well...and the wife is truly NOT a fan of this  BUT....the Spicy Chipotle Sauce is seriously good and one heck of a bit   ..She was lost in flavor to complain about it too much...Corn tortillas were thick...and they were packed out...Same on my side  except I went with Chicken with green sauce...Chicken was Whole Bird  which is my favorite for the entire flavor experience...Green sauce was tart  and a very nice punch on the the spice pallet...Beans were creamy with a few small chunks of whole beans...All around a great meal for this Tiny Strip mall Eatery

Update 10 19 19 - tried this place again and it is just as disgusting as it was the last time. The service hasn t gotten any better either   This place is in walking distance from my home. I will never work there again. To start off with  the chips they gave me were stale and seem to be stale.  Probably out of a bag. The Horchata I had was good but you could tell it was a cheap mix. The waitress that served me seemed really annoyed with me because I did not speak Spanish and she had to speak English. She made it very obvious that I was inconveniencing her. I have had waitresses before that did not speak English very well  but they were kind and patient about it  as were I. This woman was just awful. She did not even smile at me once. I ordered the chili rellenos...beef. What came to my table was a poor excuse for authentic Mexican cuisine. It was incredibly greasy  the ground beef had chunks of potato and carrots in it. The top of the chili  there was a layer of what tasted like canned tomatoes  not even hot...lukewarm  covered in cheese. I got through three bites and couldn t go any more and I am not a picky eater. When I went to pay the same warm  welcoming waitress I had took my money  gave me my change and left to the back  all without saying thank you  or smiling  or asking me how everything was. She was awful.... I wonder if I accidentally ran over her dog and didn t know about it or something.  This was one of the most horrid dining experiences I ve had and if zero were an option I d give that. Honestly  I don t understand all the positive reviews about this place
This place is great for breakfast brunch. We ordered bistec tacos and pozole which were both amazing  Super good micheladas too

It s sort of hard for me to review because this isn t my favorite style of food. That said  the portions were generous and I think that if you re really into tex-mex then you should definitely check this place out.  In my opinion  good tex-mex should be served in a divey restaurant with tons of Mexican kitsch on the walls and Aguilera s delivers on that.  Some highlights  surprisingly great waitress  the best salsa I ve had in Austin  and queso that was surprisingly good. Don t get me wrong  no one would come here for the queso  the way one might with Kerbey Lane  Trudy s  or Torchy s  but it s not a waste of money to order if you re already here.  We went for dinner on a Sunday and the place was pretty dead  also  they were out of lengua . Hopefully  as the Mueller area starts to grow  places like this get more business.

Home Made tortillas  corn or flour  and that green stuff. Aguilera s has the right makings for taco heaven. The egg  chorizo and cheese breakfast taco was great. Not oily at all. And the Migas tacos were very good. They worked out even better by dousing them in a side of chile con queso and the Jalapeno taco salsa.   You need to drive out into north east side of town to find the trip mall which spawned this little dive  but it is worth it. I was hoping to try their Lengua but unfortunately they were out.  They have squeeze bottles of a good Valentina salsa which I could imaging going great on their meat tacos.
I always looking for that great hole in the wall mexican joint and this is one of them.  Their pastor tacos are soo good i keep coming back for more
I love eating here. I ve been eating at this spot since I was in high school  It was named Arturo s at the time . Great food. Real Mexican food. And pieces are great.

Customer service was TERRIBLE. FYI this is coming from someone who has never complained and just downloaded the yelp app for this specific experience.  As I walked in there was a woman just staring at me standing behind the counter. I said  hello  how are you   She then very angrily asked if I wanted a menu. I said  yes please . I thought maybe she was stressed or having a bad day so I brushed it off. Then as I was reading the menu she stood so close to me I could literally feel her breathing. I asked if I could get three orders of the three breakfast tacos for 2.99 and started listing what I wanted. She interrupted me by raising her voice saying  cheese costs extra     I said  that s fine and she quickly walked off before I was done ordering. I told her I needed to order two more orders and she rolled her eyes. When my food was done  she threw the bag of tacos on the counter and said  HERE . I said thank you as I left and she ignored me walking back to the kitchen.  BTW I tipped this place before ordering food      And food was not good at all.
Great pastor tacos    I also love getting the gorditas with steak. If you like authentic Mexican food  this place is a great spot.

I am a long time returning customer and I can confidently tell you that this is a true hidden gem  The service is always friendly  they are almost always open  the food is authentic and DELICIOUS  The steak a la mexicana is my all-time favorite dish.

I don t know when Tex-Mex became a bad word but I know a good plate of food when I eat it.  I had the Enchiladas Aquileria  their lunch special on a Friday.  3 enchiladas rice and beans  pretty much what I grew up on in south Texas.  Choose from cheese  chicken or beef and pick the sauce.  I had the beef with the red sauce and all was seasoned perfect and covered cheese.  The rice was cooked right and had pieces of carrot  peas  and corn which is the way I like it.  I m not big on refried beans but they were also good.  The chips and salsa was on point.  Warm chips and very good salsa with a little heat.  The place is clean with newer tables and chairs.  I don t leave a lot of reviews but I use yelp a lot to find lunch on different parts of town.  What I know is if you do not eat at places like this they go away and you are stuck trying to figure out where to eat. Give it a try  service was good and the food is even better.

Had some bidness to tend on that side of town  so I thought I would look up Arturo s Tacqueria...I had an ill-fated date that lived in the area and we had our last breakfast here...remembered the food was good but the companionship lacking...  It isn t Arturo anymore...it s La Laguna. Strip center with the Texan Market a couple doors down. Healthy portions  breakfast all day. The Ranchera sauce they serve con Huevos has nopales. Good stuff. The hot sauce is pretty darned good...fresh and full of garlic and cilantro  well blended. Chips were served nice and hot. Some of the best I have had recently. The papas...diced and fried...extra tasty. The migas had plenty of fresh chopped jalapenos and mild cheese. More tortilla chips than the average miga meal in town  but was tasty nonetheless. The seafood soup as well as Caldo de Pollo and Caldo de Res are totally worth having in addition to the Shrimp cocktail...generous servings. Quick service.
The service was pretty quick. Staff was friendly. I had a potato  bacon  egg and cheese burrito and everything was very good

Food was decent  Carne asada  rice and beans lacked flavor. Server took our order and waited 45 mins for food even though there were only 4 other people there.   service was really slow  took our server about 15 mins to separate our check and have us pay for our food

We had a total of 5 pretty good sized tacos  amp  drinks for  8.  It was very good.  They do not have sweet tea and to me that was the only downfall.  Their regular tea is very good though just add a little sugar or sweet  amp  low.    I got the 3 breakfast tacos for  1.99 it s a very good price  but you do have to get 3 of the same kind of tacos.  No mixing it up.  It was okay because my partner was with me and he ordered 2 different tacos so we were able to trade and try a bit of everything.  The food was very good including the red  amp  green salsa.  The green salsa is the kind that i really love and hadn t been able to find in this area yet since moving here.  It s VERY spicy.    The company is actually called La Laguna now instead of Auilera s.  We will absolutely be returning.
I am obsessed w authentic Mexican tacos  and I am assuming this is almost as close as you can get  besides driving across the border  Try the lengua taco  My taste buds go crazy for it

ok  this is as good as it gets for cheap authentic Mexican food.  I am talking 2.50 breakfast plates  with two eggs  potatoes  homeade refried beans....yyuumm so delicous.  I like downscale places like this for the everyday  it s quick and it is always homeade.  I have never been disappointed after eating here.  My favorite is the La Lagunero plate  two eggs sunny-side up over two homeade corn tortillas  or flour  your preference  with white cheese on top... I always request some ranchero sauce on top if that and it is the perfect breakfast dish. The coffee is always fresh and never ever tastes stale.

Work at the nearby Adesa auction and stepped out for lunch last week. This is a very unassuming place in a small strip center. The inside is fairly bland and kinda feels like you re sitting in the den of someone s house that hasn t yet been made to feel like home. Then the waitress promptly brought me super fresh chips and delicious salsa. She took my order and kept my drink and chips salsa topped off. The  Especial  was Enchiladas for 5.99. I ordered the chicken mole enchilada plate. They brought out a huge plate with lots of rice and beans and three smoking hot homemade chicken mole enchiladas with a mound of lettuce and avocado. They had some awesome green sauce in bottles upon request. This place is super reasonable with delicious food and giant portions. They will be seeing much...much more of me.

This restaurant really needs to be rated on different categories. Value is a 5  Atmosphere a 2  Food- 3  maybe 4 on somethings like their chicken soup  and service an inconsistent 2 sometimes 4. Overall a good place to eat a good meal and get out. Oh and of course I frequent the fresh made to order breakfast tacos on homemade tortillas.

I got off of work late today. The last thing I wanna do is cook. So I came to tortas el Guero and they are honestly the best Mexican style tortas. Number one is my favorite. The food is prepared as you order it so everything is fresh and the cook is Very generous with the ingredients. They have outdoor seating and of course they also make to go orders and you can always have a cold drink with your meal. I am in love with this please oh and did I mention that it s very economic I got to hold meals for  19

Solid Torta place located off Cameron road  just a short jaunt north of downtown. Keep in mind it s cash only but this place was great.   A lot of places around Austin tend to put beans in their Tortas which makes them heavy in book. So I always tend to prefer that go a fresher route. Avocado is always a better route.   Got the Diabla  6  Milanesa  breaded chicken cutlet   chorizo  avocado  cheese and egg  in an omelette form . Sandwich was big and super reasonably priced at  6.50. Really have to say these Tortas go amazing with hot sauce  and I finished mine up without it feeling heavy. Was surprisingly good  no fuss.   They have a ton of different combos you can do  and they only get crazier than what I listed. Bring your appetite for sure

Stop for this School Bus     Tortas El Guero is in the parking lot with Guthrie Cleaners located on Cameron Rd behind Capital Plaza.  I had a  2.50 chicken fajita taco and a  5.00 chicken quesadilla.  WOW   The chicken fajita taco was served street style...but the serving was generous and well worth  2.50.  The quesadilla was cooked perfect with just the right amount of crisp.  They do not skimp on the cheese either.  It had the right amount of melted cheese to be enjoyed with each bite.  My favorite part is that they add fresh sliced avocados to the quesadillas. The homemade hot sauce was very enjoyable too.  Tips   They are closed on Wednesdays and only take Cash.
This was really good and they where really nice all my friends like coming here recommended   And the Tortas where soo delicious
Best street food in town no doubt the tortas are the best and guero is a really laid back person
These tortas are amazing  Had the  1  Cubana  and it is probably the best torta I ever had.  Highly recommended
Good tacos great price the meat is chopped fine that s the best way to do street tacos   more of the meat gets seasoning so more flavor .

These are great tortas. A friend of mine and I went by here after enjoying Nomad s happy hour  the synergy between drunk food and newly-drunk people has got to be one of the most fertile entrepreneurial territories in Austin or anywhere   and were quite impressed.  He got a  2 Napolitana for  6  which came with milanesa  pork leg  ham  and cheese  plus the usual fillings. I got a  6 Diabla for  7  which came with milanesa  chorizo  ham  cheese  and eggs.  They came out in less than 10 minutes  huge  fresh  and smelling great in their large crusty rolls. We did the obligatory halfsies trade  doused our respective torta chunks in their  excellent  hot sauce  and enjoyed some great drunk food. Not quite as good as the ones at Mi Tradicion  but then Mi Tradicion isn t stumbling distance away from a bar  either.

Tortas El Guero was around before food trucks were cool. These guys have been doing their mini-school bus thing for well on a couple of years. I ve always been impressed by the quality of the food they re pumping out of this spot.   This last go round I got a quesadilla with fajita and a sincronizada. The quesadilla was gigantic  stuffed full of fajita  beans  jalapenos and tomatoes. The flavor on those babies is reminiscent of Mexico... and not of dry chicken breast and mozzarella like most places where you order up that particular item. Their sincronizada is different than what I m used to -- but equally tasty. Ham  cheese and beans between two flour tortillas. Dip it in their legendary green salsa or the smokier tomato based one and it s all you can do not to cram more in your pie hole.  Prices are great -- those two items costing me  8 -- and they are ready super fast. Definitely a stop to make if you re at Nomad or Animal Trustees for a filling  inexpensive  local meal.

Yet another entry in the ever expanding food truck scene in Austin.   I expected tacos but was pleasantly surprised by El Guero.   Although they do have a few tacos on the menu  they specialize in Mexico City style tortas  which are basically some really big sandwiches with a load of toppings.   Having never experienced an authentic Mexico City style torta  I asked what was recommended and the cook advised to order a  1 and a  7.   The  1 consists of cuban breaded steak  shredded pork leg  ham  franks  yes  hotdogs   mozzarella cheese and some veggies.   Yes  all that stuff on one sandwich    The  7 is chlanga steak  chorizo  cheese and veggies.   All sandwiches are served with pickled jalapenos  on them or on the side  and are accompanied by a very spicy chipotle sauce.  All tortas are served on really good bread  which is lightly toasted and buttered.   I can t speak to how authentic these are  or what the difference between a Cuban style torta and a Mexico City style torta is  but they were really tasty.  They are also huge      Mexican Cokes and Fanta are available and they have a number of covered tables for your dining pleasure.   Have a torta and then walk over the Nomad s for a nightcap.     Really different for taco truck fare and quite good.   They have a wide range of toppings  so check the menu picture I uploaded.

Great tasting tortas around. Made just like you find in Mexico city   D.F.  The menu is very small and limited but it makes for quick and speedy service. Eating here is very limited  only two picnic benches. Most customers take theirs to go. I intend to stay there  enjoy my meal with nice weather  and indulge in small talk with other customers or owner.

I REALLY wanted to like this place. I ve driven past it so many times and wanted to stop. Finally the other night I had my chance. I parked my scooter while being stared at by the customers  evidently they don t get many customers on scooters . I went up to the trailer to look at the menu board  understanding most  but not all of the Spanish. I was just about to look up a mysterious word or two on my handy  iPhone translation app when a very nice man that was waiting for his order pointed out they also had a menu board in English. I smiled and thanked him but was grumbling inside about not getting to use my new app.  Anyway  I ordered the Napolitana torta  breaded steak  pork  ham  cheese . I ve had several tortas around town and these were different. Personally  not my style. It didn t taste bad  just not anything I would go back and try again. I give them 3 stars instead of 2 because they were very nice and their food stand was a cool school short bus
Super nice staff and the food was amazing  Definitely recommend. Authentic  I got the steak tacos with avocado and cheese. The salsa is spicy and incredible

This place is great. The tortas are on point and the sauces he has are tasty. White people like to complain about stupid little shit at places like this and they don t even know how the god damn food is supposed to be. They don t come from the culture so how can they be the authority on Mexican cuisine   I m sick of these babies  This place rules get over it

Ladies and gentlemen of Leander  hear my story of the greatest restaurant  and hero who owns it. I went to the Leander Trunk or Treat this weekend with my kids  and my son locked the doors before I could get the keys  my phone and purse out. This was in front of Aparicio s. I walked the kids to the event  we walked back and I was going to eat there after  but we couldn t get the car unlocked. My dearest friend who brought her kids and family took my kids home  and I waited for a tow truck. Thanks to my smartwatch I could call one  but that s a separate story. Smart watches work  but they aren t great if they aren t close to the phone  so I had to stay near my car.   And I waited... And I waited some more...  Finally after an hour  a kind man walked out of Aparicio s named Victor. He s the owner.  He offered me a strawberry lime-aid  and a chicken taco. He fed me  he told me about his restaurant and his food truck  and asked for nothing. And as the hours ticked by because it was getting outrageiously cold  he finally told me he would help me get  a locksmith since my tow truck never came.    He fed me  he got me warm  and he helped me get safe and had someone get my car open. Superman never fed anyone  so in my book  Victor is greater than Superman.   Now let s talk about the food. Not only was that the best chicken taco I ever had  and I ve had many  the tortilla was fresh and fantastic. This is authentic food  not frozen  not preformed tortillas  but made by hand in house. That alone is worth it. From the amazing Scarface homage to the way that everything is perfectly clean  to the beautiful presentation of the food  this is probably the greatest place to eat in Leander. It s in that same spot that Farm to Fork used to have. I highly recommend it.   I brought my husband back the pastor taco  and he s in heaven as I type this. It s delicious    If you are into authentic Mexican food  that is fresh  seasoned perfectly  and made to order  this is your new spot  as it is surely mine. The portion size makes sense for the pricing  and the iced coffee horchata is to divine and I can t wait to try the quesadillas.   So not only did my life get saved  I once again have the perfect place to get real tacos in my life.   Victor you are a hero  and an amazing chef. Thank you for everything. I will be back and with my kids and I promise  we will not lock ourselves out of the car again.

Wow  Had the pastor tacos and a Horchata there tonight and it was excellent. Love the homemade corn tortillas - the pastor filling was so flavorful and yummy with generous touches of pineapple and cilantro. The Horchata was deliciously rich  silky and creamy and not overly sweet.   Friendly service with a smile. I ll definitely be back to try some other items on the menu.
The machetes are expensive for the amount of meat they have but they are good size and the tortilla for it is really good.  Salsas are ok.

Aparicios is now doing breakfast on Saturday and Sundays   This stuff is soooo good. They have breakfast tacos   both regular size and machete  along with Chilaquiles.  The OJ is fresh squeezed and the Iced Coffee Horchata is da bomb.   If you re looking for authentic Mexican - do yourself a favor and checkout Aparicios. The staff is always looking to try new things and receive feedback and it s such a friendly place.   Located off of Hero Way in Leander - the restaurant is towards the back   actually a side store  of a small strip mall. Look hard - you will be rewarded
Drinks - Amazing  Food - full of flavor and fantastic  Service - great   The mood - chill and relaxed  Do not pass this place up. It is definitely a hidden gem.

I had the Gansito shake. If you re unfamiliar with Gansitos  they re a Mexican snack cake filled with strawberry jelly and cream and coated with chocolate. The shake s texture is great and it tastes exactly like a Gansito. It s topped with whipped cream and fresh strawberries  and also comes with an entire Gansito  It was really tasty and so big. I couldn t finish it in one sitting  but I was happy to save it in my freezer and enjoyed having it for dessert the next day.

Holy hot Cheetos batman    Aparicio s is great  everything has some sort of hot Cheeto aspect be it a tortilla made of hot Cheetos or just it being covered in hot Cheetos or sometimes both.   The Machete s are huge there s enough food for two people to share.   The shakes are also super tasty.   This is a very cool spot. Go here

Aparicios is a food truck off of Runberg and Georgian drive. There s parking to accommodate for about 8-10 cars.   We originally went to Aparicios to try their  antojitos  and decided to try their food while we were there.   Shakes - we got the Ping ino shake and the Gansito shake. The portions are generous and one shake is enough for two people. We each had more than half our shake leftover. The Ping ino shake tasted like a normal cookies and cream shake. The Gansito shake tasted just like a Gansito... and it had a full Gansito inverted into it  If you ve never had a Gansito  just imagine vanilla bread  filled with just enough strawberry jam  covered in chocolate and add little chocolate bits to it. So yummy   As far as the food goes - it was good but it wasn t great  to be completely transparent. The machete is massive  2 ft    You can get two flavors and they ll split it right down the middle. We liked the Carne Asada with hot Cheetos more than the al pastor.  There was no line when we got there. Staff is friendly and service was fast  it probably took about 10 minutes to order and get our food. Staff is wearing masks and they have hand sanitizer readily available. I don t think we d go back for more food but would definitely go back to try more of their antojitos.

Sadly they were out of the  Machete  but the Texas sized carne asada tacos were very good which def makes me more confident about buying the Machete. I literally had 2 blue lagoon limeades in a 30 min period..I got one and barely got down the street then realized it was almost gone and I needed to turn back for another. This was Saturday..I was back shortly after opening time Sunday for another one..Saturday s were much better but it was still good. My co-eater had the hot Cheetos elotes which we both liked but agreed they may have overdone on the Cheeto topping. She had the strawberry limeade which was also very good but couldn t top the blue. When we returned Sunday she bought both and combined the two which was outta this world. This place is def worth a try  the turn is quick so be careful not to pass it.

My sister-in-law recommended this place after seeing all the delicious food pictures on social media  LOL. Since we live in Buda  we travelled quite a ways to sample this little food truck. It s permanently placed in a small parking lot with a couple other establishments in the Hispanic part of town in north Austin. They have constructed a patio-like area with picnic tables to eat at for their customers.  We placed our order and weren t kept waiting long. I shared a machete with my mom because wow were they BIG  My brother didn t realize the drink he ordered would be spicy and humbly requested something else  and the staff decided to bring out FIVE additional drinks to let us ALL try their unique beverages  the sweet ones that white folks can handle LOL   which was really awesome of them  Basically  25 worth of drinks on the house. They wanted to make a good impression  I think... But all the drinks were delicious  I especially enjoyed the passion fruit variety.  My only complaint was how loud the music was blaring the entire time. I suspect they might ve been attempting to drown out the road noise from the street nearby but I could barely talk to my family while we were there.

Amongst a plethora of taco stands in Austin  this one is certainly unique. My partner tried the carne asada machete. It was  20 but filled two plates. It was quite good.   He sent me back the next night and let me know he wouldn t be sharing   I ordered the hot Cheetos taco plate al pastor. It was also good. The Cheetos come on the side to stay crisp and YES I put them on there. I ll try something different next time  but ya just gotta  you know   The shakes are gargantuan  much too much for this ice cream lover. They were impressive  nonetheless.   We ll be back when my partner gets the craving and I ll be happy to work my way through other menu items. Also  prices are on the high side for a taco stands IMHO  but I guess they win as I ll be back.

A really fun and creative food truck  I saw they had footlong tacos so my boyfriend and I came here on a Saturday night. It got pretty busy  They gave us a sample of all of their meats  and they were so tender and delicious. We were told we could do half and half foot-long taco  so we got half al pastor  amp  half carne asada. We added hot cheetos to it as well. The truck had an awesome playlist and had a lot of tables to spread out and eat. I saw they had a lot of milkshake options as well. So random but I m here for it  If I am in the area again I would definitely stop by  Our taco was delicious and so filling  we didn t have the opportunity to try anything else.

We are a family of 5 and was hoping this place was going to be good. We went to their new location in Leander on Saturday at 5 30 for dinner. Ordered 2 carne asada tacos  cheese quesadilla  hot Cheetos quesadilla  chicken quesadilla  Texas sized carne asada  2 waters  Dr Pepper  sprite  and a horchata. All in all it was about  100. We were given number 7. Drinks came out quick minus the sprite. After 20 min or so food started coming out. We got the hot Cheetoh quesadilla and 2 cheese quesadillas. None of the wait staff came by to see if everything was correct. So I walked up to the service window to explain that we got a cheese quesadilla instead of a chicken quesadilla and that we were still missing a sprite and the 2 carne asada dishes. I received the sprite right away. The chicken quesadilla came out 10 min later and still no carne asada dishes. After another 15-20 minutes Again none of the wait staff came by. I went back up to the window to inquire about my missing food. I was told we orders were mixed up and that they would make it right away. I asked for it to go since my kids were already done eating. They brought out the 2 tacos and a mangonada on the house for the wait. Still missing my Texas sized carne asada I asked again. By now we had been there for an hour and a half but I would ve have just left but that Texas sized taco was  20 and I was still hungry. I finally got the food and took it home. When I got home both the tacos and the Texas sized taco had just meat and cheese without the fixings. Overall very disappointed in the food and the service. The best part was the on the house mangonada. Maybe they are still new but figured I would share our experience.

Our little one came across a hair in her taco so not the best first experience. For  60 worth of food we lost our appetite after seeing this only a few bites into our dinner and threw away the rest. The s more s milkshake and the pina drink was good but the food wasn t too flavorful. The menu is super creative too but hairnets would be a good investment.

First time here and definitely won t be my last. It s a crazy combination of your typical Mexican food truck eats and next gen stuff. For instance  hot Cheetos tacos . Who would ve thought. Old and new. Bold and different. I can t find the words to describe the crazy ideas these people came up with  A ganzito shake   Absolutely insane    If you re an old school Mexican type of eater then you d know just how insane this entire menu sounds. I got the carne asada plate. I m going to be straight up  for  19 it was good but too pricey in my opinion. The meat was definitely cooked great but was very tough to chew in my honest opinion. That was literally the only downside of my entire experience. The hot Cheetos tacos were delicious and very  very different. The salsas were fantastic  the meats were very well seasoned and tasty. I will definitely be back on a cheat day to have all of their shakes in one sitting  just kidding  that s an overload of sugar  Lol . Overall it was definitely great but it would be a 5 star rating if only the fajita was a bit more on the tender side. Other than that  keep up the great work y all  Definitely putting a stamp on changing the game in the Mexican food truck industry

Awesome. Best was anything with the asada. Corn with hot Cheetos was good. Next time will definitely get the Asada machete or the Philly cheesesteak. Would also get the Asada plate. Marzipan milkshake was just OK. Next time will try the s more

Every food item here special in their own way nothing like Mexican food with their own twist     My family and I enjoyed it very much  Jenga accessible at every table . Suggest to look at menu before hand since ordering can be high pace   Loved it will be back soon .

I was trying to get here for weeks and am glad I finally went  The food was decent but definitely more hype than I was expecting. The machetes are a fun though but a bit greasy and the al pastor wasn t the best I ve had. And the hot Cheeto elote was a strange texture. Overall  I m glad I came here and I d probably come back if I was in the neighborhood but I wouldn t drive 30 minutes again for it.
Great Food  I Had the hot Cheeto Tacos and hot Cheeto burrito and my husband had the carnivore machete   Amazing   Flavor was so authentic   If you are a food truck foody  you have to try
great service amazing food recommend if you like tacos that re  5 stars 100   going to continue to come here for sure

I got lured in by their fancy FB posts and was so excited  I was very disappointed  Tables were disgustingly dirty so we took it to go  I ordered the machete w  no avocado sooo I also got no beans  The corn tortilla wasn t cooked all the way and while the meat had good flavor it was really fatty and in huge pieces. Never again

Not going back  I don t recommend this place at all  it s overpriced I pay  45 for 2 tacos 1 machete and 2 drinks it s ridiculous. The place has tables but they are really dirty and they have a salsa  bar  but with nothing in it. There are flies everywhere  they need to work on their cleanliness. The food wasn t good either  the meat was hard and not cut  the tortillas where hard  basically if you have kids avoid ordering food for them.
Foods greats but they take forever .... I ordered a machete and there was like 5 people before me and it took them a whole hour to make to give me my machete
I ordered a salchi-burger with a Mexican Coca Cola it was amazing  I felt like I was in  Monterrey Mexico enjoying the music and food  They also have this new 3 leches shake  I need to try next time
Great Mexican food with splash of creativity. They accept cash or credit cards and have a huge menu

Definitely a mom and Pop spot which I always love in the heart of East Austin it hasn t been gentrified yet. Excellent service great food great drinks pricing is amazing you must eat here. It s just as good as any of the high priced places I had the chicken enchiladas rice and beans were very good. Love their salsa plenty of heat and she kept my chips and salsa full and kept checking on me everybody had a great attitude and I definitely suggest getting the homemade churros
The staff are friendly. They have the small town  commubity vibe that I gwt when I visit my paren ts hometown. The food is great too

Frankly  this place is walking distance from my house  and I was hungry. I ve been to many of these types of restaurants in Austin  so I didn t expect much. But to my surprise  the food was prepared with a little more love than usual. I had the Steak Poblano  beef skirt steak with grilled onions  bacon  poblano pepper and cheese on top. It s served with rice and beans. It sounds pretty typical  but the beef was cooked perfectly  with just the right amount of caramelization. It was crisp and tender. And the rice wasn t the usual bland  watered down rice. It was spicy and actually had a great flavor  as well as the refried beans. They had a slight hint of bacon and beefy flavor. All in all  I was really glad I popped in. Not the best I ve ever had  but it s definitely on my regular rotation of place s I eat at. Top it all with a Modelo Negra  limon  and you ve got yourself a wonderful meal

No frills tex-mex with insanely good homemade salsas  No pretenses with their food  it s simple  filling  and flavorful. Best dish is definitely the al pastor tacos and beef fajita platter. Enchiladas need some work  but you can beat the price overall

Had a really bad experienced. They re chips were overly salted. They were super salty. I asked the waitress if maybe they had another bag they could open and she said they had 2 boxes of the same batch and they had to use all of them before they could reorder. Not coming back  Especially with the stupid response from the waitress.
Straight forward real American Mexicana. Great prices and free chips with delicious salsa.   Superfast in case you are in a rush.

CHECK YOUR ACCOUNTS  I just had my card swiped for 3 different amounts and when I questioned her about it she completely did not tell me the truth  She took my order wrong  then swiped my card had receipt in her hand  then she corrected the order swiped my card again  and then she s like you owe 4.50  im like No you already swiped my card twice     I will be contacting the management

Found this place by accident and was glad that i did.  They have a breakfast taco special before 11am  3 tacos  all the same  2 ingredients  for  3.50    That is a great deal to me  considering my favorite taco is potato and egg.  I get 3 of my favorite tacos for  3.50  I ll take that everyday and twice on Sunday.  I have also tried a couple of their tortas  the torta cubana with milanesa and the torta Mexicana.  The torta cubana was good but a little dry.  Once i added in their green salsa to the torta that was better.  The torta Mexicana was full of meat and is definalty a full meal.  The torta Mexicana has lettuce tomato  sour cream  avocado  breaded  beef  ham  white cheese  chorizo  amp  egg  and a weenie.  I was tryin to eat this in the car and i almost ended up wearing half of it  so if you are going to get the torta Mexicana eat on a flat surface. The torta Mexicana was good but i was thinking when the menu said chorizo and egg i was thinking crumbled chorizo and a fried egg placed in the torta  but the chorizo and egg were mixed like in a taco.  The texture of the eggs and chorizo was throwing me off  my mind was thinking sandwich but i was tasting breakfast taco in my sandwich so the mixture of both was a little off to me.  I ll probably be ordering the quesadilla the next time i go.  I saw one of the waitress taking one to a table the last time i was there and it looked so good  very full of meat and cheese. Try to the breakfast tacos you ll be glad you did.

Three 2-item breakfast tacos for  3.50  Count me in  Tacos and coffee were  6 total  and were altogether delicious. The bacon was well cooked  and the tacos were filling. I know not to expect anything fancy when I order breakfast tacos  and these met my expectations. They were exactly what I was looking for this morning. The coffee was also pleasantly and surprisingly delicious.  Only thing problem - I asked for corn tortillas and was given flour. Double check your order before leaving.
Outstanding staff and food to boot. Not sure how we haven t been here as we are so close  geographically. Will be back again and again and again

I would say you re better off going to Taco Bell. The price point for quality of food did not match at all. We ordered a chicken quesadilla and a chicken burrito with a side of retried beans and 2 margaritas. The quesadilla was of very poor quality. The cheese was not fully melted and there was very little chicken in it. The burrito was of the quality that you would get at a gas station very little meat and too much sour cream. The refried beans were of the consistency of a smoothie. I literally had to add water to my margarita because it was  dry . It was very odd. I definitely wouldn t go back to this with the plethora of other options around. The waitress was very friendly but not attentive.

Beto s is the most authentic and delicious Mexican food i ve come across in Austin. The chile rellenos are BEYOND WORDS. I m drooling even thinking about them.  The street tacos are also awesome. You can t go wrong with their queso. Everything at Betos is ON POINT.  The staff is friendly and welcoming and very tolerant of my children.

Love this place. We have been here 2 times in the past 4 days. You can t beat their breakfast taco special. Homemade flour and corn tortillas. Delicious. Kind people who work there too to top it all off

Decided to drop in the restaurant while driving by the area during a visit to Austin.  I was not expecting much but ended up absolutely impressed with their breakfast tacos and salsas. So tasty   I went back the next day and had huevos rancheros and was equally impressed
Food is ok  not the best we didn t even get chips and salsa when we sat down. It s decently priced for Mexican food in the area not really a place I would say is a must go... but it was just ok

This location used to be a different Mexican restaurant that I had never eaten at but  I was excited to see that it turned into Beto s.  I have been eating at their other location since before that one was Beto s as well and this location has the same menu but  a larger dining room so you are definitely going to be able to find a seat during peak times.  They also serve breakfast at this location as well.  We ordered our usual queso and I have to say it was better at this location  the salsa was perfect and the chips were fresh.  The chicken monterey was on special and it s one of my favorites but  I decided to try something new that I didn t care for and ended up sending that back and ordering the chicken monterey.  It was just as good as the other location.  This is one of my go to lunch places to get good consistent Mexican food and I am glad they opened a bigger location with better parking.

Yes  This is some of the tastiest Mexican food I ve had in a long while. Their tortillas are awesome and they have  3 margaritas   I ordered the chili rellano with shrimp and my friend ordered pastor mini tacos  both of which were flavorful and reasonably-priced.  So happy to find this opened up in our neighborhood. This is our New Mexican spot for sure.

3 ceviche tostadas.   Authentic Mexican restaurant  good food  inexpensive. The restaurant itself smells like cleaning products  but I suppose that comes with the territory.  And like I said    3 ceviche tostadas
Servers have always been very courteous and the tacos and burritos are delicious. The bathrooms could use some serious upgrades though.

It s pretty standard Mexican food and they do a great job with it. They do one or two tex-mex things if you really want  like a  taco salad  in one of those ridiculously huge fried tortilla bowls.  Personally  I love the burritos. Sizable  made like in Mexico. Meat  avo  beans  lettuce  tomato. I really appreciate that since I m lactose intolerant and tex-mex is just swimming in cheeses  creams  and all that.  They have a lot of  plates  too where you get a main and a couple of sides. Big portions. They have a wide selection of tacos as well.  I think they have some drink specials and maybe a karaoke night  Not sure as I generally only go for lunch or early dinner.  The prices are reasonable  the staff is very friendly  and the food is good. Love this place.
Online menu has prices for every plate  when you go to pick up they charge you more than what s listed. And when u ask them you get an ugly response...
Everything was fantastic  We had the Fajita Texanas and steak pablano dishes plus Rice  beans   corn tortillas and they were both fabulous

I gave this two chances. First time the guisada was meh. Second time the soup was horrible. My dining companion and I didn t finish it nor did I want to take it home. I went across the street and ate after that it was so bad

I regular this Chipolte. It s usually well kept  and operates efficiently with a friendly staff. The parking lot can be a bit tricky  but there are a couple of reserved pick-up spots you might be able to snag if your lucky. I don t recommend the queso. It s a little grainy and not very delectable. The veggie burrito is a great option if you want guac  but don t want to pay the extra  2. Note  thery still charge extra for guac on a sofritas burrito. The chips are pretty tasty with a salty lime flavor. I wish there were a tip line on credit card receipts here  tips are cash only so bring a buck  I also wish they did a punch card like their local competitor.

I wanted to get some chipotle today  but from my terrible experiences from the past with this location  there is no way  Very slow  usually taking their time doing everything  they are usually out of stuff and they also barely put anything in the bowl
This chipotle is not great. Seems like they usually skimp on scoop size and my bowl is usually watery. I live near here  but have learned to get my chipotle fix from other locations.
This is the WORST place i ve ever been to. I love chipotle and this store sucks ass. I ve lost  30. I ve reported fraud multiple times they are fucking awful.  They don t ever deserve 1 star.
This place is a mess.  Waited more than 30 minutes past pick up time for a to go order along with 20 other people waiting to pick up their orders.  Will not be returning.
Either this chipolte is always out of things or they re just to lazy to cook more. Employees are dismissive and rude. Dont waste your time
I got the burrito bowl and was stabbed in my gums by a sharp splinter like super pointy material I have no idea what it is from - too scared to finish my bowl super dissatisfied.

This place doesn t have it together at all. Placed order online. I ve been here 45  min waiting for that order to be ready from when they said to expect it  along with 20 other people just trying to get their food and get back to work.
Absolutely do not order here if you re looking to place a simple online order for pick up. You ll be waiting apparently over an hour for your food.
They closed at 9 30 but it says they re open til 10 00 pm. Lazy people . I don t recommend

Online order only  you can t go in  doors are locked and you have to call a number to get your food brought out  and when you call the number you re met with a voice recognition robot and then at the end it says that  pick up isn t available at this location  so how exactly am I supposed to get my food

This chipotle has really large portions  They remembered everything in our order. We ordered online and our food was delayed by about 5-10 minutes but there were a lot of people waiting too and it was sort of busy for people walking in to order. The middle seating was closed off for covid.
Management does not enforce proper masking by employees. This guy is making a burrito with his nose hanging out.

Did an online order and went to pick up. I get back to work and realize there was an error. No protein    Luckily the manager Holly analyzed the situation quickly and went out of her way to remake it and make the situation right. She even refunded for the inconvenience. Thank you Holly

This is what I was presented with after opening my burrito bowl.  It was delivered to me.  This is unacceptable. I can t tell if this is a fresh bowl  or a regurgitated one.  And this AFTER I knocked all the tons of sour cream off the side. Smh I ll never go to this location again.  I m on my lunch break at work and have to starve until I get off.

I ve been ordering delivery from this location a lot since COVID.  I appreciate that their delivery fee is only  1 and it is always pretty speedy.  The last few orders I ve received however have been luke warm at best  and today I ordered a bowl that seemed to be about half the size as they normally are.  I ve eaten a lot of chipotle in my life and I always order the same thing -- I know how big it should be   I m disappointed my orders recently have been much lower quality than they used to be.

Ordered delivery on the website from this location and my bowl came with ONLY rice  beans  and meat. No cheese  lettuce  guacamole  salsa  or sour cream  all of which I added to my order when I placed it. So glad I paid  22 for a delivered bowl of bland protein.

The young gentleman who started the burrito line was excellent and offered quick and friendly service. Kudos to him for his stellar work ethic and attitude. The food was fresh  service was friendly  and the bathroom was clean. All in all  it s a standard Chipotle location. Solid overall. Would come back and recommend. There s also plenty of parking.

As we all know  when you go to chipotle  we run the risk of getting the guy that feels it s his destiny to put the least amount of chicken or guacamole as possible. These are the types that seem to be emotionally invested in the chicken and the avocado itself. My bowl was a nice appetizer or maybe if I was a small person or child. If you re over 140 lbs be aware you may leave hungry. And if youre a grown ass average man you ll be going across the street to get a burger.

You would think that following all the horrible press Chipotle has been receiving lately  they would want to try harder to do BETTER. Apparently not...  This is not the first time I have had a less than satisfactory visit to a chipotle restaurant  but I m mostly upset because this location is SO CLOSE to my work and now I don t want to go...   I ordered chips and guac  to take back to work with me. That s it  chips and guac. Easy.  Chips were stale..... and burnt and way too salty  So that was cool...  The guacamole was the worst part- it was old and turning brown  and not just the kind of turning brown that happens when you leave guac out same day    Hardened brown chunks of avacado    At first I thought a piece of chicken made it into the cup  Which would have been equally as gross  in my opinion. But Seriously  I pulled that nasty rubbery brown lump out of my guac and almost threw up to discover the rest of the contents of the cup were just as old.    Yes I want my money back. Yes I want an explanation and an apology.  GROSS

Standard issue Chipotle that you know  love  and depend on. No surprises  but by going to a Chipotle... do you really want a surprise  The parking is easy and they have the  burrito loading zone  for quick parking if you had enough sense to order ahead to get in and out.

Having sworn off first the Chipotle in Round Rock  La Fronteira   because it sucks   then the Parmer store  because it sucks for different reasons   this location is the next one in my expanding southerly pilgrimage to locate a Chipotle which does not suck.  I fully anticipate having to drive to San Marcos before long.  Until then  this is a consistently good Chipotle  both from food and service standpoint

Right offhand  I can t think of anything clever to say about Chipotle  so let s try this  You just submitted the winning Instagram for the  Boobs  amp  Burrito  contest  and first prize is free burritos for life. You now have to choose between Chipotle  Freebirds  or Cabo Bob s. So which one is it gonna be   See the dilemma here  I think all three are pretty decent  I admire their choices  amp  options  and if you know you re going for soft  amp  mushy goo - Oppan vegan style - it might as well be good  amp  healthy too. Hey  there s Coke Zero at the fountain.   So why am I really going four stars here  Because I was with the delightful Ashley S  who was on fire telling me funny stories. I m gumming away on a Sofritas tofu burrito wondering why Ashley isn t doing open-mic at ColdTowne  because she s that good. Maybe that was the point of this Chipotle experience  to imagine my friends on a different path. And figuring out what to do about it. I m a fan of that.

Meh.  I love chipotle. I really do. Many people do. But here s the deal  I ve been to this location a lot because it was convenient but they re stingy. With everything. Teeny tiny scoop of rice. Small scoop of meat. Maybe two shreds of cheese. Four if you re lucky.  I will now drive myself all the way across town to Brodie lane to that location for their wonderful  fair portions. Much better service.

The best Chipotle that I have been to in a long time. Clean  quality product and friendly staff. It what appears to be the GM or store manager working hard in the back and the staff is attentive and efficient. Other than the bathrooms  men s all I know  needing a little attention  this is a perfect representation of what Chipotle is suppose to be
I ve been to many Chipotles. The burritos  here are HUGE.  Insert  that s what she said  joke here . There was a quick moving line with friendly service.

The employees working there were either extremely rude or just extremely cheap at the servings compared to what I paid for. The lady working at the end of the line with the toppings was slamming my burrito around and glaring at me the whole time I asked for the toppings they offered. It was very uncomfortable and made me never want to go back.

My wife and I came down with food poisoning after eating at this location on 10 9 15.  We both became very ill in the middle of the night within hours of each other.  Given that the only meal we had eaten together in the 24 hrs prior was our Chipotle dinner  it was pretty conclusive what caused it.  She had a carnitas bowl and I had a carnitas burrito.  She was sick for about 36 hrs  I was sick for 4 days.  I reported the incident to both Chipotle HQ and Austin Health and Human Services  but my report was marginalized by both parties.   5 days later food poisoning reports in Oregon start rolling in and a month later 6 states across the country have reports of food poisoning linked to Chipotle restaurants and the same strain of E Coli.  Gee Chipotle  maybe next time you should actually listen to the loyal customer and stockholder when he tells you his family became violently ill after eating at your restaurant.

We know you need to make money  but can you stop with the kids plate sized burritos  I don t usually advertise to the world that I m vegan. But  I do when I come to Chipotle because they re so freaking stingy. 1 4 cup rice  a few sad looking pieces of dilapidated fajita vegetables  a very small amount of corn salsa  brown guacamole  lettuce  and mostly all black beans is what they plop down and my 4 year old would still be hungry. I guess they think most vegans are skinny ___  but I m a Vegan Panda  Since  we re not adding meat  sour cream  cheese  shouldn t we get a little more of what we can eat  Darn it Chipotle  quit letting us starve  Screw it  I ll just take my business to Freebirds

Absolutely horrible delivery service. If I could give 0 stars I would. I ve spent over  100 in delivery at this location in the past month and in the past 5 times I ve had food delivered  it was late  it was cold and this time it looks half eaten missing. I most likely will NEVER order from here again. Don t waste your time
Food wasn t very fresh. What type of chipotle doesn t have guac  Very unsatisfied with my lackluster burrito   . I d suggest freebirds down the road.

Come on guys  Chipotle is awesome fast food. It s not a awesome sit down  dinner date place. If you need some quality tacos fast  come here. I don t understand all the negative reviews. The carnitas are always salty and good. The guacamole is always fresh and creamy. I don t frequent this location  but it was damn decent.
Ordered chips and salsa and a burrito bowl. Chips were soooooo stale  and bowl cold. What a shame.

So chipotle is a little expensive when you think about an extra  1.95 for Guac. But the portion of Guac that they give you is amazing. I had the soyfritas in a bowl with rice  lettuce  hot sauce  and guac. I totally forgot the beans though    .. but the portion of food that I got for  9.17 was enough to feed two people. The food is good and it is a nice change up from Freebirds. I am GF and so I can t have the burritos and I wasn t in the mood for nachos lastnight.    The customer service was really nice and the location on the inside was clean too. If I am back in this area  I will for sure stop in      Oh yeah pretty much all bowls start at  6.50 and then Guac  like stated before  is extra. The food looks fresh and I respect the lack of Carnitas until the Pig industry gets their sh t together

This location has the nicest women working there today ever.  I was able to sample the WONDERFUL Sofritas with brown rice.  DELICIOSO    Can I get an amen for the SOFRITAS   I had not been here in quite a while but this is what I will be ordering.  It is a wonderful meat alternative packed with flavor.  Try it out   This location is AWESOME   Only took off a star due to the parking lot.
This is the only Chipotle location that does not accept call-in orders to-go. The amount of time I was placed on hold  just to be told that they don t accept call-in orders is unacceptable.

My order was messed up and I was given food that had gone bad at a different location. Doug answered my call and immediately offered to remake my food free of cost even though the error happened at a different store. A  customer service and I will definitely be coming back. DOUG IS THE SHIT
Fast customer service.  Good hot food and this place was clean inside out.  I grabbed the hard tacos plate and they were awesome good.

Guys I wouldn t eat here if I were you. I love chipotle. my best friend works here. He told me all the ins and outs. If you eat lunch here expect to be eating the food from the night before. All the salad and the guacamole is being used. Nothing is fresh  This made me sick to my stomach. I can t believe this is happening and still open. I know food has a shelf life. But when you re using guacamole from the day before and it s all black there s a problem. And Chipotle prides itself on fresh food. Ha well I think not. I will not be eating here anymore. Sad thing is the gm don t want to talk about it. Like wow people what are you doing. Don t you know you can kill people

So the quintessential attribute in a chipotle burrito is the wrap. I ve been here at least 10 times  the first time I got a burrito and they somehow tore the tortilla completely while wrapping it. So subsequent times I d get a burrito bowl with the tortilla on the side  but I can t help but notice their butchering of other s burritoes - it s usually between wrapping the burrito in a cube form  smashing it so that the burrito is never allowed to be elongated or somehow aggressively wrapping their fingers into the filling of the burrito in order to half-ass conjure some kind of shape they think resembles an edible product.  I still go here because it s chipotle and you can t mess up a burrito bowl and tortilla on the side. But the days I want a burrito - those are terrible days.

The burrito shell was a ripped on the corner and they still gave it. And then tried to shove everything in it as it was ripping. I had to ask for extra everything bc they were either barely had any or barely put any. The pico  corn and veggies they just spooned on and didn t let any water drain from the spoon. Not only was the burrito not closed but the foil on top too and they didn t give me a bag  so I left with a half opened burrito. Before I even opened it  it spilled on my shirt. I could not eat it bc it was so soggy and falling apart. It was disgusting. I get the same ingredients and amounts every time so it s not that  it s their utter laziness and lack of care.

Wow  this place is the BEST.  Choosing your own ingredients  happy and helpful service  great decor and delicious food.    I always get the same thing  a bowl  with extra cilantro  and it is delightful every time.   Their guacamole is super fresh and delicious too.
Essentially one of the largest burritos I ve had was right here at this Chipotle. Decent tasting for the price but extra for the guacamole.

Talk about spectacular management  And staff    Tried to call in my order and couldn t  few minutes later manager calls me back ready to take my order apologizing    Talk about customer service and satisfaction    Thank u chipotle

I m very hungry waiting in line here. They appear to have a large to go order ahead of me  but the employees all have their heads down  meticulously constructing the tacos at a glacial pace. Meanwhile  my wife and I are standing  unacknowledged and hungry. A little communication would go a long way. We ve just finished shopping at the local Sams for bulk snacks  and the last thing we needed was slow service on a Sunday. The lord s day. I believe there needs to be a shift in the store culture. Pride taken in the small interactions  the eye contact  the sense of urgency in accommodating hungry Austinites. I will say  one woman working had a smile on her face  which offered a light reprieve from the otherwise heavily unenthusiastic environment we unfortunately had to occupy. Further  the sloppily thrown together sofritas burrito was unsurprisingly scrumptious. Just what I expect from a well established brand like Chipotle. Silver linings aside  I will not visit this location again  and will instead take my business about 500 yards south to the next nearest location near Mattress Firm.

Good food  same standard . V sloppy service. Girl rushed thru everything   even though there was just one person behind  me . She got most things wrong  and more importantly  did not give me time to even say  double meat . Not my favorite location...

This Anderson Lane Chipotle is a typical Chipotle  fast  friendly  popular  tasty  organic locally-sourced leaning  clean  hip  as healthy as you want it to be  and cheap.  I hate this Chipotle opening here because I live nearby and it s too convenient to drop by and suddenly accumulate 1100 calories from a  5.95 Vegetarian burrito... but that s just my own lack of self-discipline.  Parking is easy and plentiful.  It is the right east neighbor of Cover 3 Sports Bar that s next to the Village shopping center   entertainment complex.  The parking areas are connected so you can easily eat dinner here first before watching a movie at the Village Alamo Drafthouse.
The service was quick and the food  awesome for the reason it earned five-star this is one place in Austin that I will definitely recommend and revisit

This is pure utility food.   When desperation hit and I was short on time and needed some calories  I found myself here. I decided on a bowl. Here s a tip...don t ask them to  go light  on anything. I asked them to go light on the rice and cheese. Regretfully  I wasn t paying attention and ended up with barely a tablespoon of rice and a light sprinkle of cheese. My sad looking container looked pathetic and half empty. Complete with a drink  my meal rang in at over  10. Hardly worth the money.  The flavor was...wait  there was none. It had no flavor. Luckily  they have bottles of Tobasco sauce handy  so I was able to drown it in hot sauce and at the very least trick my taste buds into thinking I was eating real food.  I can t honestly say I won t be back  as it s convenient in times of desperation...and I m sure I ll find myself here when I m in a bind.   That ll teach me to leave my lunch at home...

Okay  so in general I am not a fan of national chains.  In fact  I d usually choose a Mom  amp  Pop shop over even a regional chain in most cases.  But the new Chipotle Mexican Grill at The Village is definitely an exception for me.    Because I have two friends who are  for whatever reason  completely addicted to Chipotle dining  I have frequented many of the stores in the Austin area.    I have to say... the new Village Location is a cut above the rest.  The managers  who I now know by name as they do me  are great and extremely attentive and dedicated to customer service.  Yes  it s just a burrito...  or tacos  or a salad  a bowl  or whatever .  But the Village Chipotle folks make the experience a good one.  It s no wonder we frequent that location the most now     And yes... the guac ROCKS   I have never experienced anything other than generous portions.  So I ll be back... over and over again  I m sure. Even if my waistline suffers somewhat because of it.  But hey... I know the Weight Watchers point values for just about everything on the menu at this point. Go figure.

Since I work in the Village and am extreeemely lazy  I probably eat at this Chipotle about three times a week  sometimes more .  The ingredients are great  the steak is medium rare -- mwah    the service is usually quick  and the employees are always super friendly.  Chuck must be  like  the greatest manager in the world  because this Chipotle has better employee retention than most of the companies my friends work for.  It s clear that his employees take so much care and pride in what they do here  which seems like a silly thing to say about a fast food burrito place  but it really does not go unnoticed in my book.  Today was my buddy s birthday  and I wanted to treat him to lunch.   Don t worry -- he likes Chipotle as much as I do.   Candyce was her usual bubbly self  wished my friend a happy birthday  and made sure that his burrito bowl was on the house.  Thanks  Candyce   It was about time I updated this to a five-star review
Always a fan and food is good. I always get the bowl which is filling. Great place to go to.
Angel made our fave experience even better. Thank you for the great customer service tonight  along with the rest of the night crew  All extra fresh ingredients.
