They re not trying to be authentic  they re trying to be tasty  They ve certainly succeeded at that.  I ve been loyal at this particular branch for a while now. One of the coolest things that I ve noticed about Chipotle  at multiple locations  is after a while the employees start to recognize you and throw in extra perks for your repeat business.   It s a great way to give loyalty discounts  and also kinda make you feel like you re appreciated. Maybe that sounds silly to you  but that extra touch definitely made the difference for me

Definitely meh.  The food is good quality. Here s the problem. There s just not much variety as far as toppings go.  And the only non-chunky salsa is an insanely hot salsa that only adds heat  not flavor.  Count me firmly in the Freebirds or Cabo Bob s camps.

Pros   -fast service  even when there s a long line  -meat is always juicy   Cons   -my biggest complaint  what happened to the portion size    My most recent visit there  the lady gave me a little scoop of chicken. I was so disappointed   -there s really only seating for two to four people. The dining area is really narrow  so you d likely end up eating three feet away from the assembly line of workers if you don t go outside to eat. Not good for big groups.

This place is terrible. They shake pretty much all the meat off but when it comes to the other items they ll give you a huge scoop. When I ask for the meat they shook off they charge me like  4 for  extra  meat. There are other burrito restaurants around this chipotle. Go there instead. They won t over charge you like this place.

I found a roach in my bowl    -- My lunch was ruined that day and the manager did not want to refund me my money. I will no longer be visiting this location  I have had issues at this location multiple times  but this is the final straw

Swung by here for a quick snack lunch.  Got chicken tacos.  They were delish  haven t eaten Chipotle for awhile.  Ate outside  the nice thing about that is the birds stalk you the whole time.  When you stand up they bombard the table and clean it in 3 seconds flat.   No i m not kidding   Fast and good food  not busy for a weekend.

Very disappointed. This is the second time my boyfriend and I have ordered pick up delivery from this location and have received minimal amounts of food. Hardly any protein  minimal greens  and a laughable amount of salsa. We love Chipotle  but we will be sure to only dine-in from now on.

I may have eaten here once before  and for some reason I thought my second time should be through a delivery service. Not sure why I wasted the extra money on chipotle. Ordered tacos on corn and I got them on flour. I m celiac so they went in the trash.   cornmeanscorn

This is honestly one of the worse locations ever. I ve given this place so many chances but today is definitely the last day I ll ever go. They re incredibly inconsistent with everything. You d think they listen to how you want your order but they ll look you right in the face and do everything wrong. Besides customer service being frustrating the food isn t fresh most if not all the times I ve gone. Hope they get their stuff together.

My cousins went to eat at Chipotle Mexican Grill here  in Austin  Texas and got REALLY SICK a couple of hours later. I do not understand why people continue to eat at this restaurant. They are to be avoided at all costs.

I m not new to the chipotle scene  but new to this location which is why I gave the low rating.   The bag of chips I bought were completely stale and in the guac I found pieces of the shell and the stem.   Could be a one time thing  but Definitely won t be putting that to the test.

Food was decent  normal Chipotle  but the SERVICE was quite disappointing. It was strange. It felt like we were intruding on their day or something. And we are friendly  smiley people  It was like they were all in their own world back behind the counter  amp  having to go out of their way to fix our food and ring us up.

Bad experience with this place and their catering department. We placed an order for our staff meeting. First  you have to call their 1-800   to place a catering order rather than dealing with the local store. I don t like dealing with the 1-800   because it seems they don t exactly sync with whatever local store you end up using. For example  we are tax exempt  however  the catering line cannot remove the taxes on delivered orders. You can only do that by going into the store itself. No other place does that.   But  the worst thing was when the delivery driver forgot part of our order and how much trouble it was to get the matter taken care of. So I called the local store to have them bring the rest of our order. I was then informed  by someone who I could barely understand  that they don t do the deliveries. They use Door Dash even for the catering jobs. So they blamed the Door Dash guy saying they had all of the order but he forgot it and I need to call the catering line. Then I called the catering line and explained what happened. Then they put me on hold while they called the local store  then came back and put me on hold while they called Door Dash. Meanwhile  my meeting was about to break for lunch. So the catering line person came back and said Door Dash would bring the rest of our order. OK  fine. So I went back to the meeting and a few minutes later I heard this loud BANG. I didn t think much about it  but a few minutes later I left to wait for the delivery  thinking they would call me from the front desk  and there was my order sitting on a table. The Door Dash person apparently brought the rest of our food and slammed it on the table loud enough to make the loud bang sound. At this point I was just hoping no one spit in our queso  Was he mad for a mistake HE made   So is my beef with Door Dash  the local store  or the Chipotle catering line  The truth is I don t know either  but in my opinion  the 3 entities should have worked together and they didn t. So until that is cleared up  we won t be ordering from Chipotle again. The food wasn t that great anyway - ice cold tortillas and dry meat. Thank goodness we were able to nuke the tortillas.
It s good food.  Don t ask for extra sour cream when ordering online though... Woah. I m drowning in cream  Think I shall word it quite differently next time...
Thanks Chipotle  for eliminating crappy fast food burger joints from my diet. And no  I don t care that your burritos contain over 1000 calories. You know what they say  the more the merrier.

if you get a salad here... please  please please skip the sour cream. OMG that was gross. the rest of it was ok.   the bf got the salad b c I did and he enjoyed hiswith beans and rice. I had to get it without the rice.  try it.

2.5 stars.  Every now and then I ll order at a place like this and they ll ask me   Will this be for here or to go   and I ll say  for here.  And for some reason they ll still wrap it up to go.  I know this is most likely due to bored  inattentive employees going through the motions and forgetting what I just  a minute or two ago  said.  But I can t help but feel like it s a passive-aggressive signal that they really want me to take my food and get out.   Anyway  I got my barbacoa burrito and after taking it out of the bag and unwrapping it  sat at a table  as I had intended to do all along. This was my first trip to Chipotle  and I d heard good things. I think people who rave about it probably live in places without Mexican food. It isn t bad at all  and in Austin we don t have many places that serve burritos  so I was happy to try it. But it isn t as good as Freebirds and it s nowhere near as good as Cabo Bob s.  Rice in a burrito  I know that s standard at some places. But it s weird. A carb wrapped in a carb. Like french fries on a hamburger. Some people think it s a good idea. It isn t.  Halfway through my meal  a pink  watery liquid was draining out from my burrito. I guess the water from the salsa was mixing with the water from the beans  but it mixed with my sour cream to make an unappetizing  soggy mess.  Tables were dirty  drink selection was meh  iced tea  Powerade  Mr. Pibb  and about four Coke products . There s a patio that s probably nice on a sunny  warm day.  It s a big meal for one person. I brought home 1 3 of it for another day  though I m not sure if the watery salsa runoff will make it too gross to eat.  Smashburger is just down the street.

On Thursday  July 12th  I ate dinner at this location and came down with food poisoning from a salad with steak. I haven t left the bed or toilet all day. It has truly been a frightening Friday the 13th.   I can definitively point it to Chipotle s steak  as my wife and I ordered the same thing except the meat  and she was fine. From what I ve researched  this is a growing trend across America and Chipotle can t be trusted in food quality. That was my last time eating at any Chipotle.
Always my go to  fast food.  Fresh produce  responsibly sourced meat and the best iced tea in town. Usually chipotle is a better deal than any other tex-mex options. I wish I could eat it every day
Good food  great atmosphere. Great place for lunch. You can even get a beer and relax a bit.
Decent food. Decent prices.   Terrible parking lot. Lackluster staff.   Short review for chain restaurants.

Oooh  Chipotle. How you do me right.  Yesterday I rushed in during lunch times to grab a chicken burrito. I m always at odds with Chipotle because if I don t control myself I can down a whole burrito. This is clearly wrong  given their size.   They re very speedy and the food is always fresh and flavorful. Luckily yesterday I had the sense to cut that foil beast in half so as to ensure another proper meal. I don t care if they never remember me. I don t care if it s a chain. I don t care that I am judging myself to the max for even being there. Edited to add  Judgment is not for any former McDonalds affiliations  it s simply for the amount of food they provide and my parents continuing on the traditions of their Depression Era parents who insist upon cleaning one s plate.  I am 100  victim to Chipotle s wiles. You should be  too.

My 8 year old came down with food poisoning after eating at this location. He had a steak burrito with white rice  black beans  guac  sour cream  and cheese. Thankfully  he only ate a small portion of the burrito  but he was very sick within 8 hours.  Fun times.

Excellent  always fresh  good taste  value and what means the most to me is consistency. Love that I can go here everyday for a week while on the road and get something new  different and always be good  burritos are always good  but the grilled chicken tacos  3  are my  current  favorite. Get a flour  two corn  grilled chicken and a beef fajita meat  then change up the toppings and aways surprised at how great the flavors are

This Chipotle location is in a trendy party of town  and fairly close to my office. It s new  it s clean  it s nice looking. However coming here is a logistics nightmare. The parking is a disaster  there are rarely open spots. There s always a line to the door causing a wait  and it s gotten expensive.   Adding guac to my burrito bowl put the price at an even  9.90. And that s with no drink or sides. That s outrageous to spend  10 for what I consider a fast food lunch  It s not even as if this is healthy food. Carbs  meat  tons and tons of sodium. Sprinkling salty tomatoes and a handful of lettuce on a bowl of rice and beans doesn t make it good for you  -  Just slightly better than the greasy sawdust meals from a drive-thru restaurant. The food is bland. Take away the salt and there really is no flavor. They trick you into think it s hipster-friendly health food while they promote their organic  local-trade image and stamp moral philosophy articles on their take out bags...You re just paying for an idea backed with nothingness.   I might as well go down the street to HEB  pick up a pre-packed sandwich for  4 and be done with it. At least there I can find a parking spot within 400 ft of the doors.  When you get 20 min to grab lunch  the time walking to and from the car adds up   I don t plan on coming back again. I might just be over Chipotle in general.
Fast service and friendly staff. The downfall is this place doesn t have a lot of parking for such a high volume of people. But overall great sevice.
Got me a chicken burrito and granted that the scoop was I guess smaller than usual  food was still bomb as hell.  Glad I found this location much closer to home than going more outer area.

I honestly gave this place one star because i had to put a star but if it was up to me i would give it a 0  Dont get me wrong i love chipotle and the food is great  I thought this place was great because its 3 minutes away from my job. The only problem is every time i go they give me very small portions of the food and my co-workers say the same thing and when you tell them about it they give you an attitude and thats not good customer service. From now on i try to avoid this place just because of the workers and ive been to several chipotles and this is the only place that dosnt give you a reasnable amount.

My coworker and I ordered our lunch from Chipotle online for delivery.  It was due to be delivered by 11 30.  When I tracked the meal it stated that it was delivered by DoorDash at 11 22.  Door Dash was their delivery provider  not my choice  The food never came.  I called the Chipotle location at Barbara Jordan in Austin to inquire about the delivery.  The food was still sitting in the restaurant at 12 30.  They suggested that I just come pick it up...hello  I ordered delivery for a reason  I was charged the delivery charge and the food was cold and soggy by that time.  The manager  Logan was  not at all helpful. He even spoke the words  and I quote   Ma am  I don t have time to be on the phone with DoorDash to resolve this   He wouldn t help with getting it delivered  refunded or anything.  He referred me to the website and corporate to get my money back.  No refund  no apology  no people skills whatsoever.  If Chipotle is going to contract with DoorDash for delivery services  they need to work with them to rectify any issues.  I ate my lunch from the vending machine today. Chipotle and Door Dash have lost a customer in me.  Lamar J.  door dash delivery person and Logan  manager at this Chipotle location  you have both managed to alienate a repeat customer. I have asked for a refund through the corporate website  since no one would take the time to rectify our issue.  The refund will take two to three days to process and I am going out on a limb to predict that the delivery fee and driver s tip will not be refunded.  I understand that things happen and outside contractors can drop the ball  but if you choose to affiliate your business with a delivery company you need to understand that their issues reflect on your business and more importantly your management people need to step up.  I was polite and understanding right up to the point that he stated that he didn t have time for us.  Seriously   I don t have time or money for Chipotle if that is the best they can do.

This location is painfully slow and don t have the skill of being efficiently speedy. At the location on Bee Caves or Brodie I can go in  order  and be out in less than 5 minutes because they are READY for it. Yes  it might be due to the higher concentration of office workers during the day in SW Austin  but it took me 15-20 minutes to stand in line  not the first time  on a Wed night in Mueller  which was to the door  and from my perception others weren t exactly thrilled either.  My opinion on a fast-food burrito chain where people expect to be in and out  especially at a place like Chipotle where speed is somewhat of an appealing factor... is that it should be fast. Regardless of if it s lunch or dinner or the suburbs or the city. Something I rely on Chipotle for is being able to be in and out when I need good food in a hurry.   This visit made me late to my meeting and even though I stuck it out because honestly  I do really like Chipotle  I was thinking of running over to the restaurants nearby. If a branch of a fast-food chain isn t fast and they re potentially losing business over that  then that s a problem.   To me   this Chipotle is losing its reputation to a more efficient location  and that s coming from someone who visits multiple locations. Maybe for others who aren t regularly pressed for time  then that s not a problem.  A  for the food and the polite staff  but chances are I won t be returning unless I want to wait 20 minutes v. 5 minutes to get my food.

I visit Chipotle at least twice a week.  Today I happened to be near this location and stopped there for my first time the food was good but the serving size I received was the smallest I have ever received at any Chipotle.

I can see how someone living in a city that isn t in Texas might want to eat  a burrito from Chipotle.  They re huge   tasty  and your number of options are not all that limited.  But I live in Austin and can find better  cheaper Mexican food from one of the numerous taquerias that litter the Austin landscape as frequently as churches.  In fact  we could free up a lot of space if we combined the two.  Every church should also house a taqueria and every taqueria should provide spiritual support for at least one faith.    These are the kinds of brilliant plans I come up with daily.

I really enjoy Chipolte and I really enjoy this particular Chipolte.  The staff is really friendly and welcoming  the food is so tasty  the seating  inside and out  is comfortable and nice. The bf and I share bowls and there s always more than enough food for us both.   The ingredients are fresh and pretty darn tasty. I don t feel guilty taking the kids here when I don t feel like cooking.

I like pretty much every Chipotle location  but this one was particularly good.  The store wasn t very busy  so when I arrived  the workers greeted me cheerfully and kept thanking me for coming.  The girl who made my tacos prepared them really well and even offered me rice and beans  which I think usually only come on the burrito.    The prices here  as at other locations  are very fair considering the quality of the food and the quantity you get.  It s about  6 for a burrito  3 soft tacos  4 crispy tacos  or a burrito bol  no tortilla .  The Chipotle meats are lean and tasty  and there are more options than at Freebirds  fajita chicken  fajita beef  carnitas  and barbacoa.  This location doesn t have a ton of seating  but when I went  it wasn t crowded at all and the whole place was immaculately clean.

I m a Freebirds convert  half-birds don t leave me feeling ridiculously full with a quarter burrito waste leftover  but this Chipotle is in the new Mueller shopping center  which is awesome because my husband and I are within biking distance.  They have a nice outdoor patio.  We ve been a couple times.  A few days ago  the cashier kept making jokes a la Stewie Griffin of  Family Guy  to the girl making our burritos  and wouldn t shut up long enough for her to finish our food nor for him to ring it up  which was kind of awkward  but that was an isolated  weird incident.    Orange soda on the fountain   y all

I ve been to various Chipotle a few times and have been let down each time.   Overpriced  under flavored  limited options. As an example  their only salsa option is Tabasco  albeit three different types.  On the positive side  the ingredients are always fresh.  If you want a burrito  go elsewhere IMO.

New Chipotle location at Mueller.  A couple of notes   - this location is the ONLY food place open over at the Mueller shopping center as of 6 27 07.  This is a master stroke of brilliance for these guys since the Dell Children s hospital just opened and they are less than a block away.   - generally speaking  I don t really like Chipotle that much. They make a serviceable burrito  but for my money I d rather go someplace else.  - however  if someone s buying you lunch and price isn t an issue... then I suggest getting a chicken burrito with the grilled veggies and guacamole. When you re really freaking hungry halfway thru a 10-hour work day  it will actually hit the spot quite nicely  but again - only because I didn t have to pay for it .

You know how some people are either Chipotle people or they re Freebirds people  Count me firmly in the Freebirds camp.   Chipotle just makes a bland  salty burrito. The salsas are okay  but none of them are actually very spicy. Oh  and the salt. Seriously  I like the fact that they re committed to using natural ingredients. I like that this location is new  shiny and open without feeling cold and antiseptic. The staff is always friendly and helpful. You even have tasty Izze drinks  which are delish. Still  every time I come here  I just end up thinking  blecch  that s one salty freakin  burrito.    The worst offender seems to be the cilantro-lime rice. One  you irk me for not offering  fistfuls of fresh cilantro.  Oh  but we have this rice with cilantro in it  doesn t cut it. I want fistfuls of greenery in my burrito  and lettuce is too freakin  bland. Two  it s just a salt-bomb. I can t taste the cilantro for the salt. So  no rice for moi.   C mon  Chipotle. Just because you re technically  fast food  doesn t mean you have to follow all the rules of fast food. You re already breaking quite a few of those rules by sourcing fresh ingredients that d be no stranger in a Whole Foods. Now work on the gottdanged salt.   I just don t feel like Chipotle has enough ingredients to really warrant being an assembly-line joint  either. I guess there s some merit to being able to peek over the counter and tell them how much you want of certain items  but for the most part  meh. There s not enough variety  and there s nothing here that really entices me to come back. Sure  they offer barbacoa  but when there s myriad taquerias to be had that do it SO much better  what s the point    Seriously  guys--explore your local taquerias instead. Before Waco got a Chipotle  we had a Taqueria Arandas  and their giant Super California burrito still kicks the crap out of any Chipotle ever  period  not even a contest.   Overall  this is a very nice location of a very mediocre chain.

oh Chipotle  you got problems other than just the e coli thing at this location.   Of the staff  exactly 2 people were employed  the nice lady working the line  and the checkout lady with the warm smile. Everybody else was so busy discussing their personal stuff I hated to interrupt  particularly the girl blocking the door when I tried to go in as she leaned into an extended shoutout.    There are lots of other Chipotles elsewhere in town--this one s not even convenient to the staff.

What can I say   I m a sucker for the Parmer Metric location.  I used to go there once a week and they knew me there.  Not sure if that mattered or not but the food was always really good.  I came to this location for the first time last week.  It was later in the afternoon and not a lot of people working.  It took a hot minute for anyone to greet me get my order started.  There was literally one person in front of me.  When my order got started I had to repeat  bowl  about 3-5 times because the employee was holding a huge tortilla.  When my bowl finally started getting made  it was made haphazardly.  Ingredients were just thrown in and no thought was given to even distribution.  I know  I know  it s  fast food .  Whatever  it s a peeve of mine.  Also  the ingredients were so skimpy it was as if they were getting rewarded for less waste.  I also found the butt of an onion in my bowl.  It was kind of gross.

Visited September 9th around 1.15 pm  one of the workers the bigger Hispanic woman closer to register at that time gave  me wrong salsa and I could tell  exactly that it was on purpose. The managers need to make sure they get only people with stamina to do standing jobs to work here. She did not have a single one of the thirteen worker qualities you proclaim.  The location is good but the service is average.Some of the staff is grumpy -happens when multiple race and age group  workers work together.No flow. The salsas were considerably less tasty compared to other locations. Are they taking shortcuts  The staff changes in a matter of weeks  hope the new ones are trained better.

As an avid Chipotle customer in Dallas. I felt that this location has poor communication because there are too many people working on the line and it creates clutter. I was extremely appalled that as I was grabbing my credit card to pay  the cashier skipped me and grabbed the lady s card behind me. I felt it was extremely rude because apparently I did not move fast enough for her. I also did not enjoy my food because the chicken was too salty. I am obsessed with chipotle and this experience tainted that for a moment. I will not return to this Austin location.

If you have ever watched the documentary Food Inc. then you can easily comprehend my 5 star review without reading any further.  My 5 star does include the service at this particular Chipotle Grill.    However  for those that have not seen the documentary here is why I like Chipotle.  They serve naturally raised pork  chicken and beef.  Steve Ells founder and CEO of Chipotle is an advocate for eliminating the use of antibiotics in ranching.  Their corporate commitment is to provide customers with  Food with Integrity  visit their website at   a href   redir url http 3A 2F 2Fwww.chipotle.com 2Fen-US 2Ffwi 2Ffwi.aspx amp s 9be05edcc1b4735c2c2036d8d5156f857141309e178a8c2d198a0472b6c8ea79  rel  nofollow  target  _blank  chipotle.com en-US fwi f   a  for more information...  This particular location has a great staff  and they are fairly quick.  I always get the burrito bowl with chicken  steak  black beans  rice  corn  pico  cilantro  guacamole and cheese.  The serving is perfect for me and I normally share it with the BF.  The price is right   If you decided to go during the rush hour you may not find a seat in the dining area  aside from that seats have always been available when I visited this restaurant.

I like Chipotle for its portion size. It s a pretty hearty sized buritto made with fresh ingredients. My portion size tends to be bigger so a sandwich from lets say Wich-Wich right next door does not fill me up at all. The freshness of their ingredients and their flavors are great pluses as well. The service has been pretty consistent here  even with the trainees. This place is starting to become my go-to place for dinner when I don t feel like cooking. The place is also right next to shopping places like Bed Bath  amp  Beyond  Best Buy  Staples  and Home Depot.  The only complaint I have is the price.  7.20 after tax burrito  for carnitas  is almost the price of a sit-in restaurant. But that s generic to all the Chipotle stores.

I went in knowing that it wasn t a Mexican place rather an American-Mexican place. Well I ordered the salad with chicken  brown rice  tomato  and salsa. At the check out I ordered chips. I HATED the food I had to forcibly eat it because I was starving  but boy was it awful. Service was nice. I wont ever come back though  I would rather go to Pad Thai or Smashburger both are in walking distance from this place.

Thank you Chipotle for helping me out when I was starving. It was not yet 11 00 a.m. and you graciously opened your doors to me when you saw the look of hunger on my face as I waited outside for you to open.   All the ladies working at this location are very friendly and fast.  The burritos are tasty enough  especially the barbacoa.

Let me just say that I never enjoyed Chipotle until I came to this one. For some reason  it is special   Great location in the Barbara Jordan Mueller 51st shopping center. And everyone who works here is super nice and friendly. I feel like every time I go in I get a compliment  What an ego boost  which I definitely need  considering all the burritos I m now eating .

Ridiculousness   I ordered the burrito bowl with chicken.  Very  very little chicken.  And the chicken was very fatty and tissue-filled.  I couldn t enjoy the meal without biting down on fatty tissue   With as little meat that s given  you would think it would at least be all meat   Never going back here again   They give you LOTS of rice  sufficient amount of beans a little meat and a little cheese for a BIG price.  So not worth it especially in light of the fact that they are just now getting customers back due to the e.coli

Great customer service  There was a mix-up with my order and the one behind me  which I didn t notice until I got home. I called and they offered to make me a new one at no charge. When I got there  there was a bit of a line  through I was still in there for no more than five minutes  and everyone in line was given a free drink. These were seriously the nicest Chipotle workers I ve ever interacted with  They went above and beyond in fixing their mistake  and I never once felt I was inconveniencing them. Highly recommend

This is my favorite location the staff is super friendly the place is always clean and the food is great now with a family of 6 the price isn t all the bad 4 kids meals and 2 adult meals comes out to  30. I could eat chipotle everyday if I lived next to one.

I incredibly appreciate the quality of the food  and the friendly staff.  The portions are plentiful and eating there means a great fresh meal whose taste is really fantastic at an  affordable price. When I either don t have the time or the energy to make my own meals  this is my number one go to restaurant.

This is the only Yelp reveiw I have ever written because this is the first time I have ever been pissed enough to write one. I was giving Chipotle a second chance today  and it failed miserably. The first time I visited  was not a great experience  gave me the runs and it was far inferior to Moe s SouthWest Grill  which has a plenthera of different toppings  chips are free and salsa is unlimited . But they don t really have any Moe s resturants in Austin so I wanted to give Chipotle a second chance. The food was meh at best but the reason I m writing this is because the employees straight up suck. A little old lady behind me spilled water all over the place  the table  her seat  the floor  and her white pants  The lady she was with was visually impared  using a cane to try and make her way to the stand to get napkins. The employees did NOTHING. Didnt help her clean or get napkins or mop up or even put a wet floor sign out. Nothing. They only cleaned up the floor AFTER she left and someone else had to ask them before they did. An employee walked past her THREE TIMES. I was helping her clean up  but just because someone else  a customer  is willing to help doesn t mean you shouldn t step in as an employee to provide minimal service. The visually impared lady with her could have slipped with all the water that was on the floor  she could have gotten seriously hurt if she fell. They seriously need to be retrained or SOMETHING. If for no other reason  to avoid a lawsuit.

This place is great  Your standard Chipotle and very fast at that. I love their antibiotic-free meat and the dressing for their salad is delicious. I m in and out of here in no time  with not much money spent.

This is my favorite Chipotle in Austin. The staff is friendly and very generous with servings. The only downside is its proximity to the Children s Hospital  which can result in extremely busy lunch times  so plan accordingly.

You missed an opportunity Chipotle. I have had people tell me that I need to try your restaurant so I finally did  but I will not be back if it s my choice. I will give you points for having a clean restaurant and smiling faces  but it s going to stop pretty much right there. I could have gotten a better meal somewhere else. All of the smiling servers who I talked to spoke so fast and mumbled that I had ask each one of them to repeat themselves before I could finish my order. The clerk who rang my meal up dropped my change into my hand and it rolled onto the floor. He made an attempt to correct himself by simply saying  sorry   and then looked quickly to the next customer. I sat down with my steak burrito hoping that the steak pieces were going to be as good as I anticipated but I was disappointed. I could have gotten a better meat add a hot dog stand. I ll give you a star because I m not hungry anymore.
This is what you think it is going to be. Its the subway for quasi mexican food. I go once or twice a month and get tacos or salad and have not been disappointed once.

I am a fan of chipotle  and this one was particularly nice mostly because the server gave us giant servings of everything. Quite possibly because it was kinda late at night and just before closing  so obviously they felt generous.

I love Chipotle. I m at this one at least 4 times a month  sometimes more depending on where clients have me going.  Everything is always fresh and tasty  and very consistent.  Food seems to be handled well  and the line moves fast.  This one is a bit smallish inside  but has a nice outside patio area.    They re great when ordering a bunch for the office  too.  Either pass around the fax form  or hit the web page  iPhone app.
I eat here pretty often  its real convenient for me and the food is great  Its never cold  its a clean place  amp  the staff is really friendly

The staff is very friendly. The food is sooo good and this location always gives very good portions. Even when the place is busy I can get in and out and still make good timing. Chipotle is the best ever and thats a fact.

Ok...so Chipotle called me this week and told me that I won the drawing from the buisness card fishbowl. 10 Free Burritos  I was excited   Then they proceeded to tell me that I had to pick a day and time that wouldnt inconvenience the staff and also I had no choice what was in the burrito but the meat.  I know beggers cant be choosers but really   What about my coworkers who dont like beans or are lactose intolerant   Dont think this is really the way to promote trying Chipotle.  Bad taste in my mouth right now.  I think Freebirds is right around the corner too.

I ordered a margarita with my lunch. It tasted like water with a small bit of lime flavoring. After 1 sip  I asked to get my money back. The cashier  manager   told me that I could not get a refund  but I could choose another drink.  That is ludicrous  I paid for a margarita which cost  4.50 and I didn t want another drink. I ended up with a bottle of water which in effect cost me  4.50.  I am never returning and I will tell my friends. I feel that I was robbed.

Quick place to pick up tacos for breakfast  I had potato and bean this morning  and the tacos were delicious. The tacos stay together well and even once I put the salsa on  they weren t too drippy  so I could eat them in the car without making a mess.
Only had their breakfast tacos. These are good breakfast tacos - not skimpy and flavorful filling. The Shack taco is my personal favorite. Definitely up there in the breakfast taco game.

Best crispy beef tacos in town  If I m craving a crispy taco I m not satisfied unless I go here. Great price also  Can t beat it  The staff is awesome and super friendly   HIT EM UP   You won t be disappointed.

Taco Shack is really good. I think many people assume it s a step down from Taco Deli or Torchy s  but the quality of their food is just as good. Taco Shack is just more old school than those more  hip  taco joints  so you go here when you want more traditional breakfast tacos.  I personally love their breakfast bowls which allow you select from 4 ingredients you want to include. I recommend the ham  amp  black beans.  Taco Shack serves lunch  amp  dinner  but it really shines in the AM for breakfast. Next time you are craving a hearty  delicious breakfast taco then go to Taco Shack.
Messed up my order  amp  didn t want to replace it.  Over  30 worth of food. I m so upset  ridiculous.

Staff behind counter NOT wearing masks and food prep cooks NOT wearing masks. The customer in front of me requested them to wear mask and front staff laughed at her and said no. We left. Staff needs to take this seriously  Have been coming here for years and am extremely disappointed not taking customers safety seriously.

Just got into an actual argument with an employee at this location about weather I ordered flour or corn tortillas. I ve never eaten here it s my first and my last time the employee didn t even remake my food they just moved the taco from flour to corn after I had to explain over and over that I ordered corn tortillas due to a flour allergy. The employee was upset and defensive and completely unprofessional. A sickening thing I see from low class workers is the blatant disrespect they have against clients that have food allergies I get this all over town and it just incentives me to not eat out at trash places like this.

Stopped by for a quick breakfast taco here and while I will say that the speed of the service was impressive  the taco itself was really not. First of all  the ingredients were pretty stuck to the foil when I unwrapped it  so it became pretty messy in the car. Second  the chorizo within the taco just didn t taste great. All that to say  if you find yourself in Austin  TX  you re surrounded by options for breakfast tacos. So this doesn t need to be your first. However  perhaps trying one with bacon or sausage would be worth it.

Taco shack is a snack that does not quite have the knack to crack a 3 star rating. Hope you liked my soundtrack. I ll be releasing it soon  just kidding don t worry  your ears are safe .  It s not bad by any means. In fact  I was pleasantly surprised by the taste of their breakfast tacos. I had the shack taco and the texan taco. The biggest drawback has to be the price given the size. Simple breakfast tacos should not be costing  3.50 or so each. Now don t get me wrong  it tasted fine  but at the end of the day  I was wishing I had by  7 back to buy a bigger and more satisfying meal.  I wouldn t mind coming back if they lowered their prices  but I don t that ll happen anytime soon. In the meantime go to taco joint instead for a better tasting and better bargain of a taco.

7.47  for two tacos with eggs      Yeah this is very poor quality food I ordered the Texan taco the way how they prepare the taco is just drop egg few slices of old taste beef and that s it they not even mix the egg with the meat because everything is prepared long time ago. Thats why is not fresh  second taco . shack taco  the chorizo was old and dry. The egg same thing just drop the egg and they put the chorizo on top and ready.  Don t want to comeback to any of this restaurant for this bad experience   Cashier not helpful  I ask the cashier are both menus are same    He said yes  after I ordered I noticed that the other menu was different. But well. Is over
Cute little stop on the way downtown.really yummy and pretty quick service nice to sit down and look on ongoing traffic

This morning I had an awful enough experience that I am motivated to write this review immediately.  Here is the short version   The young man working the order window was unfriendly.  He compounded his unfriendliness with incompetence.  As a result  today was my last visit to Taco Shack  which makes me sad  because I ve been a customer going all the way back to the original shack.  For the curious reader who wants to indulge my venting  here are the details   I placed my order for four tacos.   Lest you think me a pig  two were for a friend.   There was apparently a breakdown in communication because the pickup window announced there were six tacos ready for me.  Now let s stop right here.  Suppose the communication error that resulted in this mistake was the fault of the young man who took my order.  He should fix that mistake and my order.  Now suppose the communication error was my fault.  Okay  but I m the customer  right   The solution is the same   Fix the mistake by correcting my order.  The young man and I had fruitless discussion about the cause of the mistake  he was firm in his conviction that I was the culprit  and instead of fixing the mistake he suggested that I was two tacos ahead and should be pleased.  I was not.  But rather than waste any more time on a Sunday morning I took the bag of six tacos because the young order-taker went out of his way to point out that  my  four tacos were among the six.  Fine.  I just want to get out of this thunderstorm and eat my tacos at home.  I didn t even seek a refund for the two tacos I didn t order.  Here s the punchline   Two of the four  correct  tacos were not the correct tacos.  So of the the six tacos in my bag  a mere one-third were correct.  That s a score of 33 .  Fail.

I love this restaurant  with a few caveats. The burnet road burrito is amazing. I have recently been a fan of their breakfast bowl  which is both cheap and very tasty. My biggest problem with taco shack is their lack of variation. The only vegetable they have on their menu is pico  which is great  but I would love some other options. Mushrooms  onions  spinach. Anything  Please please add vegetables to your menu      Also  I think you would get a lot more customers if you cooked fresh eggs on the grill

Space        Not sure how you rate a shack. It s not trying to be anything fancy. It s no frills with a window to order and a window to pick up. There s some shades seating around the side and a few parking spots in front.   Food  4 5 the tacos were tasty and definitely stuffed full. The Texan taco had a really hearty portion of well seasoned steak. I would say the potatoes in the Shack taco were a little tried out.

I was recently at their location on Guadalupe St. and while I waiting for my food  I noticed that the employees were not wearing gloves or masks. The employee preparing my food stuck her bare hand into a bag of cheese. During times like these  spread of COVID-19  it is unacceptable for a restaurant to remain open and not take any safety precautions to prevent the spread of the virus. Although I did receive a refund for my order  I am more concerned about the health of other customers.
Have been here a few times for coffee only  which is very good. First stop today for food and was pleasantly surprised by their veggie crumble. I ll be back

I didn t really have any high expectations to let down  but it did waste a moment for good breakfast tacos. This place is really easy to drive by and not give a second look  and it s pretty much the same for their food-although I am surprised it was pretty busy when I went.   To be fair  it isn t as sketchy as it looks from the street  but I would suggest a more open more inviting look for publicity. The parking situation is a mess  and frankly  my roommate and I never figured it out.   For the important stuff  FOOD. Underwhelming...It tastes exactly like a generic breakfast taco. I got a potato  egg   amp  cheese and a chorizo  bean  amp  bacon  but instead of satiating my craving  it felt more like eating to put food in my stomach than a party in my mouth. The POTATO  EGG  amp  CHEESE was bland but with a buttload of salsa  it was alright. The CHORIZO  BEAN   amp  BACON was decent  but it s relatively hard to mess up.   Overall  I could come back if I was desperate and lazy  but there are a lot of better places.

No frills taco shack  just as described. The Texan has a great portion of steak. May recommend one big taco with all add on vs two tacos  if you are biking like I was . Also had a bacon  egg  potato  cheese and was substantial.   Great quick pick up  friendly staff. Small salsa containers so ask for extra

I stop at Taco Shack every once in awhile and all is fine. I stopped by recently and that quickly changed. I ordered a sausage  egg  and cheese taco and noticed after leaving upon opening it that there was a hair in it. I haven t gone back yet and I m not sure that I ever will.

This place SLAPSSSS     It is sooooo good. There s always the same guy there and we re homies now. Burritos can be a little expensive but I m a broke ass bitch that won t drop  1 on a bottle of water so who am I to say something is expensive. I recommend the Burnet Road Burrito w  beans. I ve gained something like 10 pounds from this place but it s worth it.

This is my FAVORITE breakfast taco place    however I do wish it was a little cheaper because two tacos is like  8 and as a college student I can t really afford that so I have to limit how often I come.  But if they were a little cheaper I d be there every morning   Or maybe they should have like a punch card or something for loyal people. However it s my friends and i s favorite go to spot

2 stars because Taco Cabana makes better tortillas. Ordered sweet tea the cashier heard me because she asked if I wanted small or large. I paid for large only to find out they don t carry sweet tea. Of course it was too much trouble to return my  2.19 so I won t be returning at all. There are way better places to get a taco than this  hit  hack. Goo luck

I like breakfast tacos....a lot. In fact  if it wasn t for cholesterol ramifications  I d eat them every day. But Taco Shack just doesn t cut it  especially with Torchy s breakfast tacos less than a block away. I find it weird I live right outside this place but never ventured there until today.  We got the shack pack  potato and egg and bacon and egg tacos. The thing to like is that they do give you a full strip of bacon  which looks impressive but thats the end of the line really. It doesn t have much taste and the eggs are kinda pebbly. Tortilla seemed like one of those generic cheap ones you find from the Mission bags. The taco itself isn t that large either.  At the end of the day you get what you would expect from a place called taco shack. Tacos sold out of a very unappealing sounding place that unfortunately leaves you underwhelmed instead of surprised.

I am still in shock that I paid  2.50 for a breakfast taco and it was the tiniest taco I have ever seen in my entire life. The eggs were watery and bland  potatoes as well  and the bacon tasted like it had been sitting under a heat lamp for days.   No amount of pepper or salt or salsa could make that crappy taco any better. What is all the darn hype

Um  no. Just...no. First of all  good luck trying to find parking. There are two spots. But maybe you ll get lucky and there won t be any parking and you ll keep on driving. Seriously  it s the best thing you can do for yourself. Keep going. Pass this shack and don t look twice.   Horrible breakfast tacos. Just...ick. Cold eggs  gross chorizo  hard potatoes and mediocre salsa. Oh  and I went to get a diet coke and a bee fell out of the soda machine  so there s that.  Seriously  there are WAY better places for much  much cheaper.

Taco shack breakfast tacos are the best and oh how dearly I miss them now that we don t live near one of their locations.  I definitely took them for granted when we lived near the Metric location years ago.  Now we live in a part of town barren of their delicious wares so I only indulge when I happen to be near one.  That doesn t happen too often  but this past weekend my wife and I were at Seton for the birth or our second child.  And being that we spent two nights at the hospital  it was naturally a top priority of mine to fit some Taco Shack tacos into the mix.  You all know what I mean  don t act like you don t.  I mean  their potato  egg  and cheese tacos make for a pretty perfect breakfast.  Other factors that sealed the deal on two straight mornings of Taco Shack goodness  1   We were literally just 5 minutes from two locations 2   One of them  this one  was open on Sundays 3   Nursing mothers should always stay properly nourished with eggs and plenty of cheese

Taco Shack is not really a place that I would go out of my way for on a workday when I am running late  but I do enjoy rolling out of bed at 10 on a Sunday and grabbing one. They have breakfast all day on the weekends so I take my time waking up. The food is good and it comes out quick.  A lot of people complain about the parking  but what do you want.. they are located in the corner of a gas station lot. Most of the people who frequent there  grab tacos and leave. The parking spots clear up quickly.  If anything  I rate these people highly because they are consistent. When I order bacon egg cheese or potato egg cheese  I get the tacos well wrapped and hot and they always include a little salsa cup for each taco. They never forget napkins either. Grab and go.

When I worked within walking distance we ate here often. It is also a cheap place to eat while spending all your   shopping on the drag.  I respect the fact that it is a family run Austin only chain.  The wife of the owner has a delicious chicken soup named in her honor I forget the name but it is very yummy - try it.  The breakfast tacos  till 11 AM I think  are 1.49 with 2 fillings and choice of tortilla. My stand by is the corn w  egg  potato and cheese the additional add on is .35. 1 taco for me is a light breakfast or an early pre-lunch snack while shopping. 2 breakfast tacos before 11AM and I won t need food till Happy Hour.  For lunch I like the Chalupa and the Quesadilla  I love that they let you choose your tortilla as I do not like flour and that is how they usually come- here I get 1 corn w  beans and cheese  both are 1.49. I can easily fill up on 2 or 3 of these for less than 5 bucks.   Don t go here looking for ambiance its just as bad as the closest taco at Taco Smell but the food is way better.  If you are ever up North the location on Metric   Parmer has a lovely outdoor garden seating with a water fountain.  Nowhere near the best taco in Austin  but  the best for the cheap in this area.  PS Last time I was here they close at 2 30PM

I stopped here to get breakfast after picking up some hardware at Breed s before heading into the lab.  Fast  polite service  good tacos.  I got a  Shack pack  which is 6 tacos  3 potato  amp  egg  3 bacon  amp  egg  for my co-worker and I.  A bag of tacos and 2 orange juices for  10.  Eggs were hot  amp  fresh and the potatoes perfect  salsa was tasty.  I watched through the window while they were making the tacos.  It s tiny  but clean  and watching the 4 people working in there was like ballet.  Four stars for it being what it is  and pretty darn good at it.    Something must have changed since those mediocre 2007 reviews were written  other than the minimal parking   since it seemed much better to me than many of those older reviews would suggest.

Greasy  dirty  nasty tacos done right.  Yummy.    Okay so the place REALLY is a shack  it has no indoor anything really and the hours are strange at best.  Still the place is a great choice if you are looking for just plain dirty tacos with no regards for health or trying to find something gourmet.    Taco Shack is a convenient stop for those shopping the North end of the drag.  The food is reasonably priced for what you get and certainly better than going to the nearby Taco Bell.  They load up the tacos with all kinds of goodness but that doesn t overcome the fact that nothing really makes them memorable or makes them stand out above any other cheap taco joint.    Overall  expect cheap prices  quick service  big fatty tacos and a future colon cleansing.  If you re in a hurry or just need some walking shopping food try the shack.  If you have time to sit down try Milto s or Spider House both are nearby and offer better grub.
Good cheap tacos. Their plain tacos are similar to T-Bell but with higher-quality ingredients. Salsa is very good--I was pleasantly surprised. 2 decent tacos for under  3  I m always down for that...

Breakfast tacos are an essential part of my daily nutrition  ha. I wanted to like Taco Shack. The name  the idea seemed right up my alley. I dealt with the dicey parking situation  had to figure out which window was the ordering window and eventually had breakfast tacos for the family. I thought I had scored something good   But the tortillas  There is a problem. You see  the tortillas are the same as the kind sold in bags in supermarkets. These are not even those made fresh by the tortilla machine at the Hancock Center HEB. These are the thick  chewy ones that were made in a factory somewhere. If only Taco Shack and other Austin places would have ladies making homemade tortillas fresh  the food here would be so much better and authentic. Before you think that I am asking for too much  go to the Valley  to almost any convenience store  and you will see tortillas being made before your eyes  then filled while still fresh and hot  for a delicious taco that costs 99 cents. And don t forget the fresh  really fresh salsa that has never seen a can of tomato sauce. Maybe the owners of Taco Shack should take a little trip south to see what breakfast tacos should and could be

I have fond memories of when this actually looked like a shack. I used to work at the donut shop across the street and we would often brter donuts for tacos and they would hook us up. I can still find this great attitude there.  However  this is not a place for vegetarians  If you like to eat meat in a mexican inspired fancy  go here it s cheap  Fast fuel for fast times. Limited offerings on the menu make this one a great place for illiterate folks or stoners. What else can I say  cheap and descent make this a visit if you want.

Delicious breakfast tacos. Don t expect real Mexican flavor though. Their salsa is the only thing that could be considered to taste Mexican. It s hard to find good salsa at a taco place in the US.  4 5  would eat here again.  They don t open at 6am as their website says though. I ve made the mistake of going there at 6am and waiitng for half an hour. 6 30 is their real opening time. Enjoy.
Oh yes.  Definitely a contender for the best breakfast tacos in the city.  I miss you  Taco Shack.

I went to order a chicken quesadilla and got a quesadilla with  yes  RAW chicken. I contacted the manager and he said they were gonna fix it. The guy from the store told me he would PERSONALLY deliver it to me  I work right across the street . He never did. Oops  Don t mind me reporting you to the health department   I am going to . This is unacceptable  dangerous to sell raw chicken and super unsanitary.   Love   The Girl Who You Never Delivered The Quesadilla To

update 1 12 2007 Alright  I ll give these guys a little more credit than I did in my original review.  They ve had some new guys come in and take over  and things run much more smoothly than before.  But for F s sake  how could a taco place not be open on Sunday morning   Its about the same price as other places  the tacos are not any larger or particularly better than anyone else  but they do stand out from the crowd in one respect   they are never open.  The one on Spicewood Springs isn t even open on Sundays.

Quick lunch or breakfast  and I usually get out of there for around 5 or 6 bucks.   The flavors won t take you to utopia like some of my other favorite spots  but they make my taste buds do the electric-slide  and thats good enough for me
only 3 things i expected from this place. fast  cheap  and good. Met all 3. Burnet Road burrito is where its at  used to get it once a week.

Eggs from a bottle  Come on Taco Shack. Considering how many local competitors you have  how could you think that was ok  I had the  Burnet Road Burrito . For 5 bucks  it s not worth it. The bacon had a rubber feel. The eggs were straight out of a bottle. I watched the guy pour it into the pan. The tortilla wouldn t compare to an HEB tortilla. It s unfortunate that with such a prime guad location you would have such low standards.

Honestly not the best breakfast tacos I ve had. I only like this place because of the location and seating. Service is fast and it s coveniently located on Guadalupe in front of spider house and across the street from juiceland. They let you make your own tacos and the prices aren t bad though.  Breakfast all day.

This place has been a favorite of mine for a long time. If I am going out for breakfast  chances are I m going here. The tacos are quickly made  and taste great. In especially love the salsa. I do wish they had a larger menu though  maybe with burritos or enchiladas for lunch.

The Tacos here are mediocre... Not impressed and the main reason is because they make their tacos with store bought tortillas..  Coming from San Antonio I m picky about my tacos and if the word taco is in the name of your restaurant then I think you should at the least have homemade tortillas.  Taco Shack step it up and start making your own tortillas...

I stop here often to pick up a breakfast taco on my way to work  and they are fresh and quick and a decent size  if however a bit on the plain side  but they still hit the spot.  Their salsa is not my favorite  but it ll do.   I would give them an extra star if they just had a spicy option.
i LOVE the breakfast tacos. mostly because the potatoes are so good and crispy  like frenchfries but breakfast potatoes. so cheap also

Taco Shack is locally owned by Orando and Yoli  a couple of former school teachers.  They make some of the best straight up  nothing fancy  breakfast tacos in town.  The best for me is the  Shack  with chorizo  potato  egg and cheese.  Add sliced avocado and put it on a corn tortilla  then be sure to get some pico de gallo instead of the salsa.  It s an awesome meal  you won t need lunch.  For those of you who complained about the location on Spicewood Springs  it s the only location that Orlando doesn t own outright  it s another group and they run theirs a little differently.  Try the one downtown on 402 Brazos  back side of the Frost Bank building   it s small  but they do a great job.  Also  Taco Shack gives back to the community in a big way.  They sponsor the  Taco Shack Bowl  between McCallum and Anderson high schools to raise money for scholarships and the Capital Area Food Bank.
One of my favorite weekend breakfast taco spots. The Shack taco is pure joy  the service is fast  and the place is perfectly funky.
By far the best breakfast tacos  And if you disagree that you haven t tried the Shack Taco      Love love love taco shack

My wife is addicted to going to Taco Shack  which means from time to time  I go to Taco Shack.  If you business is built on the scrambled egg  I would hope you could figure out that eggs like a little salt and pepper.  Here s some free advice  eggs also like to be completely cooked.  The cardinal sin committed by Taco Shack is found in their red salsa.  Horseradish   Horseradish   Horseradish   Are you kidding me   The green salsa is above average  but still...   Horseradish   Channeling Allen Iverson here.   Whose idea was it to put horseradish in the salsa   The Burnet Road Burrito has been pretty good.  I like their iced tea.  The price and location save this place from 1-star land.  You can fill up for cheap  but unless you re in a rush  why would you

I love the breakfast tacos at all of the Taco Shack locations. However  the Guadaloupe  amp  29th location NEVER opens on time in the morning. When minutes count in the morning  because I have to show up at MY job on time  it can be frustrating waiting for them to get their collective act together and open.

Good  cheap  fast tacos at a convenient location  but they are a bit ordinary.  Hours are a bit inconvenient  as you can t come here for a late night bite.  The tacos are served with nothing special  and the meat is a tad greasy.  They don t offer corn tortillas  which isn t too good in my book  but for the price you pay  these tacos are definitely a great fallback.

Good stuff  Amy and I stopped here on our way to the Texas State History Museum. Great little joint with fresh good ingredients  loved sitting out on the porch watching everyone wake up from a night of partying. Gritty and full of character  just like I like  em

A co-worker and i stopped here for lunch today. I ve gone to the north store for breakfast and it was good-nothing special. Today i am thoroughly disappointed. The rice tastes like straight up tomatoes  the beans are canned and not even seasoned  and the sandwich...ugh. They forgot my guac  which they charged me for  and the sanwich is cut all the way through  not on an angle so i can t even pick it up without half of it falling apart. The lettuce is brown and looks like it sat in the fridge overnight near the freezer  and the sour cream is plopped onto the side of the sandwich and not even spread out. Did i mention my bun is STALE  I hate stale bread  crackers  etc. If i wasn t so hungry i would have taken it back and gotten my money refunded. They charged my co-worker a DOLLAR per taco for CHEESE. Unbelievable. I get covering food costs  but haven t the owners read about nickle and diming your customers  If not  they should.  I will not be returning  ever.

OMG  Their burritos are the size of a mack truck    Seriously one is equal to 3 square meals and soooooo darn good   Plus the food is prepared super fast and the service is just as friendly.  The only thing I guess I could complain about is the line at the window -- but then again isn t a line the sign of a prosperous business   Oh and the mack truck burrito is only about 5 bucks    Muy  Bueno
Nothing flashy about this place other than how good their breakfast tacos are. Plain old Bacon and Egg is great  or try the Shack Taco.
not good at all  they need to know more about mex food since their food doesn t tatse like it...
My new favorite taco truck  Got the al pastor street tacos  5 for  12-13. Very flavorful with amazing salsa  don t forget the salsa    Located in front of the Sunoco right outside of Q2 Stadium.

I think they must have had an off night.  I ordered the  I ve never been here before special  delivered by doordash.  He s what I got for  17 before paying any doordash fees etc.  I tried each of these  and while it wasn t terrible it certainly wasn t anything special.
OMG talk about delish tacos    The carnitas were extremely good and sirloin  al pastor even better. We ate so fast we have no pictures of our food  but needles to say... 100  recommended

LOVE this taco truck. It s in an unassuming location at the Sunoco gas station on Braker Lane. It is the YELLOW truck that is in the lineup of food trucks closest to the road  not next to the Sunoco gas station mart . They serve both breakfast and dinner tacos. Be sure to check Google for the times they are open. The schedule on Yelp seems to be out-of-date.  Unfortunately I haven t had a chance to try their breakfast tacos yet  but I have been able to sample several of their non-breakfast offerings. For the tacos  the tortillas have pre-melted cheese on them  so they are kind of greasy and cheesy and extra flavorful. The meat is always on point for both flavor and texture  and they do not skimp on portion size. Both the red and green salsas are excellent.  Service is super fast. You won t have to wait long for your appetite to be quenched.  Prices are very reasonable. I don t know why anyone would anywhere else for tacos in the area. These are simply fantastic  and cheap. You can t go wrong.  I ve also had a few chats with the owners there. They take a lot of pride in their business and are super friendly. No issues speaking English either.
Perfect taco truck haul   15 for 4 tacos  Greasy so make sure to pack a fistful of napkins.

Omg omg omg  This food truck is amazing. I had the nunca he venido  9 which was fried tacos and fried quesadillas they were so good the green sauce was amazing and spicy  My wife got three tacos with flour tortillas. The tortillas were great but the Al pastor and bistec were nothing special. However  there Barbacoa  was sensational  a must get

Holy smokes. I can t say enough good things. We got the tacos doraditos and the street tacos with pastor and everything was incredible. If you re looking for anything before or after an Austin FC game or any other time they re open I would highly recommend.
Delicious and super authentic  The empalmes are my favorite. Also wonderful staff and service
This is literally the first taco truck in Austin that makes me feel like I am in Mexcio  The food is good and the staff is friendly. If you haven t been  highly recommended.
Amazing food  I love the Tlaquepaque ba ados  authentic street tacos    Come and try the most amazing Mexican food

Great Mexican food truck  Authentic flavors of tacos and food from around Monterey Nuevo Le n. Awesome lean barbacoa  Goes great in any of their fixings. I went for their official grand opening and because it was my first time  I decided to try their written daily special  Nunca he venido . It means  never been here .     It might become a staple due to popularity. The owner and his family are super nice and friendly. It s definitely a family operation. The food was delicious. Some stuff was spicy  but not taste killer. The tacos de vapor  or canasta  were delicious and tasted like a tamal taco and not greasy whatsoever. Very tasty  The Empalme  kind of a quesadilla with beans dipped in a red sauce   was delicious  but I used a lot of napkins by the time I finished that one  Maybe a fork and knife could help that one out  Didn t get to try their breakfast menu  but I m sure it s gotta be just as good as the grub we had for lunch. I was too full to try anything else and seriously wanted to try menudo from the other truck nearby at first  LoL  This food truck is in a gas station parking lot and it gets full at lunch time  and in the weekends it s got both the stadium construction workers and locals. The great thing though is that there are a total of 5 good trucks in the parking lot so you have plenty of good authentic choices.

I tried this place for the first time today.  I couldn t get item I wanted or drink.  I should have left from there.  I ordered the barbacoa tacos and I felt like I should have my arteries cleaned after one.  The taste was bland.  Plus the lack of cleanliness and sanitation is shocking.
Wow this place is as amazing   Tacos were amazing and so quick  We will be back  The owner was here and was telling us his story  Amazing Resturant and throughly enjoyed the tacos

Went to trailer located on airport and 38th.  Maybe it s moved or maybe there are two...  I have a system for testing taco trucks           1 al pastor taco with corn tortilla.  This al pastor taco blew my hair back.  It was so good.  Perfectly seasoned  crispy pork and fresh onions and cilantro with a freshly made verde sauce.  And the star of the show is the homemade tortilla.  Wow

I came here recommended by a coworker. Was not disappointed. They make their tortillas to order which is great. I had the corn tortillas I really liked the flavor. Warning  they tend to get soggy easier than flour  but I prefer corn tortillas over flour that s just my preference. Meat was very well seasoned and had good flavor.  Idk why people are saying not much seasoning  some people have different palettes  They had a green sauce and red sauce  the red sauce is the spiciest. It had good spice and added more flavor. Will come back here again to try a lunch plate.

Hesitant to have this place blow up  but the only thing worse would be if they go away  So I m writing a rare review so I can continue enjoying this east side taco gem forever.  DAMN. These tacos are seriously amazing  most notably due to the homemade tortillas. I get corn tortillas for tacos  and normally that means your taco is falling apart halfway through. Not here. This tortilla is literally 3mm thick and hot off the press.  I ve been a taco deli loyalist for years  but this is a completely different level. It s authentic. You order from an abuela and the salsa comes in little packets made from plastic baggies.   SO bomb. Please do yourself a favor and eat here - Get the chorizo for breakfast
Nice people  ok prices  lacks flavor.  Super bland.  I think if they added some spices it would help.  The salsa even was not that great.  It reminded me of school lunch salsa.

I am not the harshest breakfast taco critic but I am looking for homemade tortillas and gobs of yellow cheese and this is exactly what it is. Try it or order from Uber Eats so you don t have to deal w Austins s traffic and parking.  Oh yeah  the red Salsa is hot as balls beware when pouring on your entire taco.

Ordered a beef and chicken fajita plate through uber eats. The plates are well portioned and reading the reviews I had high expectations. Unfortunately  the food was lacking in flavor and overall was a disappointment. The beef and chicken fajitas tasted almost unseasoned. The homemade tortillas looked delicious but were also bland. The salsas were spicy but aside from that didn t really have any flavor.
Amazing tacos  Homemade corn tortillas. So fresh  so much flavor. I ll be dreaming of these for dayyyys.
Great salsa  great tacos  great prices  Only thing is the cashier doesn t speak english  but she is super sweet.
It is all about the homemade corn tortillas  Fillings were all tasty and well seasoned too. I had 3 types  al pastor  chicken and napoles- all delicious.
Pastor tacos with homemade corn tortillas.  They were great  going back as soon as I can

Fantastic Barbacoa and al pastor Pork tacos. Lovely ladies serving up great tacos with homemade corn tortillas. Hidden gem in East Austin in the little food truck lot where Pleasant Valley meets E. 1st Street.

Best sushi in Austin and it s out of a food truck    Chef Michael is a genius and super friendly to walk me through all the special sushi tacos of the day.   On the cheap side I was shocked at how good both the salmon skin and spam rolls were.  On the expensive end the crab was mind blowing.

One of the best handrolls we ve had in Austin so far  This food truck is located at the most perfect location. You can get some sake at the distillery right in front to pair with your handrolls  - perfect for the hot weather    All of the handrolls we had were very fresh and delicious. Our favorites were the kingcrab and tuna handrolls. The kingcrab was super buttery and yummy  i mean who doesnt love melted butter    . My bf also liked the spam handroll as well. These were all so good we went back in line for seconds   Overall  i thought they did a really good job with pairing the seasoning with the fish proteins. We will definitely be back to get a our quick handroll fix again soon

How is it possible for someone to not give Texas Sushiko 5 stars     I ve been dining at Texas Sushiko at Texas Sake for months now  and since my first bite it instantly became my favorite sushi joint in town.  This may be the most epic unknown sushi joint in the country right now because they re doing truly incredible omakase style bites at a price every sushi lover can afford.    From their spam roll to their wagyu roll you cannot go wrong.  Just writing this review makes me want to go in when they open.

This truck is one of the best kept secrets in Austin. As someone that has worked for Chef Morimoto himself  the handrolls are nothing short of amazing. Words cannot describe how good this place is. Go  Run  Leave your home or job immediately and grab the tasty creations they have to offer. No option is bad. This truck deserves its own restaurant. You make me dream of moving to Austin to always be closer to you.

This is a cool food handroll truck spot with a sake bar right next to it  I know what you re thinking  sushi out of a food truck   Here me out... it was really good   I came here on a Friday night and although the parking is big  it here was ALOT of people out at this area that made it a little difficult to find parking for. We got a variety of hand rolls but hands down I think the best one was the hamachi. All the rolls were fresh and delicious but the hamachi just hit a little differently. It is a little pricey but I would say that it was totally worth it
This place is a food truck located in a park full of bars and eateries. The sushi tacos are so good  I ordered the spam  scallop  salmon  and tuna. The yuzu sauce on the salmon is especially great

Presentation was great  but the food was expensive for what you get. We ordered the salmon  hamachi  salmon skin and corn ribs. The corn ribs were great  the sushi rice had too much vinegar and the flavors were just ok. I wanted to really like this place as we were excited to try it but we much rather the hand rolls at uroko

Seriously my favorite place I ve eaten at in Austin so far. Texas Sushiko is so underrated. The corn ribs are very unique in the best way. You can get your food brought inside to Texas Sake  their partner company  where we had a delicious sake margarita.

I love the location and the concept. I got the corn  king crab and sea scallops. Corn and king crab were yummy  sea scallops was okay. It was an expensive meal  but I would go back to try some more things.
This might be my new favorite sushi spot in Austin  and to make it even better you get to eat it at sake bar
High quality sushi and Austin craft sake. It s located in the yard where you can find craft wine  whisky  and sake

By far the best sushi ever  So glad we found this gem. My bff and I had a great time with both sake and sushi. The staff was super friendly and offered some great recommendations. If you re in Austin  this is a must try eatery    Can t wait to go back

This place is delicious   I had a blue fin tuna roll and my friend had a the king crab roll and we both tried the scallop roll as well.  One of my FAV sushi places now  and the ambience makes it even better.  Everyone at the food truck serving us was extremely nice and social and it made for an overall great experience.  Highly recommend trying this place
Shit is bomb af. Corn riblets  spam hand roll and scallop hand roll. Yep. I mean all the hand rolls are good. Don t skip this place.

Honestly  presentation was pretty  it looked great. But the first bite i took it was so sour. There is so much vinegar in the rice that it masked the taste of everything. I ended up just eating the topping and not even eating the rice. Disappointed. The only thing good was the corn ribs because there wasn t any rice in it. Definitely have potential if they changed the rice recipe they use.

Went there on the Labor Day  thanks for being open  Pueblo Viejo . Long line  but it moved pretty fast   I ordered my usual favorite  Taco Bueno and Taco Nes. Both were delicious  consistent as other locations I ve tried. Their ghost habanero salsa elevated my tacos to next level.  When your order is ready  they texted you so people don t need to hover around the trucks. Appreciate that since it s hot out   Pueblo Viejo is still my favorite taco place in Austin.
I got the specialty taco plate with the quesadilla steak taco and steak and chorizo taco. Both tacos  beans rice and chips were great.

I love tacos and I also love Pueblo Viejo  This food truck is parked at the Meanwhile Brewery and is a happening place to be in Southeast Austin. I ve had Pueblo Viejo at different locations through the city over the last 10 years so and I was delighted to see them pop up at Meanwhile. Lately I m loving the Quesadilla tacos and chips and queso. It s been my go to order for several weeks now. They are open early for breakfast tacos as well  which I d recommend trying. Their selection of hot sauces is impressive too. If tacos aren t your thing  no worries  they offer all kinds of other Tex Mex plates to choose from and it s all good  You can t go wrong with Pueblo Viejo especially when you re re chilling at Meanwhile sipping on a beer and watching you kids play on the playground

These tacos were phenomenal. I had the Al Pastor and Taco Nes. Both were delicious. I got the creamy serrano and Mexican chipotle sauce with them  which just added to the deliciousness. The menu is huge here  so definitely a place where you can try something new here each time.

I want to start out by saying that I am most definitely a huge fan of Pueblo Viejo as a brand - great food and pricing.  However  the location at Meanwhile Brewing left me with an unpleasant experience due to the lack of customer service.    I ve visited twice - first time service was great  food was hot and consistent with other locations.  Second visit - I was completely ignored by the staff.  When I attempted to make an order  the staff member sitting in front of the window completely ignored me.  I never want to be the person to bang on a food truck window  so I just stood there waiting  nothing.  I said  Hello  are you open    Ignored.  Hello     Feeling awkward  I checked their truck signage to make sure they were open  they were.  I checked online - also marked open.  Great  guess I ll go to the neighboring food trucks who actually serve customers.  Unfortunate experience. Would give one star  but added a second in good faith that this was a one off thing.

My wife and I were in Austin for a long weekend and i ordered the fish tacos and al pastor taco. The fish taco was one of the best grilled fish tacos I have ever had. It was ready in about 5 minutes but their salsas were weird. They were more like dressings instead of salsa.   The ghost was spicy  but not crazy hot and I like the jalapeno.  The chips and guac looked great as well. I didn t try them  but it looked fantastic   The atmosphere of the brewery was wonderful and during COVID  the outdoor seating was huge. Dog friendly and super nice people serving the beer.  Totally try this place

Pueblo Viejo is my go to stop when I want to spice up my breakfast taco routine.   They have an amazing salsa selection. The orange  I assume habanero sauce is great. The smokey black sauce they give is great. Really all the salsas here are great.   I made a really complex breakfast taco order  all special tacos  all different toppings. I was sure there would be some mistakes. Guess what  they nailed it 100 .   If you want something a little nicer than your average taco truck and great service. Pueblo Viejo is for you.

I blame the beer for not having photos. However  I wish I lived in austin so I could come back here every weekend  Holy smokes  I had the burrito and it was the best I ve ever had  Idk what they did. But THEY DID IT

This was our second time visiting the Pueblo Viejo truck at Meanwhile when we were there with friends on Saturday night. The food is decent  but it s an organizational shitshow.  We ve tried the guac and salsa  both great  but the queso is just pure melted Velveeta and absolutely nothing else. Tried the fish taco this time and one of the meat ones last time--again  both solid  no complaints. The Mexican salad  added saut ed veggies  was surprisingly good all things considered and our whole family  and a couple friends  enjoyed the quesadilla plate. Prices are a little high  but the value is there.  Honestly  we would have been happy to have given this place four stars  but the service is complete chaos. There was no confirmation text once you put your order in and after over 30 minutes of not hearing anything  we went there to find our food just sitting out. It was completely unprofessional as it seems like there is no system whatsoever here. We ll likely go for the pizza or BBQ place next time since we really did not appreciate the business model at this truck--hopefully they ll get their act together at some point.
The tacos do not disappoint. Consistently good  amp  no better place to enjoy than  picnic table at Meanwhile.
