Just had the Gordita plate with beef  amp  it was delicious. Forgot to take a before pic. I ll definitely be back  especially when I get to pair it with a delicious hazy IPA

I d post a picture of the burrito but I already ate it. They are consistently consistent in quality and service. The pricing seems high for what I get. The flavors remind me of my grandma s cooking. I miss her. She only spoke Spanish and I at the time only English. I felt like she loved me but I never knew if she said it. I know I said it to her. I hope she knows how I felt. I learned Spanish later in life so I never miss out on an opportunity to express how I feel. The world is smaller when you learn other languages and culture. I wish it was smaller sooner but at least I have the burrito from Pueblo Viejo.

To be fair we only ordered quac... And I was unsure if I wanted to order bc of price. But we got a HUGE portion of guac and a side of salsa. They gave it to us right away so we didn t have to wait. We ate through all the chips and they were nice enough to refill our chip basket and she was super sweet.

wow  Just wolfed down a Midas plate. I m not usually a potatoes person  the red potatoes  tomato sauce and garlic hit was spot on  Migas with red salsa was that great combo of soft  crispy and oh so delicious . Taste buds b dancing

I usually enjoy the Al pastor tacos here  but today s tacos were off  January 13th . The meat seemed drier  as if the cut of meat wasn t right. Pretty sad because it s the only reason I come to meanwhile in the mornings.

The only reason this place gets 2 stars and not 1 is due to the chips and queso being somewhat ok and consistent. Other than that  waste of time standing in line and huge waste of money. Over priced  bad service and rarely gets the order right.  God forbid you need napkins.

Quite possibly Austin s lamest taco truck. They get customers because of their attachment to the popular Meanwhile Brewing  which provides a captive audience. But the results are grim. When Pueblo Viejo runs out of stuff  they don t indicate it on their menu  so after you ve waited in line for half an hour while they screw up someone else s order  you get to the front and find out your whole order is now messed up and then you waste more time for more people. Worst flour tortillas I ve ever had  only ordered it because they ran out of corn...   like eating a rubber drain stopper or something. The chips and queso might as well come from HEB  and I guess they probably do. The veggie tacos and taco nes couldn t have sucked more. Just bland  bland  bland. The Pueblo Viejo taco had no flavor  only ridiculously excessive spiciness.  I like spicy food  but there s more to life than heat.  Pissy service  too. Why not at least tell people up front that you re out of stuff  rather than snap at them every time they attempt to order something you don t have  I like Meanwhile  so I hope they kick out Pueblo Viejo soon and bring in something decent to replace it.

My new favorite taco place in Austin  The red sauce is ACTUALLY spicy and has really good flavor  The green sauce is not as spicy  but still has a slight kick and amazing flavor. From the fresh pico to how the food just melts as soon as you bite into it  I cannot recommend this place enough. I crave food from this place 24 7 definitely a must try place     Talked to the guy who runs it and he says they opened a few months ago. He seems super nice and loves what he does

Literally came here cause it was the closest thing around. i would have eaten just about anything but thank God they were open and there was no line. It decided to drop 40 degrees today for no reason today  something about being November  and this was just was the doctor ordered. I was too hungry to take photos of the food but it was my savior tonight

Got this delivered via Uber Eats - it was AMAZING.   The Birria tacos are a MUST. Rich  delicious melty cheese  and so much flavor  Loved the freshness of the pico on top. They come in an order of 3  plenty to share.  And the bean and cheese tacos with the  super spicy  red salsa  Yes PLEASE. Comes with a big slice of ripe avocado  but I ll ask for diced onions as well next time.   My husband loved the beef fajita  as well  but I didn t try it.   So glad we stumbled upon this after most things were closed post concert.   Green salsa is much milder  for those interested  Will get this again 100
Just stumbled on this place for delivery late night. The food arrived quick and hot  from a food truck too . Got the birria quesadilla and queso compuesto... very yummy
Easily the best tacos I ve had so far   I got their fish and shrimp tacos and they were so juicy and flavorful. Absolutely recommend and will be back
Some of the best authentic Mexican tacos in Austin Texas. My favorite is the queso  amp  carne asada tacos.

Randomly ordered delivery from here and it s now my favorite place for tacos de bistek  They have a slight variation they call Tacos Locos which adds melted mozzarella  grilled onions  and a roasted jalapeno. It is also awesome.
Late night Postmates  this food was EVERYTHING. Best torta I ve had in Austin  All the tacos were amazing and nachos were loaded

Short version  -Unethical food truck owner -Verbally ABUSIVE food truck owner -Inconsistent and very long wait times  -Poor communication from the owner -Owner happens to have serious anger issues  -Owner is extremely rude and disrespectful -Owner is extremely unprofessional -Poor customer service  Long version  I was initially told that the wait time for my order pick up would be 10-12 minutes  so I set my timer for 12 minutes. When my timer went off  I was told to wait an additional 5 minutes that quickly turned into 10  additional minutes.  So my overall wait time was 20  minutes. 20  minutes is a lot longer than the initial wait time of 10-12 minutes. I had every right to ask for an update on the order each time my timer went off. The owner had no reason to verbally attack me and scream profanity at me as he accused me of  rushing him  when I simply asked for an update on the order. The owner has broken English  but he is surprisingly fluent when it comes to screaming in English profanity. His irrational temper has definitely caught me by surprise. The owner of this food truck is an abusive psychopath with serious anger issues  very poor communication skills  and has absolutely ZERO respect for others. You can get significantly better Mexican food elsewhere without putting up with verbal abuse from an irrational psychopath.
Our second time having Johnnys birria and Al pastor tacos. Super delicious  Caters more to the late night crowd but we enjoyed them more sober
Best tacos I ve found in Austin after 10 years. We ve probably tried half the menu by now and it doesn t disappoint

Taco mile  Taco crawl  Of the places we went on our recent taco crawl  I think Taqueria La Chilanguita was my personal favorite. Prices are decent  tacos are big  juicy and flavorful. The meat is very well seasoned and the tortillas taste fresh too.  I really liked the cabeza and the barbacoa. Barbacoa is normally my gold standard to judging taco places and it definitely passes with flying colors here. The cabeza though has become something I liked at more places  as it has the richer fatty flavors I crave that cut well with the salsa. I don t think you can really go wrong no matter what meat you choose  and that s saying something given they seem to have the most meats of any food truck on the taco mile  though they may not necessarily have all of them at a given time . But all in all  they ve simply just mastered the art of simplicity in their food.   Definitely give them a try  You won t be disappointed.

Food truck in the Texaco gas store lot. Authentic Mexican food    Food is good and they give you generous portions. The tacos de Cabeza have been the best I ve found here in Austin  so good   They didn t have any aguas frescas so wasn t able to try them.     I didn t really like the tripitas. I asked for them  extra doraditas  but they weren t. They were pretty runny - see picture so I wouldn t recommend them.   Relatively inexpensive. We got 5 tacos  1 huarache  and 2 Mexican cokes and paid   24. They accept card and are open pretty late which is a big plus  We will be going back to try more items  They also have a few other food trucks around in that same area so we re excited to go back

Very cute atmosphere considering its food trucks at a gas station. The lights and music are what drew us in  but the food is what will bring me back every time  The food was excellent I mean absolutely delicious authentic tacos. I got 4 barbacoa tacos and asada quesadilla which came out to 18  but I was charged 20  so kinda pricey but worth it truly. The wait was also kind of long and the line combined with the ordering and pickup process was chaotic but overall I will return because the food was truly 5 stars. That s all the really matters

This is one of the best hole in the wall food trucks  Everything tastes amazing  And I love how late they re open  They cook once you order of course. Just ordered their Horchata for the first time  usually I go to the gas station nextdoor to get a drink  but I have to say honestly  it s not the best nor the worst. I always expect Horchata to be in a bin and you scoop it out. They have one of those running lemonade looking things with it in there. Again  not bad  not great. But back to their tacos  Man are they good  I love getting their Pastor Tacos and their Huarache with Pastor as well. Check out for yourselves. Don t judge this place by the atmosphere. Everyone there is there for the same reason. To eat and chill out. There are times I ll just chill on the tailgate eating and people watch. Pretty fun from time to time. All in all  everyone has their own opinion. This is mine. Enjoy

Great prices and great food  It can take a while sometimes  night hours  but they re still pretty decent on timeliness  I ve found it s best to call ahead and order for pick up. Their huaraches and sopes are so good and they have a variety of meats to choose from

The food is really good home made tortillas order tacos de cabeza is really good is like barbacoa taco taste like in Mexico City. It has space to eat here   La comida esta muy buena Los buen tama o de tacos los tacos de cabeza como si estuviera en la Cuidad de M xico muy ricos tortillas echas a mano

Best Authentic Mexican food in Austin hands down. Gorditas and Huaraches are huge and so good and filling. I loved their Pambazos. Also had tacos de cochinita pibil and chicharon verde. I eat here at least once a week. Support this business so worth your money
For the first time i can say Authentic Mexican Street Tacos and Garnachas  just Amazing   Quality and made from scratch
So frickin good. Best item is chicharron prensado when they have it and make sure you get it on a pambazo or anything really.
Nice customer service  clean food truck  skimpy portions. My pambazo was seriously lacking potatoes and chorizo. It was mostly bread and at  7 I d expect a little more meat and potatoes.

I went there yesterday and the food was so good I got seconds. I got a gringa  my parents got tacos  my sister got a quesadilla  and my brother got a burrito they were so good. The size of the food was not small it was pretty big definitely recommend
Finally real Mexican seafood  Had the Baja fish taco and it was great. The ceviche de camar n tostada hit the spot. It s my second time here and will keep coming back.

Highly recommend this place. Best seafood I ve tried in a long time. You have to order the Aguachiles Rojos.  The shrimp tacos are AMAZING    Don t let the appearance fool yoThis is a must come to spot next time I come to Austin.
I m picky with my seafood so I m so happy I found this. Everything is made to order and the seafood is picked up fresh daily. The flavors are amazing. Authentic Mexican seafood dishes. Amazing.
Very fresh  and delicious. Would recommend anyone who has never had true ceviche to try it here. Don t judge this book by it s cover. I had the Ceviche Borracho
Incredible aguachiles  octopus  shrimp cocteles  tuna tacos...everything on the menu is incredible. They re not just the best food truck  -- El Marisquero is the single best   restaurant   in Austin.

Just got 2 fried fish tacos  2 grilled shrimp tacos and 2 different ceviche for my wife and I and everything was ABSOLUTELY OUTSTANDING    I just moved a mile and half away from here and will definitely be back  Probably weekly

I came back again to order something different and  after I ordered they ran out of cooking fuel so instead of having me wait there they delivered my food to me at home. A1 customer service. I love this place

A local recommendation when asking for Mexican food but definitely not Tex-Mex style but more of a SoCal type. The employees are nice and may not understand my broken Spanish but they also speak English really well. The service is somewhat slow but that means food is made to order.   Authentic food from breakfast options  to seafood and even Micheladas. Party of 12 was a bit much but fit us between 3 tables but there are booth options.
Pretty sizable portions a a decent price. Food is pretty good for the cost. Cute Mexican decor and lots variety  of authentic Mexican dishes. This is a hidden gem one the few left in Austin.

Definitely my go to Mexican restaurant on the south side. It is inexpensive and the good is delicious. I have tried it several time already and it has not disappointed. One minor detail however  they only serve beer and no cocktails or wine  other than that highly recommend. The staff of lovely and the quality of service is outstanding  two thumbs up

I ve been eating at Chapala for years and am a little embarrassed I haven t taken the time to write a review yet   Solid  authentic Mexican at a great price.  My favorite salsa in town  made in-house. Not the tomato paste type  but rather the fresh veggie type -- to be clear  I recognize that the paste type is a valid style  it s just not my preference .  No black beans offered  but their charro beans are legit.  Their shrimp soup has replaced Dong Nai s egg noodle as my favorite in town. Mexican style with the giant carrots etc  I have their breakfast tacos  eggs and bacon with salsa  twice a week.   Other dishes of theirs I love  Chicken Enchiladas  green sauce  charro beans  with an order of sour cream on the side  Pork chops  Flautas  Chicken tacos with onions and cilantro on corn  Parrilladas   Honestly I haven t tried anything else of theirs  it s hard to branch out when I know I love the above dishes  you know

The hostess was very disrespectful and annoyed we were coming to eat at the business   but once I talked to Jaza   who is also a manager there everything was perfect . I love this restaurant   we actually come here quite a lot . This was my first bad experience   and it wasn t bad it was just the hostess . She wasn t happy with her job so why was she here   Lol dosent make since   but Jaza  is amazing     amp  every other server and hostess besides her   were VERY helpful . Definitely will be coming back soon

I don t like writing bad reviews but I am considering calling the health department due to the   2  RAT TURDS rolled up in my tortillas.  This place is nasty.  Completely grossed out.  Don t eat here.

I Like this restaurant a lot   the food and service here is always top notch.  I don t quit like it as much as there Oak Hill location  Taqueria Chapala  however I would still rank this among my favorite Mexican restaurants.  Their new interior decorating is like no other restaurant I ve seen around.  It is really colorful  authentic and makes you feel like you ve walked into Mexico with all.

They took a bigger tip from my credit card than what I had put on the bill. Do they really think people don t check their credit card statements  I don t know what the restaurant business calls this  but I call it stealing. Never going there again.
Not bad but not great. Better than just Tex-Mex with some variety. Carne Guisada was below average. Not sure I will go back but for the price you might find a gem there one day.
We were looking for a random new place to try and stumbled on this. Food was good  service was fantastic and we were pleasantly surprised. We will definitely go back sometime

A great inexpensive option if you re in the area and want Mexican food. No liquor license so you ll have to look elsewhere for margaritas but they still have beer and I like the service atmosphere here. Short wait times for food and plenty of parking.

Tried the caldo de res today and it was amazing.  Tastes like it had been stewing forever and wonderful deep beef broth flavor.  It also came with a good amount of beef as well.  A must try and a definite go back for dish.

One taco at a time  this establishment is taking over my tummy.   4 stars because the red sauce is not very good. Go with green  and your in the clean.   Wait staff  Straight 7 s across the board. These ladies provide valuable eye candy while I m remembering the correct combination of beans  eggs  cheese  bacon  chorizo  potato  pepper  onion  or even beans.  Come for the tacos  stay for the hospitality. Amen.

Not quite as good as the one in Oak hill - service was a bit slower and prices higher. Salsa was terrific- and as good as anything else close by. Chips were fresh - I had the combination plate see picture

So tired of them getting my order wrong. Food is fine  but there s plenty of good TexMex places. One time my order was so wrong that I sent it back - which is something I do like once every 10 years.   And here s today s episode with my to go order    Yeah  I just got home and my order s totally wrong. Not even close.    I m sorry. She doesn t understand English.    Well  how do you say enchilada in Spanish     Enchilada.    Exactly.   Then I was told if I want to drive all the way back  in the middle of Congress traffic  they d do me the grand favor of remaking my order. Wouldn t credit me  wouldn t give me a discount next time  nothing....  Well  I won t be driving back there today or any other day.  Like I said  plenty of great places to get Mexican food in South Austin.

This little taqueria has been improving ever since it opened. My family and I are pretty loyal customers so we definitely get our taco fix here. For the most part that s all I order because the fajita and barbacoa tacos are really good. I appreciate their salsa and chips too  very fresh. I definitely have to comment about their renovations too  they seem to spruce up the place a lot and I think it s very fitting to the feel of the place. The service here is pretty fast but it can get crowded too especially during the lunch hour. Overall  I ve never had a bad experience here except that time that they ran out of barbacoa meat...

This place has the promise of authenticity if not the the most consistent food.  I had a very tasty curry of beef tongue in a tomatillo sauce which was very tasty   But then the Sope was very strange. The substrate was this thin and fried-to a crisp wafer of masa. Not the nice  hand-pressed Masa you get at so many other places. And the cheese on it was Monterey Jack instead of queso fresco. It s clearly not their thing.  With so many places making their own corn tortillas  I am now getting dissappointed when I get served store bought. But really  I am probably just getting spoiled on that front. There is really nothing wrong with a store bought corn tortilla. I got great ones at Juan s for years   Salsa  2 great authentic green ones pretty close to the standard bearers  Fruta Feliz .  Not bad. Worth further exploration...

DISCLAIMER  I m a vegan gringo  and although also gringo  my carnivorous parents approve. And it s probably a good sign that most of the patrons are not gringos.  FOOD  Best nopales evaaar  Hefty portion of avocado. Their corn tortillas have the perfect texture and don t crack when rolled. Salsa is great. All in all  it felt fresh and light for mexican food. Parents raved over an enchilada plate and carne guisada.  PRICE  Tacos for less than  2 at lunch  and  1 tacos at breakfast  before 11am . Each taco comes with two tortillas. My sister and I did lunch for less than  10 before tip.   SERVICE  Tip like the food s not cheap  They are always quick  friendly  and patient with my spanglish.

Just had some of he best chilaquiles I ve ever had. Green sauce was great  the salsa was great  service was solid. Definitely a solid option for breakfast.  10 total including an iced tea  Can t wait to try other dishes.

I never would have known about this place had I not had car trouble nearby.  While my hero manly man replaced the starter on my car...we stopped in here to grab a quick lunch during the ordeal.  Knowing I was about to fork over major cash for car repair  I really appreciated the 4.99 lunch special. We both got that...Thursday enchiladas. Chicken with Green Sauce. He had the Beef with Red Sauce. Both were adequately slathered with cheese  mine white  his yellow. 3 to a plate and they were thick and delicious. The salsa was a tad salty but still tasty. The waitress didn t mind fixing us to go ice teas which we were happy to have later as we continued the quest for auto parts...got outta there for around 15 bucks and plenty full.

This was my fourth experience here.  The first three were fine.  This past experience was the worst.  I had asked for my eggs over easy.  A simple request as a dinner.  Eggs come out medium.  There s a difference.  I asked for a new eggs please.  As I waited I started eating the bacon and toast.  As I grab a piece of toast they had served the end piece of the loaf.  In all of my dinning I cant remember being served the end piece of the loaf.  I then asked for a new piece.  After seven minutes of waiting on the eggs my toast comes out.  I asked where my eggs were and they didn t know.  I asked for a manager and was told there wasn t one.  I got up from my breakfast and left.  Now  this is first world problems I know.  However  they need to pay attention to the details and they failed

The green sauce knocked the snot right out of me... in a good way. And any place that gives me a giant squeeze bottle of the stuff is golden in my book. It s like the TacoDeli dona sauce but without the portion control. No more licking the inside of those little cups hoping for one more drop of fiery green bliss. Here  my inner salsa addict can leave satisfied.

You can get 3 breakfast tacos here for  2.99. There neither bad nor great. Just OK. The included salsa was a bit too watery for me as well. The tacos were cheap and did not leave me hungry. However  like I said before  they were just OK.

Pretty good food but the service was a little slow. I suppose I can forgive them because they had to prepare for a party of eleven or so.  I ordered shrimp with an avocado margarita. It was excellent. Great atmosphere  good food  it was just a fun time. I would definitely come back again.

Sorry  I only eat one thing here.  Steak Tacos with Cheese and Peppers.  This place is the real deal.  I m from Cali  and all these  Tex-Mex  tacos are disgusting.    This is yummy.   Good steak  good cheese  good Peppers.  I eat here at least twice a week.  If you think Taco Cabana is yummy  this is not for you.  Just going to be straight up  plenty of legit Latinos in here  so you know its good.

Just really great super legit mexican food. Love the salsa served with the chips. LOVE the horchata. Love the charro beans  seriously sometimes I skip that rice and get a double portion of charro beans in a small bowl. Beyond that the enchiladas are great  as well everything else I ve ever had there.

I get my car serviced in walking distance  so I always stop in for breakfast tacos. I love the salsa. The Bacon is deliciously crispy. The service is fantastic. And the chairs are amazing. If you re nearby  this place is great for takeout or sit in.

There are obviously better places than Chapala. But you know  for a neighborhood dive  its really pretty good.  My daughter liked her meal a lot. I was surprised they served Chilaquilles there.  The food was hot  the mom of the mom and pop team was really sweet.  Her English was   how are ju .  Which is a good sign of things to come generally.  You know  the thing that stood out really was the salsa.  They make really really good salsa.  It was very surprising to me. Everything was fresh. Nothing came out of the warmer.  It s kind of like going to somebody s aunt s kitchen.  They have a lot of stuff on the menu. All of its low priced.  Its hot fresh and plentiful.

I love this place. We come over here after church every other Sunday or so  and we can t get enough of it. From the fantastic corn tortillas that don t tear up to the Spec al Quesadillas  there is something for almost everyone here  whether you like authentic Mexican cooking or the milder TexMex version. And save room for great flan  If you manage to not fill up on chips and salsa before your meal  you will have room and cash left over for a tasty dessert. I m not so crazy about the canteloupe nectar or the tres leches cake. Service is always friendly and helpful.

This is oddly one of my favorite restaurants in Austin They give you a Free hot batch of Chips with Salsa no matter what when you sit down  their Prices are killer  and every Meal I have had there has been 100  on point. I usually get the same thing every time. Tall Glass of Water  Bottomless Coffee  and then the Chapala Breakfast that has 4 slices of toast with jelly   Bacon  Sausage  2 eggs  and home Fries and my final tab when I leave is about 7 bucks and thats after a couple dollars tip. Another few meals that are good is the Beef Fajita Quesadilla Special  or the Beef Fajita Dinner..Enjoy

My hubby drove by this place and decided he wanted us to try it. I am so glad he did  Not only was the food reasonably priced  everything was delicious  I highly recommend this restaurant if you are looking for delicious cheap eats. I will definitely be a returning customer. This has become our Wednesday dinner place.

Me and my husband tried this place out for the first time and needless to say we will never go there again  first it started with bad service then we noticed they had a full trash can right next to our table flies everywhere no good

Big meh...I has the Milanesa torta and it tasted like the old oil it was cooked in. They have a green salsa which i have had many times other places and this one was bland and it had no kick. At least it was cheap.

I ordered their enchiladas and a taco and wasn t impressed. The roomy and I went here some time last year and I can t even remember what I had. I guess that s how forgettable this place is. To be honest I only like my enchiladas from El Borrego. I did like their taco. It wasn t anything special and it tasted like something from Taco Bell. So now I know where I can go for my late night Taco cravings.

My family ate here Sunday brunch time and it was delicious and affordable.  We ordered the ceviche  quesadillas  and enchiladas.  All the food was tasty and fresh.  We loved all of the salsas.  The service was great too.  It doesn t look like much from the outside  but if you are looking for some affordable  authentic Tex Mex you should check it out.

While the pricing is pretty cheap  I found the food tasted fairly cheap as well.  I ordered breakfast  migas and a beef tounge taco  on a Saturday morning.  The migas came out looking like an egg caserole.  The taco was very good  but I found the tortilla to taste more or less like a store-bought one.  The service was quick and unspectacular.  All and all  totally edible  but not a place I am likely to revisit.

Sabe has the most amazing options that are all delicious  When I arrived I saw them cutting fresh fruit  which I love so much more than frozen. It s all authentic and fresh    Bonus  is its right next to La Monta a taco shop so I got my watermelon agua Fresca  translates to fresh water  and refers to the fresh juices and fruit they offer  and my delicious tacos  I saw her blend my fruit right in front of me so you know it s fresh and delicious. Was my first time here but I can t wait to come back all the time
Great fruit cups  The agua preparada is also something I d recommend if you like Topo Chico  lime  and tajin

My family and I enjoy coming here to satisfy our sweet tooth  We go almost weekly  We adventure out to other new places but we always find ourselves coming back here  The only reason I didn t give a five stars is because of the personnel. Sometimes they can be in a bad mood.

my go to fresh juice spot. I discovered this small business while waiting for  tacos  the place next door is great  and have been a regular for years.  This store appears to be owned and operated by a few ladies and it s geared to serve the spanish speaking community. Everything on the menu is in spanish first  english second. I ve not tried much on their menu  quite extensive and items I don t understand  and am mostly a regular for their OJ      It s fresh orange juice that s made to order and the price   quantity is fantastic value. They ve got many other fruits  smoothies and desserts too. If you want some truly fresh juice  w o the austin premium you should try this place.

Still loving it  Still awesome.  I ve went to several diff places trying the  energ tico  and my kids demand we go to this one.  It s so good. Love their corn and most of all their fresh made juice  they re perfect for when you re feeling yucky
This place is the best to get yourself a amazing Mexican snacks   Will recommend    Having the best of the best snacks   Whoop whoop
Love Love love this place. The ladies I work with got me hooked on the strawberries and cream.
Interesting Mexican smoothie and juice house. Authentic Mexican snacks.  Fresh fruits.
One of my favorite spots to hit up for authentic Mexican snacks. Such great people work here and they truly do take the time to prepare your food with care. Really can t recommend this place enough.

Well we are out and about and shopping for a Fan at Lowe s Home Improvement Store and decided to get some Brats for a Fourth of July Lunch and the service was top notch the Employee was very nice and helpful and the Food was Fantastic   we got 4 Bratwursts  I got 2 of my Brats with Mustard and Onions and Jalapenos  Dad got his 2 with Kraut and onions and maybe Mustard   anyway they were  all very good.
Really good breakfast tacos. I ll be back to try the tortas later. Staff was very friendly  fast service.
Do yourself a favor and order a pastor torta all the way before you run into Lowe s. It ll be ready when you get out and your stomach will thank you
By far the best breakfast tacos in Austin  At a price that won t break the bank    5 STARS

Really solid taco truck with a big menu. Owners are very nice people and prices are reasonable. Also fun to walk around Lowe s while you wait.  Had breakfast tacos and al pastor and steak tacos and will def return and try more of their menu. And If you re a gringo like me  just be warned. The hot sauce is HOT

If you re at the Lowes  knock yourself out  but don t go out of your way to try this place  it s just o.k. The meat was a little bland and dry. I poured salsa on the tacos and they were still real dry. The tortillas were not homemade  more like store bought. Solid 3-stars but not more.
The staff was friendly and didn t take too long to get my order made. I got the steak quesadilla and it was pretty pretty good along with some green hot sauce  I ll be visiting again
This place is fire  I haven t had a taco place since home but this place should open a spot up DownTown bc words cant even explain my happiness with the tacos. It definitely hit the spot

Stop your taco search now. Every time that I land in Austin  I will be heading right to the Lowe s parking lot for the best carnitas and barbacoa tacos  served in generous portions on a piping hot fresh corn tortilla. At  2.50 taco  it is hard to find much to complain about.

I tried a chicken taco for a mid-afternoon snack after shopping at Lowe s. The chicken was hot and fresh and full of flavor. The corn tortilla was homemade and delicious. All-in-all  perfect. I eat a lot of tacos  this was among the best I ve had.

Best tacos in Austin. The owners are very friendly  and prices are very reasonable.  I highly recommend the beef fajita taco. Excellent.  I m certain anything and everything is good and it s in a great location. I definitely will be going back  I want to try everything on the menu.

I ordered a few tacos to try out an assortment.   The service seemed legit at first  but then I ended up waiting longer than I should have.  I was told I would be alerted when my order was ready  but I wasn t and ended up finally just asking if it was ready.  It was luckily  but then they acted like  why didn t you check sooner .   And then the tacos were bland and lacking any kind of flavor profile.  I was hoping for good tacos  but you won t find them here.  And to top it off  they charged me more per taco than is listed on their menu.

I stopped here once after getting some stuff at Lowe s.  I couldn t believe how good the carnitas with cilantro and onion were.  Definitely get it on corn and get the green salsa.  The corn tortillas were grilled nice and crispy and the green salsa was full of flavor.  I just brought some home to my wife to validate I wasn t crazy for thinking some of of the best tacos in Austin are at a truck in front of Lowe s.  I need to try the barbacoa next.

Best tacos in Austin... Hands. Down.  I was fortunate enough to misunderstand some directions to Rositas up the road and ended up at this gem. It s a no frills straightforward authentic experience with the best seasoned meat wrapped in homemade tortillas that you can buy. Bistec  chorizo and barbacoa are phenomenal. Phenomenal as in you d sacrifice a good night of sleep to wake up at 2 am to go buy more and STILL not be able to sleep while laying awake thinking about going back again in the morning for more.  This is more of a grab and go kind of place so take your tacos and find a secluded place where no one can hear you moan with delight. Whether you know authentic or not  just GO. You won t be disappointed. And if you are  you re probably unaware of life s finer pleasures. Which is ok... just sad though.  A QUICK NOTE   I ve read the reviews of people calling the staff rude. But you ve got to put those in perspective. This place is not a trendy chic Eastside food truck with an instagram following that has national presence and draw. It s located on the side of a busy road in an inconvenient location where the staff has to sit all day regardless or not if you come skipping up to the window with a smile and a pending yelp review in your back pocket.  These are authentic people making authentic tacos as a way of life. Not as a social experiment. Go here. Often.
Not what I expected  barbacoa tacos where super watery and Al pastor was mediocre  I was really looking forward to these tacos but really can t say anything good about them

Just wow.... amazing late night tacos that you would definitely want to have sober as well   Open until 3am 4am  The tortillas are homemade and the meat is flavorful. Remember to bring cash and expect a line.

The tacos were good... when I finally got them. I ordered my food late night on Sunday with a couple people who ordered ahead of me.  It took over 90 minutes for me to get my order... this place wasn t even that busy  way less busy then Rositas Al pastor is even on a slow night  still took over 90 minutes for my order to be finished.  Was the food worth the wait  No.  The food was cooked well  but there was absolutely no seasoning to any of the meat to the tacos. If I m waiting over 90 minutes at 3am for a taco  I would love to be thoroughly satiated by the flavor of said taco... this was not the case  the juice was not worth the squeeze... the squeeze being waiting over 90 minutes for  bland flavored tacos.... If you have a choice and Rositas is open  go to Rositas no matter how long the line is. I guarantee you ll be served faster at Rositas with more flavorful dishes than at this place. I will never order anything from this time sink of place  ever again.

Misunderstood the directions to Rosita s and came to this food truck. Then found out rosita s is in the next block but the line was too long and I didn t have time to wait. Ordered bistek taco  chorizo taco and gringas  with pastor meat . Overall  the food was okay. Meat was slightly hard and was not adequately marinated. There is a seating area in front of the truck if you d like to eat there.

Meh.  Something was off about the taste of all of our orders. We all tried each other s food and none of it was just even ok.   Underwhelming and under seasoned.  The only bright lighthouse for this slowly sinking ship in a fog filled sea was the plain bean and cheese burrito  not that it was great  but the only one that liked it was our finicky eater so that has to account for at least a 2nd star  yeah   There s better taquitos a block up or down Riverside.
My favorite is the pastor bambaso and the carne asada quesadilla  their food is great one of the best taco trucks I go to

Legit taco truck with homemade tortillas corn or flour. Open late and super cheap  2 tacos. Green hot sauce makes my eyes tear but I love it  not the kind of spicy that lingers too long  unless you have a lot of it . Random taco trucks are the beeeeeest not the ones in a lot full of other food trucks...
Great  for when you re drunk or sober  the spicy green and red sauce is reason enough to visit. Locally owned  and open until 3am
Best gringas in town  Seriously they give rositas a run for their money. Home made corn tortillas nbd.

I visited Taqueria Piedra Grande 2 on a late evening.   We drove by and found the very well-lit food truck open for business.   The food truck had a covered dine-in area and a good selection of foods to choose from.   We tried the beef quesadillas  a bacon and egg breakfast burrito  gasp  I had forgotten cheese   and a barbacoa wrap.  1.  Barbacoa wrap  I ordered it only with cilantro. I normally enjoy the fatty barbacoa and the simplicity of cilantro on a flour tortilla.  Unfortunately  the barbacoa was dry and not very tasteful.  The amount of barbacoa was good  I wished it was more moist.  2.  Breakfast Burrito  Bacon  amp  Egg    It was very silly of me but I read straight off the menu and it didn t say cheese and I didn t think to add cheese. Cheese makes everything better  There was a good amount of egg and bacon and the flour tortilla was just right.    3.  Beef Quesadilla  I only had a bite  but man it was good. Really  really good. The fajita beef was perfect and savory and moist. There s just enough cheese. Even as I m writing this review I m thinking about having one right now.  If I m ever that way again  I ll definitely order correctly and give everything another try. On my maiden trip  I was very impressed and plan to go again.

Was going to go to another taqueria next to this one but I am so glad I didn t.  I had a Gordita de lengua and taco de tripa.  Was so bomb  it definitely reminded me of the California Mexican food trucks which I dearly miss.  Glad I found this gem. No indoor seating.
Really delicious tacos  We got the carne tacos and I got the breakfast egg and potato taco with cheese  onion  cilantro and they were all delish

Found this gem aimlessly wondering for an open Walgreens. It was late late and I was Hombre Mucho Mucho so I Froggered across Riverside and the lively bunch of locals told to just a Gordita and fugetaboutit. I ve been recommended a Carlzonor two like that but WTF is with Gordita. I prefer the flaquitas my self.  Oh wait this is a food truck review not OK Cupid search settings.   I got all up in that Gordita and luckily I was saved by a huge roll of paper towels. We re not talking vegan friendly recycled organic un bleached septic tank friendly hipster napkins they were old school lumber jack man paper towels.  On a side note they had to lay that dude off because all the wood in the Pacific North burned or already got turned into a Walmart parking lot which ironically provides a safe parking lot for the homeless lumber hacks and out of industries coal minors to sleep in their cars at night.   Back to tTacos  break out the red and green salsa and drizzle it over ass so phat you can see it from the front or back  Gorditas are almost always on pointe except when they are swamped. The Sope  which is quickly going from staple to relic disappointed and  piled so high you ll think you are in Denver Except at El Big Leg  dos there are no Microbrew small batch Blue Dream Marihuana  Texas penal code spelling. The J goes back in when Tejas decides to legalize it   infused tortilla option.   This one is toward the top of my rotation so check em out and say hi to El Gato Negro who lives a taco troll life below.

Growing up on the border  these tacos taste like home. Austin has a lot of really questionable tacos but these taste the most authentic. The chorizo and egg are amazing for breakfast but the tacos de bistec are my favorite. And always leave a nice tip

Tried this place because my friend suggested it. She said it was better than the others on riverside. I thought she was just hyping it but it did not disappoint. I had the burrito and it was huge. They even give you a knife and fork because of how huge it is. I also had the melon water and it was soo good. A great meal for  8. I m hooked. Will definitely be going back.

I am not Mexican so I don t know much about what s on the menu  and I had a lot of questions and the girl that was working had the worst attitude and customer service. I don t even want to eat the food  definitely not coming back here.
Drunk and uber to El Taquito.. saw it was up a hill so went here instead and was blown away  Good barbacoa tacos
Honestly one of my favorite taco trucks in Austin. They hand make their tortillas not like the busier taco truck a few feet away. Always fresh not always friendly but the tacos are worth it
I had the bistek tacos and they were flavorful tender and delicious      They were a good size too.  Try it out

Amazing tacos   I got the bistec and pastor tacos and they were so good  The salsa verde is a bit on the spicier side but it s very delicious. The red salsa is more tolerable for those that don t like spicy foods. The tacos were big I m used to always receiving small tacos but at la yaquesita you ll get a big meaty taco . 10 10
Accidentally stumbled on this place and it s so good   Close to Mueller  great tasting food  and big portions  Definitely coming back here again -- highly recommend.

Y all.  Go here.  Get a gordita   They are amazing.  We went on an afternoon for a late lunch.  The ladies are so sweet and the food comes out piping hot  fresh and tasty   There are picnic tables to sit at and enjoy your food  as well.  I got a chicken fajita taco  they were out of beef .  Chicken was hot and tasty and seasoned perfectly.  Mark got a gordita and I totally wanted to steal it   It was absolutely scrumptious.  I can t wait to go back and get my own.      They have a wide variety of items to order  so I definitely want to go back and try more.  There s parking  picnic benches and the ladies bring out sauces  the crema on the gordita was heavenly   that range from no spice to OH SO SPICY  YUM
Very good. I m very happy to have such a good place to eat in the area. Great al pastor.

Everything was tan incre ble  Def eat here   I asked for soup and she said she didn t have any and then said she had consume  which sounded like some French  something or other  and I said yes please   It was a groovy pepper based deal and I dipped my tacos into it like a happy crazy person and slipped deeper into culinary madness    Ps everything was super homemade with love  you want this food

We went today with my partner. Delicious  authentic and inexpensive  Looks like any food truck but there are seats inside. The service is awesome  you can feel the love in the food and the place  we loved the tacos and gorditas. My favorite was beef gordita and my bf loved the bacon breakfast taco. Thank you for a delicious dinner   We were so thrilled with the food that we forgot to take pictures  but there will be a next time for sure

If you are looking for homemade comfort food. This is the place to be    The food is AMAZING  I love the tacos  all of them  and  their gorditas  The soups are so flavorful and perfect in any weather. The Food is delivered within a few minutes and always with a smile. Staff is extremely friendly and make you feel at home.

Great tacos . Found this place couple years back and can t speak enough about their food and service  It s a mom and pop joint that knows what they re doing   Do yourself a favor  and check it out.   Clean  great food  and excellent customer service

Really Nice  amp  Chill Tex-Mex Restaurant Across the street from Me  last time I went unfortunately wasn t able to pay   so they kindly gave me the food low key was embarrassed... made it back to them couple days later when I went back and pay for that food and some Extra   amp  Definitely about to go right now on this Sunday Morning

I don t get all these high star reviews. We finally went in to try this place out and it s NOT cheap and the food is NOT good. We ended up paying almost  60 for 2 adults and a child. There was a weird aftertaste on almost everything. The queso was microwaved  there was an obvious nasty film on top.  The beans tasted like they came out of a can. The fajita meat was older than my grandmother. Dry  brittle  amp  absolutely disgusting. The one redeeming quality was the salsa but based on how everything else tasted  it probably came from a jar.  To top it all off we decided to give them a second chance and got breakfast tacos. Not only are they tiny  there was a huge hair in one of mine. Appetite gone. Nasty.  Oh  I should add that they have hand written signs up inside that say  1 basket of chips per table      Extra chips  amp  salsa cost money  F that. What a joke. Charging for additional tortilla chips   a Mexican food place. Hahahahahaaaaaa go to hell.  Don t go here. You ll regret it.
This is a little local spot  not fancy but it does the job.  My husband comes here for breakfast and lunch on weekly basis.  We tried many things  all good.

Paid 11.22 for a water and a salad the size of a child s plate. Menu said 7.99 but doesn t mention extra charge if you pay with a debit card. Didn t know places charge you extra for using a debt card  seems illegal to me. Don t go here  super small servings and it s not even very good. Chicken tasted old  salad was wet and slimy. TOTAL RIP OFF

This cute  little hole in the wall is a great value  Right in my neighborhood  you can get 2 breakfast tacos for  3.25  I m not sure where else that can happen and the food actually be good  I m glad I tried this place  Staff is friendly too....beware  if you spend under  10  you must have cash
My goto spot after school. The food is delicious and they have great weekly specials. The staff is super helpful and friendly. Great food for a great price.
When My work schedule allows this is my go to place for breakfast tacos  The service is great and the food is consistently good especially the Migas

Tiny hole in the wall.  Ordered migas plate  5.99 with bacon  2.00.  The salsa is to die for  but be careful because it is spicy hot and addictive.  Migas were a bit dry  but cover it with some of that addictive salsa and then you can t tell.  Came with beans and potatoes.  Potatoes were plain  beans tasted like they came from a can.  I think the tortillas might be home made  so not too bad there.  Biggest disappointment was the bacon.  Three slices of paper thin tasteless bacon for  2 is ridiculous.
Good prices on tacos very fast only wish they would lower there credit minimum to like  5 instead of  10
Great place to stop for breakfast tacos  Service is quick  and the tacos are delicious

Must write a review about this place now. Last time I ll eat here. Placed a to go order for two flauta plates. We received hot sauce for each order that equaled to less than a teaspoon  one of them was just light red water basically. When I received the order to go I asked for some more hot sauce and was told it would be an additional .25 cents each... For half a teaspoon of hot sauce  Should just have not tipped so high on the to go order. Funny thing is if I ate there they probably would have given us a cup of hot sauce  or would they have charged for it  who knows  I ll never go there or recommend this place again.
Great food . Amazing amazing service . Everything in the menus is Trully amazing and you can t beat there prices

This is one of my favorite places to get breakfast tacos. I can t really speak for their non breakfast menu items  but the breakfast is pretty good. I love their potatoes. Seriously  MAGIC POTATOES they re so tender.   The parking lot is tiny  and they re closed on Sundays. However the women behind the counter is very pleasant every time I go.

I love love love the brekfast  as the sign out front reads  tacos at this place. They seem to use fresh ingredients and their SALSA is freakin  good--fresh tomatoes  cilantro  onion and garlic- all in a little plastic cup with a cap...especially for your taco to go. The bacon they use is extra yummy  they chop it up in small crispy pieces. If you need more grease in your taco- try the chorizo in your taco  mmmm authentic.  They have week night specials-- I recommend Wednesdays  taco night  3 beef tacos rice and beans- I think it is around  6. Locally owned- the people couldn t be nicer. Very neighborhoody feel when you dine in.

This place is my heaven. They have great food  The salsa is fantastic and they have the best bean and cheese tacos everrrr   I m sad I don t live next door anymore but it s probably a good thing   Also  the two ladies that are there when I go in are so friendly  Love this place.
This rating and review is for the breakfast tacos. So so so many mornings I have great service and great tacos

Excellent down home place to eat true Mexican food. Perfect Menudo even my Mom and Uncle loved and recommend. Tender and not too spicy. Muy Sabroso    Friendly staff and great conversation if you want.  Very good everflowing coffee. We go at least once a week usually twice.

We stopped here for breakfast tacos on the way back from a Buda bike ride.  Cilantro s is a little dive.  Maybe a dozen tables  all covered in plastic tablecloths.  Cheap chairs.  Cash register sits above a mostly-empty glass display case featuring gum  toothpicks  and kiddy doodads.    We ordered sausage egg and chorizo egg.  They were hot and tasted fresh.  The salsa was good and not too spicy.  I think the tacos were  1.25 each.  This was my first visit  so I can t speak for the rest of the menu.  I ll endorse the breakfast tacos though.

Breakfast tacos are all I know.  I live around the corner  poor me  and have ordered multiple times from them in the past 3 months.  They are about  2 each plus or minus 50 cents and worth every penny. They were ready within 5 minutes.   The cashier waitress was nice and never failed.

Lately I ve been on a quest for caldo. Surprisingly  it s a little hard to find. The caldo at the Taqueria Arandas by my house is inconsistent  so I decided to try this place  since it is also fairly close by. I ve had great breakfast tacos here  too  so I figured they knew what was up. I went on a Sunday afternoon because I knew caldo was on special on Sundays. I asked the waitress what caldos they had  and she had to get the manager to translate my question. She was obviously pretty green  so I d rather her ask her boss than get my order wrong.   My husband s food came out first  which is weird  since I ordered the special. Doesn t that mean that they have a bunch of it cooked up and ready to go  There ain t much to pouring soup into a bowl. His food began to get cold as he waited for my caldo to come out  he s polite like that . I began to realize I was getting full on the chips and salsa I was snacking on to sate my hunger. I could taste that caldo now...warm  flavorful broth and juicy hunks of veggies. And then  my actual food came out of the kitchen. My heart sank as I looked down into the nuclear red mass of oil and vegetables. I d never seen caldo that looked like that before. I took a chip from our basket  and literally could scoop the oil from the surface of the soup. I d been waiting so long  that I decided to try it anyway. BLECH  There was no flavor  it literally tasted like hot canola oil soup. I darted my eyes around  looking for eye contact from one of the employees. Eventually I asked the manager if I could get something else  and it was  no problem  to order another dish. I was depressed. Delicious  warming  all-healing caldo was within reach  and then not so much. I replaced my first order with chicken fajita tacos  which were equally greasy and tasted exactly like HEB fajita seasoning.  The manager told me to come back and try the tortilla soup  but I don t know if I ll ever be returning. Cilantro s has numerous clippings on the walls of write-ups and honors  but those were mostly from a couple of years ago. I m not sure if they ve changed owners since then  or what  but this was not award-winning food  even for a quaint taqueria.
Had breakfast  it was excellent.  Shredded beef  eggs and bacon.  The bacon was outstanding.  Coming back tomorrow.

The food is fantastic   I am so happy I found this little gem   I have tried the carne guisada  menudo  barbacoa  fajitas  and pozole   All excellent   The prices are very reasonable for Austin.  Lunch special is  4.99.

For lunch  order the tacos doblados  or however the hell it s spelled. Chicken  guac  and sour cream mixed together and then  uh  fried. Greasy  hot  tasty. The other stuff on the menu is fine  but the doblados are the best. The best  I say.  The salsa is supposed to be warm. Sometimes it isn t  which it makes it less good. It s still good  just less good. When it s warm it s very good.   Also  sometimes  the iced tea has  as my grandmother would say  a  wang  to it. Not wang as in penis  but a funky rancid taste. Like it s old and has been sitting in the metal pot for a long time. This has happened twice in twelve visits or so. Math nerds can do the percentages.

Prices were cheap. Portions were small  maybe we are just big eaters   But what got me was the  6.99 large guacamole. You would expect a large bowl of guac. What we got was a large bowl of shredded iceberg lettuce with avocado mixed in. No spice. No flavor. We tried it but we won t be back. Service was friendly and we didn t have to wait long.

Cilantro s has some of the best breakfast tacos.  I would say they could hold their own in a head to head breakfast taco fight with anybody else in town.   It s a really small place in a strip mall that you could drive by and miss if your not paying attention.  They even have an award from the Chronicle on the wall for  Best place to eat Salsa in a Dingy Strip Mall.   I ve had most of the lunch and dinner specials they have  and all of them are priced well.  The fajitas are good  but not so great that you HAVE to tell your friends.  This is a nice little place to eat at.  The owners are always in there working   very friendly people.  I also really like their salsa.

Cilantro s is a cute little dive.  I ve only been there for breakfast.  Their tacos are pretty good and stuffed full.  I d prefer it if they made their own flour tortillas  but other than that  I have no complaints.  The staff is very friendly  and it s pretty cheap.  It s a good place to go for a quick  decent breakfast.

This place is deceptively great. Just looking at it  you wouldn t think it would amount to much as the storefront is small and it s located in a sort of run down plaza. I haven t ever had a plate so I can t speak to those  but I order the tacos to go a few times a week.   The breakfast tacos are solid and fairly cheap  although most do not come with cheese so you have to pay a bit extra. The sausage and egg and bacon and egg are good  although they do tend to skimp a bit on the meat. However  it works out because the substantial amount of egg seems to soak up all the delicious sausage bacon flavor making the taco both tasty and filling. For lunch I recommend the Al Pastor and Barbacoa.  The customer service is superb  the ladies behind the counter have always been extremely polite and seem genuinely happy to have my business.

I just live a mile or so from restaurant and have always wanted to try it but never stopped in till other day and was kinda disappointed the day i went I was way hungover from nite b4 entered and was only customer in place sat down ordered the lady there was very nice service was good but while I was eating my chips  amp  salsa I noticed how warm hot it was in rest. and asked about the ac she apoligzed and told me the ac was out and that she could comp my beverages ok what ever that was nice of her but couldn t really enjoy my food it was to hot in there  food was allright  Ill try them again maybe just hope the ac is working next time

I have been twice now to cilantro s and it is acceptable but not the greatest. Let me tell u why...first of all  apparently i am a creature of habit because both times i went it was a friday and the lunch special was enchiladas. The first time i had the enchiladas  i ordered cheese because that is the first thing i get at any traditional tex mex restaurant  unfortunately they brought me beef  which i am not the biggest fan of but i ate anyway and they were pretty good  came with rice and beans of course  and only 4.99 till 2pm. That part i liked  also atmosphere was great  felt like a small traditional taqueria. Second time i went  i ordered breakfast tacos  which is great to be able to order tacos any time of the day but not that impressed with the quality of the taco. Overall i say it s a good neighborhood joint  but i wouldn t go out of your way to eat here

Basically  it s a great place to eat good food cheap. The environment won t remind you of the Four Seasons so as long as you don t expect that  you won t leave disappointed. We had the fajita combo plate. The beef  amp  chicken was tender  amp  flavorful. The guacamole  amp  veggies were good as well. I rarely have it due to it being super sweet  but the horchata was off the hook  The meal was under  10 each. Actually  we liked the food  amp  price so much that the fiance  amp  I decided to have them cater our wedding.

This review is for service  not food.  The breakfast tacos here are good  but they have lost my business due to service.  They charged me for an item that they didn t put in my to go sack.  I called to inform them of this when I got home.  The lady on the phone  Liz  said  We did forget to add it. No problem  just come back next time and I ll remember to give it to you at no charge since you ve already paid for it.   Given  I didn t come back immediately  but I m a regular customer.  When I reminded them of said item on my next visit they didn t remember  including Liz  and didn t honor what they initially said.  Even if they really didn t remember  I m a regular customer and the item was just a few dollars.  So...basically they ve lost my business for life in order to save a few dollars.  To quote Julia Roberts in Pretty Woman... Big mistake. Big. Huge. I have to go shopping now.

This is a little hole in the wall dive kinda place. It is in a little shopping center with what used to be a convenience store that no longer sells gas but still has the pumps. It is tiny. 4-5 booths and maybe 6 tables. Friendly staff and good service.   The wife and I found this little jewel a last summer. We got our complimentary chips and salsa  they will charge you for a second basket of chips but the prices are so cheap on the entrees it really doesn t matter . Nice flavor with a slow and pleasant build to heat on the salsa. Won t hurt you but it will let you know it is there.  I ordered the Mole Chicken Enchiladas. I have been back many times and I have never ordered anything else  nor am I likely to. More on that later. First thing my wife and I do is take a bite of the re-fried beans. Pure magic. Never have I been so impressed by a plate of beans in my entire life. Most places I have been the rice and beans are just a side used as a filler. These beans could have taken center stage in and of themselves. Smokey bacony bites of heaven. Whenever and whatever my last mean is I hope it includes these beans.   In my experience Mole is one of those dishes that is either done right or not at all. I have not experienced any  middle ground. That being said Cilantro s mole is top notch. If you don t know what mole is it is chocolate sauce  the first time it was described to me I did not think it could possibly be good but my curiosity got the best of me thankfully . It can be spicy  I think traditionally it is supposed to be spicy  but Cilantro s is not spicy although it is still fantastic.   Great food  great prices and good service  what more could you want

Another place to hit on my infrequent trips to south Austin.  I googed mexican restaurants near my destination and this one popped up.  Not much to look at  it s yet another of those places stuffed into a little shopping center.  Basic seating  no frills.  The woman waiting tables was friendly enough  though.  As with previous excursions to new Mexican breakfast places  I got a chicharron taco.  It wasn t better than my favorite place  but it made a decent effort to try.  Also the al pastor is good  not heavy on the sauce like some places I ve been.  And the tacos are decently filled  not skimpy.  It s only a block or two off my path up Manchaca  so I don t have to travel out of my way.  Not a bad place altogether.  Hate to try to find a parking place during peak hours though.
Excellent breakfast tacos. I am eagerly awaiting a chance to go back and try a lunch special

The girls at the counter have a lovely disposition and the food is good  If you want your best value   eat your breakfast tacos at the restaurant because to-go tacos are made smaller to fit in the bag. Good salsa as well
like this place. good  cheap  fast breakfast tacos

This place is ok. Pretty Divey but cheap as cheap gets. Really hoped for better when I did eat there a few times. But food for dollar it was not too disappointing.  The breakfast tacos are actually pretty good standard.  Some things there....well they kind of have their own  who knows where they got that from  interpretation of the meal.  Outside of the typical food if they are unsure  they kind of  figger  and throw some cheese on it and bring it right out with smiles. Very nice polite people working there.

Awesome spot  Authentic Mexican food. No  it s not Tex-Mex  The taste and feel of the food is like being at a Mercado  farmers market.    I would come again  the price is cheaper compared to having to go to Mexico for the taste of its food.

Very enjoyable experience.   We sat at the bar  we originally had a reservation for a table but we prefer sitting at the bar. The service was very good  we got drinks  a starter  and entrees at a good pace  and never felt rushed.  The delfina cocktail  watermelon mezcal based  was awesome. We had guacamole with chicharrons  and my boyfriend got the crickets on the side  they were a little too salty for me. The guacamole was great.  I have a nut allergy so I couldn t have the mole negro or Colorado  the server was really helpful and brought out a list of all the ingredients in the moles so I could check. I got the shrimp in the green mole  the shrimp were cooked fabulously  cilantro rice  so good  the mole could have been a little silkier but the flavor was there.  The prices are a little high but that s South Congress for you. I would definitely go back  and try some of the platos fuertes  amp  tostadas next time.

Really disappointing. Went on Saturday and arrived just after they opened at noon. The place was empty  fair  since they d just opened.  We were offered a table outside and I said I d like the shadiest spot. ALL of the tables were open. The greeter offered us a table directly in the sun. I reiterated that we wanted at least partial shade. She seated us a a four top with partial shade. The manager sees this and BERATES the greeter for sitting two people at a 4 top.  We offer to move inside  and are reseated.   This place bills itself a the real deal upscale Mexican food. I ve had better guacamole at HEB. The yellow fin tostada was good  and the bone marrow appetizer was meh. Frustrating to have hot bone marrow delivered to the table then have to wait for the tortillas to arrive so you can eat it. I ordered a pork memela. What I got  two tiny  smaller than a small drink coaster  corn cakes with what appeared to be a chopped up pork chop. Most of it was inedible gristle and fat. Never got the side of beans I ordered. Husband got the steak. Prepared ok but way overpriced and nothing to write home about. Oddly  for an  authentic Mexican  restaurant  the steak came with a pile of French fries. Like  a pile the size of a newborn s head. Total bill for this disaster   101 before tip. Our server Bailey was the only bright spot. She was excellent.   Since this restaurant is associated with Vespaio  next door  and the former Enoteca  I really expected great things since those restaurants are  and were  pretty excellent. This place is a giant disappointment. From the incredibly rude manager berating staff  to the false claim that this is  authentic Mexican   the subpar food... not good at all. If you re looking for excellent food and service  try Comedor. Skip this disappointment.

Amazing selection of mescals  2 full pages   Great  attentive service by Bailey and the food was fantastic. Lots of options for smaller plates and tacos to share. My friend and I decided to try the Pescado Al Espazote  mahi mahi with a delicious fresh herb sauce and the most crispy potatoes I ve ever had  and the Mole Amarillo with roasted pork shoulder. The seasoning on the pork was umami-rich and crispy skin as well. The second dish was served with buttery cilantro rice and black beans. We can t wait to come back again and try more delicious dishes and cocktails.

We tried the Tu tano  Charred Bone Marrow  and it was by far the best dish we had that night. It s not that much food but the bone marrow just melts in your mouth like butter.  We also got Barbacoa de chivo  arrachera  and duck with mole. They re all very solid  but I wouldn t say they were amazing or super memorable. I definitely want to come back and try some other dishes that they have on the menu though.

Listen  I miss Enoteca too. I actually told the waiter  Michelada  who I highly recommend asking for  the second I got sited that this is my neighborhood and eneteca was on my top list so I had low expectations.  He walked us through the menu and gave us the best options  he made the whole experience a 10  The good news is the chef stayed the same  the waiters also  so the quality is still there  it just didn t make sense to Italian restaurants next door. Moving on to the food.  It s definitely an upscale Mexican restaurant.  The chips are served in tortadas that you cut yourself  and the queso fundido is excellent.  Then we shared one of the ttayuladas  Mexican pizza  with chorizo - good  but also not the thing I ll be craving again.   I don t love mole but the pork mole was excellent  so tender - definitely a must  That was also the most expensive part of our dinner  but I probably would only get that next time I come back.   The chocolate cake for dessert was delicious. Not just a simple chocolate cake  it had cayenne is it  very interesting combo   Overall  I recommend giving it a chance. It s an excellent upscale Mexican place and the food was high quality. For 3  we ended up sharing queso  2 dishes  dessert and had 4 margaritas  which were excellent  and paid  150 tips  so it s pricey  but also not unreasonable.  I would also check if they have a happy hour  that would be a great way to test it.  Pro-tip  - request  Michelada  as your waiter - make a reservation on Open table  so easy

When this place first opened up  it had the buzz of the chicest of the chic and the hottest of the hot.  That flower has wilted.  5 30 on a Friday night and there are lots and lots of empty tables.  The place did fill up over time - but not the way the gangbuster places are doing out on the New East Side.  What is the issue   This place does not put very much on the table  quality wise or quantity wise - and they charge a lot for what they serve.  Chi chi touches do not hide indifferent food.  Instead of chips and dip they serve whole crispy tortillas wrapped in a napkin.  Well ou la la.  The chips  whole and circular rather than broken up and in a basket  still don t taste like much.  One salsa was hot and uninteresting. One salsa was sweet and undistinguished.   On most chips and salsa  I inhale the entire bowl.  I was just as happy to leave these.  Guacamole was standard fresh guacamole just as you can get in over a hundred other restaurants in town.  Queso fundido was its usual hard-to-eat wrestling-with-cheese-sticky-putty that you also get in over a hundred other restaurants in town.  My paloma was indifferent with unpleasant sips of whole granules of chili powder.  The shrimp cocktail was large and very good.  However  I am eating tomorrow at Ceviche Love out on 812 which serves an even better shrimp cocktail at a fraction of the price of Chapulin Cantina.         Overall  tourists who aren t going to leave Downtown Austin or the Soco area will be the primary beneficiaries of Chapulin Cantina.  Since tourists don t know the price of anything  they will happily overpay for food they think they can t get at home.  The room is pretty enough to give them nice selfies.  If you are an Austin resident  and you are lucky enough to have out of town visitors  take them to the real places where they can get the good stuff.  Your wallet will thank you.  If you are an out of town visitor - consult Yelp.  And seriously consider getting out of SOCO and Downtown.  Both BBQ and Mexican are better out of the tourist zone.  For elegant Mexican  and that romantic night to remember  try Fonda San Miguel.  For down-to-earth family Mexican  try El Secreto de Abuela.  For Barbecue  try Stiles Switch.  And for a ton of fun  try T-Loc s Mexican hot dog truck.  He does amazing burritos too .  And for Keep-Austin-Weird Mexican for bona fide Mexican nerds - try Chilakillers.  And for new bold daring Austin cooks go elegant - try Vixen s Wedding  Austin-Goa fusion  or Canje  Austin-Caribbean fusion   Did you notice I did not mention a single downtown or South Congress location   That is not accidental.  Get out and discover where the good food REALLY is.

Thanks very much to Gordy  our fantastic server  who was willing to brave the chilly patio with us and our pup. The queso fundito with champi ones and fresh tortillas were excellent as were our moles and barbacoa. Delightful service  great food  and due to the chill  the patio all to ourselves   We miss the former concept but will come back and keep trying the new one  especially the homages and other nods to Enoteca.

Came here for Austin Restaurant Week. They donate a portion of every meal to the Austin Food Bank.  I ordered the Chicken Milanese with pasta. By far the best dish at the table. Think Latin Chicken Parm.  It was delicious.  I m a sucker for good table chips and boy oh boy did they not disappoint. Great staff. Warm environment. I would definitely come back here.

Came for some appetizers  will be back to try entrees and mezcal cocktails  I recommend trying some of the tostadas and memelas.  The queso fundido tasted more like Tex-mex style queso... it was still good but not what I was expecting.   Definitely still miss Enoteca  but this place is a nice addition to south Congress.

this place was not it. i am mexican and it is so hard to find actual interior food in austin. so  my family and i were beyond excited when we saw a place that offers chapul n had opened up. despite the prices being incredibly high for seemingly regular food  we decided to give it a try with open hearts  i wish we did not.   the arroz frito appetizer was very bland. despite coming with mole and huitlacoche  there was little to no flavor. the tlayudas however  were very tasty. they were gigantic and the huitlacoche especially was incredibly delicious. my only complaint is the chapul nes were very very small and salty. nonetheless  i really did enjoy the tlayudas.   the food is not why i m giving this place one star  it was the employees. the server was standoffish and ignored us until my family said something. when we tried to order in spanish  because the items are in spanish  she did not understand then gave us attitude. do not give mexican people attitude for ordering in spanish  at a mexican restaurant  where the menu is in spanish  be serious.   later  one of the managers decided to come and speak to us asking how we enjoyed everything. he was pleasant until he decided to explain all the food we ate in a very condescending tone  despite my family saying we already knew what all of this was. when my mother spoke about what our version of this was like in mexico he was quick to cut her off and say that  well this is from oaxaca so it s different . right  but if you wanna talk about food don t start getting stuffy when we talk about what we know and experienced. la morena que estaba trabajando detr s de la bar era la persona m s dulce de all .   overall  this is a perfect example of what happens when white people try to open authentic restaurants of different and cultures  it just doesn t work. si quieres aut ntica comida oaxaque a  solo ve al north lamar

I keep coming back since first visiting. Yes  it is a niche restaurant offering non  Austin Mexican  food but those who know and appreciate Oaxacan and other interior Mexican cuisine will love it.   Each time we ve gone these are my go-tos   - queso fundido - huitlacoche risotto balls - Tostada de at n   tostada de camar n  - tlayuda con tasajo  quintessential Oaxaca dish  - chicken with mole negro  I know the menu is intimidating if you re unfamiliar but hopefully these recommendations make choosing easier    As far as drinks  look  just get an agua fresca with a serving of one of their many mezcals on the side  Can t go wrong

Good food but grossly overpriced  for what it took to leave there content and full  we could ve gone elsewhere and had a fancier meal. Portions are small so don t come hungry  it s more of a tapas place if we re being honest. Everything tasted good  but it wasn t over-the-top amazing to warrant the price.  We had the following  - Yellowfin tostada  blue corn tortilla was nice and crispy  but also oily  - Rice balls  I ve had better at an Italian restaurant  - bone marrow  you get such a small amount  but the homemade tortillas were great  - ceviche  a more decent portion  but meh  - wagyu memelas  again  oily  - chips and salsa  the chips are hidden in a napkin holder thing  we didn t even notice them until we were leaving  the green sauce was great   - good drinks  they have lots of mezcal  Meh  I don t see a need to go back.

Meh  I m disappointed. We loved Enoteca  but were excited to try a new concept here.  While the decor was nice and the service was fairly good  the food was pretty lousy. I think the only dish I enjoyed was the queso fundido  who doesn t like melted cheese though    The octopus was served chopped up in a cold sauce that had a funky flavor. It wasn t necessarily bad  but didn t taste great.  The pork had that musky pig flavor you get sometimes when they either didn t cook it property and or didnt marinate season it enough. Was okay  but not worth the almost  70 it cost.  The chips were served as tostadas so you have to break them up yourself to dip them. Not a big deal  but just sort of weird.  Hope they can improve it  but for now I won t be back anytime soon.  Also agree with the other review regarding servers trying to pick up dishes before we were done. You need to ask customers if they are through before you pick up plates.
I was pleasantly surprise by the food. The food was such good quality with lots of flavor. I will be back to try something else on their menu. The decor was also  cute and fit the ambiance very well.

Without question  the worst service I have ever had in any restaurant at any time anywhere in the world.   We arrived without a reservation and all the tables were full but the bar was almost empty with perhaps two people on one end of a long bar with many seats. We sat down and waited. And waited to be noticed. The bartender kept doing whatever she was doing  but never approached us to asked us if we wanted a drink. Finally  when she was close enough to talk to  I asked if we could order some drinks. She obliged  and the drinks arrived A few minutes later. we never received the menus for drinks or food  so I requested them. We figured out what we wanted fairly quickly  but the bartender never came back over to ask us if we were ready to order. Finally I told her when she was close again  that we were ready to order some food. She took the order. The food arrive in not too long of a time  brought by someone from the kitchen.  The food was decent  not necessarily stellar. The bar started to fill up a little bit more. Two women that sat next to us who had the same problem with the service  waiting to order drinks  waiting to order food. Wow. Finally  I got the bartenders attention again to request a check  which arrived incorrectly. I think it was someone else s check. We then got ours and waited to get the final bill to sign. I left only a 10  tip which is half of what I normally do. The bartender didn t deserve that but  people still have to eat  right   So  it really doesn t matter the quality of the food at this point because the service was so unenjoyable  the food could not compensate for that.
Great food and service  We had guacamole   Mahi tacos and steak tacos. Highly recommend all  Great atmosphere and staff

ReAly good flavor of food lots of mezcal options the ceviche cenizo was really good had a mole sauce not spicy at all. We had the puerco de Chamorro with mole sauce on top was very savory filling of flavor . Could of been cooked longer  it did not fall of bone was a little tough.otherwise

I m giving Chapulin 5 stars for food and service. Both me and my friend felt the ambiance didn t match the food  we felt it could be more elevated without being overly pretentious. With that said  our food was really delicious   We went for Austin restaurant week. I had the Yellow Fin Tuna Tostada as my appetizer  4 5   the Milanesa De Pollo Y Pasta for my entree  5 5  waitress also recommended    and the Chocolate Cake with Fig Ice Cream for dessert  4 5 . The service was amazing  5 5  and our waitress was helpful with drink suggestions and food suggestions. A manager came by to make sure we were enjoying our meal. I will say that the portions were medium to large. I have enough Milanesa De Pollo for two additional meals. I noted mixed reviews for this restaurant prior to our dinner  but glad we selected this restaurant for restaurant week.  I would love to go back for Happy Hour small plates. I prefer authentic Mexican cuisine and feel this restaurant is a great addition to the neighborhood.

What a disappointment  The menu looks very inventive and creative  everything looks to be authentically Oaxacan. However  we found a food to be totally bland which is the complete opposite of what this type of cuisine should be. Everything felt like it was missing salt or acid. And absolutely  insanely ridiculously overpriced for the quality of food. Both of our meats were overdone and tough. We went to get tacos from the local taco truck after our meal. A shame because the menu shows real promise and the interior is so cute

Great service  vibe and ambition.... You can tell this place is new and working things out. Happy to pay for great food but this was not good whatsoever    Just really bland food. I Just went tonight.... Not sure if the chef is tasting what is going out  Maybe it was just an off night  All food at our table was universally unseasoned and inconsistently cooked. Fundamentals were missing  and flavors were portio sizes need reevaluating. Chorizo was overcooked. The tortillas were meant to be crispy and they were soggy.   We had 4 drinks and one was great  one tasted like rubbing alcohol. I suppose that is my fault for ordering vodka at a mezcal house. Reminded me of everclear jungle juice from college.  Maybe this place is just inconsistent and others are seeing things we didn t  All I know is  chef and bartenders need to know  Salt matters  And this place had little  Server was great  manager offered to comp the meal  asked for feedback  which we politely declined.   Hopefully back of house will improve.  Lots of respect for a business trying to get up on their feet  hope they can turn it around ... Hope to be back with a refined menu  and same high quality service.
OK. Fist ask yourself did S. Congress REALLY need yet another TexMexish eatery   And did it ever need  21 taco s   Me thinks not

I loved Enoteca  and I had hoped that this place would be more on par with my experiences there  but I would rate it as  okay.  It was a bit overpriced  but I did taste some delicious Mezcal  was impressed at the size of the ceviche  and my partner enjoyed his carne guisada tacos.
Best mole in town  top 5 margaritas  what else do you want  Stop being so unreasonable  No  I m totally calm  you re the one getting worked up  Just go there already
Food and service was wonderful. We liked the new festive ambiance. Can t wait to go back

Chapulin Cantina has beautiful  vibrant  authentic decor inside  great food  and friendly staff. My favorites were the pork mole and crispy rice balls. And it is located in the fun and fabulous South Congress  so bonus there.

Had been looking forward to trying this place but left disappointed. Based on these reviews it seems like I m not the only one who found the food extremely bland. We ordered several margaritas and they were not great. They tasted like sweet and sour with zero tequila. Guacamole was shockingly bad with no lime juice or seasoning whatsoever. We didn t even finish it  left after appetizers and decided to go elsewhere for entrees. Sadly I wont be back.
Food was cold and flavorless.really over priced for what they serve  seemed like our server was in a hurry and kept taking things away while we were still working on it .

We had a wonderful experience   Love love love the food     We had tlayudas and reminded us of our last trip to Puerto Escondido in Oaxaca    Cocktails Oh my  We had el chavo   Mezcal cocktail    Salsas were spicy and service was Amazing
